story:
Introduction

Eliza Christie is the leader of an underground militia hellbent on avenging her father’s murder. Braden Pierce is a gifted syndicate enforcer who will do whatever it takes to execute an order. And Gavin Hassell is a young narcissistic private investigator who’s tired of following rules and not getting the recognition he deserves. The three outlaws become the stuff of legend while the city becomes their battleground. And in their wake, they leave a long list of bodies, a sunken cruise ship, and a half demolished police department. These are the Three Kings of Ybor.

Romanticist author Rock Kitaro learned the hard way that striving as an independent writer isn't easy. With the advent of e-books making it simple for just about any writer to publish their work, the market has become flooded with new books and is more competitive than ever. With a false sense of confidence, he thought he could go it alone to make his flavor of fiction books popular. Over the past summer, he put up $2,000 of his own money in book promotion and production. While anyone should be impressed with Mr. Kitaro’s conviction by putting his own money at stake, what’s even more impressive is his 180 degree turn towards humility; he realizes that to make his mark in the publishing world, he needs help.

He launched his Indiegogo campaign to invite fiction fans and book readers of every stripe to embark on a brand new journey that has the potential to grow into a franchise comparable to “The Hunger Games”. The characters, the subplots, the action and adventure were all written by Rock with two goals; enchant readers who turn every page and dazzle movie audiences who could very well see the Kings of Ybor on the big screen one day.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Pitch

The Three Kings of Ybor is an intense thriller that shows how three young outlaws grow into the stuff of legends comparable to Jesse James and John Dillinger. However,  instead of slinging guns they're slinging blades and they're the best the world has to offer.

Unlike most authors whose studies focused solely on English Literature, I have graduated with a degree in film making. This is just one of the factors that gives me an edge over my competition. I know how producers and filmmakers think because I went to a film school. Right now there is an untapped market open for an epic new organized crime saga with an element of vigilantism.

Picture a more structured and influential organized crime alliance from "The Dark Knight" and the futuristic law enforcement tactics of "Ghost in the Shell" and you're coming close to it. The Three Kings of Ybor stories involves the heavy usage of advanced computer technology, cyber security tactics, cybernetic prosthetics and black market performance enhancers.

In the year 2206, after the United States becomes the American Empire and the northern hemisphere has frozen over due to nuclear warfare, the city of Tampa Bay plays host to the most powerful criminal organization in the world. The man widely believed to be the Godfather is Isaac Pierce, the billionaire CEO of a highly respected conglomerate. The first detective who came close to proving his alleged involvement was Eliza Christie's father.

Eliza is a little bit different from pious heroines like Katniss of "The Hunger Games" or Beatrice Prior of "Divergent." Eliza Christie's not helpless or lost trying to find herself and save the world. She has always been a tyrannical leader of the pack ever since grade school, imposing her will on others and going overboard when it comes to retaliation. Eliza tries to do the right thing...but sometimes the right thing can get in the way of revenge.

But at the spiteful age of fifteen, a traumatizing incident took place that changed her life forever. Her father, an honest detective and a rare breed from a corrupt department, sat with his back against the trophy case. In his dying breath he kept mumbling the name of the young killer standing before him with a blood soaked katana in hand. That name was Braden Pierce, the Godfather’s favorite nephew.

This was the night that set the "Three Kings of Ybor" in motion.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How You Can Help

You can help by donating as much as you like and can afford to help me raise $6,000. ALSO!!! If you're not financially able to help, but believe in this project as much as I do, I encourage you to share the link to this page to your friends, family and anyone you know who's in a position to donate. To me, that's just as valuable.

The funds raised through this Crowdfunding project will go to pay for:

  • First edition print runs of both hardcover and paperback books
  • Legal and copyright fees
  • E-book and Kindle formatting
  • Digital and physical distribution
  • Design costs
  • Strategic marketing
  • Production of audiobook (if stretch goal of $10,000 is raised)

By Strategic Marketing, I plan to advertise with Goodreads, Google Adsense, PR Web, Twitter, Linkedin and Facebook.

I plan to attack printing two ways. The first is with Createspace, which is a print on demand service in which I’ve already paid for 10 ISBNs needed to publishing. While I submit seven volumes to Createspace, I plan to release the complete set, all seven volumes as one book to Infinity Publishing. 

With Infinity Publishing, there’s a package priced at $1,675 that would release the complete novel and include extended global distribution to more than 50,000 book retailers through distribution partners Baker & Taylor, Ingram, Audible, iTunes and 31 online retailers; editorial consultation with an experienced book editor; marketing consultation with a marketing expert; and the development of a professionally written press release to announce the availability of the book.

The novels I want to promote are two action-packed thrillers focusing on organized crime and the legendary outlaws known as the “Three Kings of Ybor”.

The first novel is already written and all seven volumes are available via Amazon Kindle. It lays the foundation on how three young killers begin their blood-soaked journeys to rise into the stuff of legends. Over the summer of 2014, I’ve already spent $2,000 of my own money to promote it through press releases and facebook advertisement with good results.

The following picture was a campaign that I ran for just a single week on Facebook.com. As you can see, over 2,000 people have clicked on my ad to find out about the book, and of those 2,000, my audience is mostly young adults in their mid-to-young-twenties.


The second novel, “The Pierce Syndicate” is a work still in progress. A 90-Page outline is already written and I’m already five chapters into it. This story is set three years after the tragic events of the first novel. While the first book focuses on Eliza Christie and August the 18th, the second focuses on Braden Pierce’s ascent through the ranks of the syndicate. It’s a dangerous brand of politics to be involved with, and the situation becomes more treacherous when your enemy is your own flesh and blood.

Break it down for folks in more detail:
  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Seven Volumes of "The Three Kings of Ybor"

Caution! Spoiler Alert




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Three Kings of Ybor: Volume 1: Eliza Christie's Vendetta

More about this product
In 2206, when the city has become a paradise for organized crime and the CEO of the famous Pierce Corporation is also the alleged kingpin of a dangerous syndicate, three ambitious outlaws become stuff of legends as they go to great lengths to destroy each other. In Volume 1, on the wake of her father's murder, spiteful and vindictive Eliza Christie stalks the streets in search for answers and finds an unlikely ally in a narcissistic mercenary.

The Three Kings of Ybor: Volume 2 - The Wolves of the Syndicate

More about this product
As Eliza Christie continues down her path of vengeance, she encounters juxtaposition in two forms of guidance. One comes in the form of a non-violent philosophy that teaches honesty and self-acceptance. The other is in the deadly martial art of ninjitsu. Four years later, we find out that the Pierce Syndicate has only continued to grow in strength and influence. We’re introduced to the men who are responsible for that growth, namely a prodigy assassin who shows he’s willing to do whatever it takes to complete an assignment.

The Three Kings of Ybor: Volume 3: A Reunion of Beasts

More about this product
Welcome to Ybor, the American Empire’s new sin city! In the district were every night’s a celebration and every street’s a spectacle, violence erupts when Eliza Christie finally confronts her father’s murderer after four years of being away. Inspired by her beauty and bravery, gifted computer hacker Robby McCloud befriends her with the idea of making it an interesting first year of college. Things get a little too interesting, however, when Eliza reveals a plan to bring about the downfall of the Pierce Syndicate.

The Three Kings of Ybor: August the 18th

More about this product

Comprised of ex-military and off-duty officers who have lost all faith in the constitution, every man of August the 18th has lost a loved one to the fangs of the Pierce Syndicate. With the cutthroat Eliza Christie serving as commander, August the 18th finally takes center stage to cause disruption and destruction in the intricate world of organized crime. This of course, starts with raiding a notorious casino, exposing a corrupt superintendent and rescuing a political prisoner from a Haitian hit squad.

The Three Kings of Ybor: The Kennedy St. Massacre

More about this product
In the heart of the American Empire’s largest metropolis, August the 18th has waged guerrilla warfare against the most dangerous criminal organization in the world, the Pierce Syndicate. Billionaire business magnate Isaac Pierce has no choice but to retaliate, calling an emergency meeting of his respected warlords, the Board of Directors.

Just to name a few, Renji Amaruto is the ruthless heir to the largest yakuza group in Japan. Benjamin Garrett is the world’s youngest billionaire who would order a raid on an entire village to just to kill a single penny-stealing theif. Michael Helms is the all-smiling chairman of the notorious Black Creek Security firm with an unnatural affinity for explosives. And then there’s David Pierce…Isaac’s last surviving son. With an insatiable greed to expand and conquer, David won’t let anyone halt his ascension as the next head of the syndicate. Even if that person happens to be his own flesh and blood.

The Three Kings of Ybor: Beware of Romanticists

More about this product
"Revenge is overrated when your target is everyone"

Eliza Christie and August the 18th have set out to match blood for blood in a brutal war of attrition against the notorious Pierce Syndicate. The situation goes from brutal to tragic when the conflict ends up taking the lives of over thirty Tampa police officers.

The Three Kings of Ybor: The Ides of March

More about this product
Sometimes when you hear screams during a storm… the screams are real.

It’s been nearly six months since Eliza Christie created the vigilant August the 18th to combat the American Empire’s most powerful mob. She’s seen her share of triumph and glory…but it cost the lives of over a dozen ex-military vets who have elected to put their lives in her hands. The time has come to end the bloody war once and for all.


    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    What I Can Give Back!!!

    $10 – Aside from a heartfelt thank you, you’ll receive a detailed character biography from The Three Kings of Ybor storyline. Learn about the main character’s backgrounds to find out why anyone would be crazy enough to involve themselves with the mob.

    $25 – By donating $25 you’re showing that you believe in this project. As way of saying thanks, I want to make you a part of it. When this book sells millions of copies and the characters shine on the big screen, be able to tell your children and grandchildren that you came up with one of the names in my book. It doesn’t matter how outlandish the name is, I’ll find a way to make it work.ALSO, WHEN YOU DONATE... be sure to give me the name you want in the comment section that pops up. You can make it private so only I can see if you like.

    Example. “What’s the name of the victim?”

    “Says on his dogtag that his name was Jackrabbit McFlagglesflum.”

    “Give me that.”

    “Haha, I’m serious. That’s what it says.”

    “What kind of mother…as if his last name wasn’t already a f****** sin.”

    $50 – Fifty Dollars buys you a free signed copy of the first book I’ve ever had printed. You’ll also receive a character biography, and your choice to submit a name.

    $100 – You’re too much! I’ll personally write you an email expressing my gratitude/ It’ll be exaggerating and endearing, I assure you. On top of that, you’ll get all of the above and a free signed copy of “The Ghost of Cloud Beaudry”. I realize that this will arrive at your door after Halloween, but it’s more so a mystery than a ghost story. The Ghost of Cloud Beaudry tells the story of a young attorney who uses his ability to interact with ghosts to solve mysteries. I’ve received excellent reviews, most agreeing that they couldn’t put it down. The best compliment to receive.

    $150 - * wipes tears * My email of gratitude will probably have you rolling with laughter, even though the emotions are real. In addition to sending you free printed copies of “The Three Kings of Ybor- Volumes 1-2,” I’ll send you all three of the “Ghost of Cloud Beaudry” series! And of course, I’ll not deny you for an opportunity to submit a name to become one of my characters.

    $250 - * stands breathless * For this extremely generous donation, I’ll send you all the seven volumes “Three Kings of Ybor Series.” This is the complete series.  You’ll also get a chance to submit a name for the upcoming novel.

    $500 or More –The Grand Package!!! All Seven Volumes of “The Three Kings of Ybor,” all three books of the “Ghost of Cloud Beaudry” series and a chance to have your name or created name submitted to be a key character in the upcoming “Pierce Syndicate” Novel.

    In addition to that, I’ll send you a signed printed original copy of the screenplay I wrote five years ago. Since 2009, I’ve evolved the story and given it more details, more emotion, more suspense. I thought it would be a great gesture to send you a printed copy that might one day be priceless as the original manuscript that started it all. Find out how much the characters have changed and witness the improvement first hand.

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks or challenges. For the rest of this year, I've been blessed with the opportunity to take a week off every month for the rest of the year from my two jobs. During those weeks, I plan to continue working on the production of "The Pierce Syndicate" and work on making "The Three Kings of Ybor" available for print.

    I've been ask, "Rock. What are you going to do on your time off? Where are you going to go."

    And of course, I get the puzzled looks when I answer that I'm going to be in a whole nother world. Yes, writing my stories take me away from this world and I submerse myself into my characters shoes. I see what they see. Feel what they feel. I even celebrate their birthdays. For instance, Eliza's Christie's birthday is December 17th. So I always feel good on that day.
    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Other Ways You Can Help

    As I previously mentioned, you don't have to give any money if you're not in a financial position to donate. The fact that you've read this far is enough to bring a smile to my face. But if you have made it this far, and believe in how amazing this project is, I implore you to share this campaign with your friends, employees, co-workers, or your bosses. It's excellent water cooler talk. And you'll be able to tell them that you saw this project before it appeared on the big screen.

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who do not already know me, my name is Chaim Berkowitz also known as DoLo and I am a NYC artist currently residing in Los Angeles. I write for many different companies and websites and self published a book back in 2011 called Such Is Life. Before moving out to LA I have been a part of many art shows in NYC and started my own streetwear brand about a year ago. 

This campaign is to raise money for me to go to a secret event, which is taking place on Catalina Island off the coast of California. I recently by chance found out about the mysterious event and my goal is to sneak in and document the whole 3 day event for an article that will be submitted to many large publications. This is a secret event being held by a secret LA society (which is, from what I understand, made up of high profile artists, athletes, and business owners) and the only reason I know about it is because I happened to cross paths with a member over 4th of July weekend. He didn't say much at first but after a few drinks I found out everything I need to know to get there and get in.

I don't know how many people get an opportunity like this without having to go through the whole BS of becoming part of a secret society but to me this is a once in a life time opportunity that I HAVE to cash in on. I must go to this event and take this adventure. From what I was told, these are 3 days that are not to be missed and in my opinion must be documented.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking for at total of at the very least $500 to be used as such:

  • $250 for the private event ferry there and back.
  • $100 for any transportation needed around the Island
  • $150 for food for all three days
  • After that everything is additional so will go towards a grander experience. I'm sure extra funds will be needed but $500 is the bare minimum needed for me to make this happen.
  • Check out the perks section to be part of this adventure and get an insiders look at this event from my eye.

The Impact

This is a very rare opportunity to get an inside look at one of the secret societies of LA and see what goes on at their private and secret events. There is a strong chance that this is a once in a life time opportunity and only with your help will I get to experience a world seen by few and report back. 

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks and challenges of this adventure:

  • Being found out as an outsider and dealing with the consequences.
  • Keeping a low profile while documenting all three days.
  • Working my way in to blend in and look the part.
  • Risk my life to bring back evidence of the event/society.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, thats fine! But please help any way you can in the following ways:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the campaign!
  • Borrow money to help make this adventure happen!

story:
Short Summary

I write the book in which through destinies of ordinary people the history of Russia for the last 100 years is shown. This history is full of both nice fulfillments, and disgusting acts. There the powerful industry was created and violent collectivization is carried out. The advanced science, the educational system, best in the world, is created and rigid dictatorship of communist party is established. The fascism is crushed and millions of citizens are repressed. In Russia there was a space flight of Gagarin and trial of Sinyavsky – Daniel.

Communist regime failed, but it is impossible to tell that the country changed to the best. The simple person feels bad in modern Russia. The Supreme power often makes inadequate actions. The government is penetrated by corruption. Law enforcement agencies often violate the law.

It is possible to be proud of history of Russia and it is possible to be ashamed. Hundreds of books are written on this subject. But for the first time the History of Russia will be presented in the comic form. Let's laugh together. We will laugh over Lenin-Stalin's party and over a modern political regime. And they will shrivel and will fall into oblivion.

What We Need & What You Get

So far I wrote a half of the book. Unfortunately it is necessary to earn a living somehow. If I had money for operating costs, I for half a year would add the book. Besides I write in Russian, and it would be desirable that the book read and in other countries. It is necessary to pay for the translation at least into English. And the new laptop is necessary, old already on the last legs. Help me, and we together will laugh over this political regime, and we still will see how it will leave.

I write well. My comic stories were published in weekly newspapers and magazines. In 2009 I won literary tender for the best extremely topical novel. The book was published in EKSMO publishing house, Moscow.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

1. Tell your friends in social networks about our campaign..

2. Use the Indiegogo share tools

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo

story:
My best friend Kelly and I have been planning on backpacking around Europe for 3 months in the summer of 2015 after we graduate college for years now- and it's less than a year away now and I could really use some help funding it. We're both working full time and have been saving for a while now, but this is a lot of money to save up working minimum wage jobs.

This is our last hurrah before joining The Real World, and we're trying to get in as much as we can before we're anchored down by jobs, leases, paying back student loans, and everything that comes with being a college graduate.

This trip is going to be an incredible and life changing experience, something that we will remember for the rest of our lives, and something that will help us grow as people and change our lives! We're both planning on trying to write journals and blog posts about our experiences, and even make video blogs to share with the world!

If you are capable of sparing just a few dollars or want to help me out, I would appreciate it so much, I can't even express my gratitude. Any amount would help- even $5 could buy food for a day while we're over there, and $20 could pay for a place to sleep at night.

Any donations would be going towards lodging and food while we're in Europe and my plane ticket and rail pass.

All together, this trip is going to cost about $6000 or $7000 and any assistance would be amazing.

I know there are obviously a million other causes out there that are so much more important than this, and it seems trivial to be asking for money to travel the world, I recognize that and I agree wholeheartedly- this is immensely unimportant in the scheme of things, But if you have any money to spare and feel like this is worth a dollar or two, it would really help my dreams come true, and I don't think there's any harm in putting this out there, even if no one donates.

Thank you so much for even reading!

story:
What I have going on here is a campaign for my next big goal in regards to getting my books into the hands of readers (where all books belong).

This is my virtual shout-out to all fellow creative creatures, lovers of fantasy, and supporters of Indie Writers, in regards to an ambitious little project which will hopefully see the funds raised for me to print out my next batch of paperback books, and hire a booth at the Gold Coast Supanova Convention, this coming April.

Dragon Calling is my fantasy series which follows the adventures of a young dragon in his quest to find the others of his kind. Of course, the story is much more involved than that, and if you are curious, you can find out more on my website: here.

The series is planned for five books in total, the first two of which are currently published and available at all major online retailers (KIN SEEKER, and THE BEACON THRONES), both in paperback and eBook formats.

Though the target audience is primarily upper Middle Graders (kids aged 10+), the story can be enjoyed by older readers, too. Especially those who love dragons.

As well as being the author, I am also the illustrator, and do all my own character designs, book covers, maps, and comics.

For those who don't know, Supanova is Australia's largest pop-culture expo, appearing annually in several cities across the states, including the Gold Coast (where I live).

A mega hive of all things geek/ game/ sci-fi/ and fantasy, Supanova is an amazingly crazy and awesomely fun experience. Famous actors, writers and artists from around the world come to meet their fans, and stalls containing all manner of pop-culture extravaganza are set up for attendees to splurge on.

It is the perfect place to showcase my Dragon Calling series. I love the Supanova experience, and know how many fantasy-lovers swarm to events like this (myself included). Dragon Calling will shine at such an expo, even in a little booth. It is the best chance for me to meet my target audience personally, and give my books some epic exposure.

Supanova attracts thousands of visitors every year. Close to 30,000 people passed through the doors of the Gold Coast Supanova in 2014. And the event just gets bigger and more popular by the year!

I would love to have a fully stocked booth at this year's Gold Coast Supanova! And you, my fellow creative souls, both friend and stranger alike, can help make it a reality.

Oh, right. Of course! I'm Naomi Eccles-Smith, Australian author/ illustrator currently living on the Gold Coast.

I am a creative extraordinaire, warrior princess, dragon-lover, anime enthusiast, partisan of fantastical things, and most assuredly and proudly peculiar.

The Dragon Calling series has been a passionate project of mine for over a decade, and it is my dream and ambition to become fully self-sufficient through my writing and illustration endeavours.

This fantastic campaign will help create another stepping stone towards achieving that dream.

My goal for this campaign is to raise $5000. That amount will cover the costs for stock (printing enough books so that I don't run out half-way through the expo), the cost of hiring a Booth, public liability insurance, and extras such as shipping fees, safety vests (a Supanova requirement during the bump-in and bump-out times), food and other seemingly insignificant, but necessary additions.

Every dollar counts, Seriously, even $1 will make a difference, and will be deeply appreciated. Any amount that you wonderful supporters are able to put towards my goal, will add to the stepping stones of success.

This is something I've had on my dream list for a long time. A booth at a Supanova event! I'd love to see it come to pass.

All of the money raised through this campaign will go straight to the Supanova fund, so sadly I can't offer any substantial perks, like signed paperback copies of the books (all the paperbacks will be needed for the expo).

But I will offer something, for those who'd like some small freebies in return for donations given.

$10 Donation = digital wallpaper of Dragon Calling characters


$20 Donation = eBook of the first book, KIN SEEKER + wallpaper


$35 Donation = eBook of KIN SEEKER + eBook of BEACON THRONES + wallpaper


$50 Donation = both eBooks + wallpaper + all 3 bookmarks


$80 Donation = both eBooks + wallpaper + bookmarks + second digital wallpaper


$100 Donation = eBooks + wallpapers + bookmarks + A2 posters


Of course, it's possible to just donate funds toward the print run and booth hire, and not worry about the perks, if you so choose (eg. if you want to help out but eBooks or random bookmarks isn't really your thing), Entirely up to you. :)

While $5000 is the ultimate goal which will fully fund my venture, whatever the final amount comes to will help. If the goal isn't reached, the donations will still be put towards the print run and booth hire. It just means that whatever amount still stands I will have to procure by another means (goblin-hunting perhaps).

But every $1 put towards this project will make a difference.

Again, if you would like to help out, but don't want any of the freebies offered, simply donate whatever amount you wish, and don't click on any perk options.

Well, you should know that I really, REALLY appreciate your support! A little goes a long way, if a lot of people chip in.

If you want to help out aside from donations, spread the word! The more people know about this campaign, the better the chances it will succeed. Indiegogo has 'share' tools to help spread the word about people's campaigns, so if you're share-happy, then share away! ;)

You don't even have to buff up the campaign itself. Just telling people about my books and website will bring me many happy rainbows.

Also, if this endeavour exceeds my expectations and I manage to SURPASS my goal, the extra funds will go towards getting the fully-illustrated KIN SEEKER COMPANION GUIDE, formatted and printed in paperback. The Guide is full of interesting facts on creatures, places, and legends from the world of Dragon Calling, which are briefly glimpsed or hinted at in the book, KIN SEEKER. In addition, the guide will also contain the four PROLOGUE COMICS, which you can read for free online right here! (although I recommend you read KIN SEEKER first, because the comics contain spoilers).

So, here we go. Wish me luck!

If you have questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

story:
我們是《漸近線》，一本網羅世界各地最優秀文學作品的國際雜誌。

免費閱讀網址：www.asymptotejournal.com

文學世界的多元活力正逐漸消失，英語開始統治訊息傳遞，我們為你帶來更多不一樣的聲音：我們講述更多的語言，我們與全世界的對話。

我們來自27個國家的70位成員通過線上接力，為讀者搜尋並呈現來自世界各地精彩的文學作品，另外還有美術、音頻與影像——都可免費瀏覽。

  1. 在每一期雜誌中，我們都為大家帶來當代作家和譯者首次出版的優秀作品。去年，我們刊登了諾貝爾文學獎得主約翰·馬克斯維爾·庫切和赫塔·米勒的作品，還有2014年新加坡文學獎得主Amanda Lee Koe和2013年歐盟文學獎得主Faruk Šehić的作品。從台湾，我們呈現了羅福全傳記文學《榮町少年走天下》228事件的片段，黃麗群的短篇小說《入夢者》，來自邱妙津《蒙馬特遺書》的書評。從香港，我們呈現了王良和的詩歌《甜椒》以及李維怡的《遊園》。我們也呈現了兩位新加坡文化奖得主英培安與韓勞達的戲劇，以及政治家陳碩茂的採訪。我們還與眾多著名作家和藝術家進行了訪談，殘雪、奈良美智的訪問都以她們的母語進行，我們為了方便讀者閱讀將其翻譯為英文。在漸近線成立的四年中，我們一共為大家呈現了來自95個國家、67種語言的小說、散文、詩歌、戲劇、評論和訪談。

聯結網址：

20位40歲以下最受期待的華文小說家

台湾文學特輯（藝術作品由侯俊明提供）

與《現在詩》編輯夏宇、鴻鴻、零雨、阿翁、曾淑美的專訪

陳建忠《台灣製造的文學品味──2011年的台灣小說》

黃春明《有一隻懷錶》短篇小說

楊牧的現代詩

饒加恩的影像藝術作品

香港文學雜誌《字花》與漸近線的共同合作


「語言沒有中心點，《漸近線》也一樣：就像翻譯本身，這是一張流動的巨網，向所有方向伸展開來，變化、收縮、再次伸展，然后把文本和讀者帶到一起，透過不可思議的神奇聯繫。」

——喬納森·利特爾，龔古爾文學獎得主

【我們去年做了什麼】

去年，我們在美國眾籌網站Indiegogo上共募得20184美元。我們將這些心意轉換為實際行動，為大家帶來了：

❈  一幅文學地圖，可以通過點擊對應的國家，來搜尋往期作品。

❈ 每日博客，提供最新全球文學資訊。

❈  「無限趨近」（Close Approximations）——我們為新生代譯者舉辦的翻譯大賽，由資深翻譯家艾略特·溫伯格（墨西哥劇作家帕斯及中國詩人北島作品英譯者）及葛浩文（諾貝爾文學獎得主莫言作品英譯者，《漸近線》特約編輯之一）分別負責詩歌組與小說組評審。獎金共計3000美元。

❈  我們在四大洲舉辦了14場文學活動（首次將我們的全球對話帶到了波士頓、哥本哈根、香港、悉尼、上海和薩格勒布）。

過去的一年精彩紛呈，盡管未來還有許多地方需要花銷，我們依舊會為廣大讀者提供免費無廣告的無限次閱讀。

問：《漸近線》團隊中有哪些人？

答：《漸近線》的員工來自全球各地：葛浩文（諾貝爾獎獲得者莫言的作品翻譯）和李耀龍（《漸近線》主編，新加坡作家、翻譯，常居台灣）。同樣還有我們的戲劇編輯——奧比獎獲得者卡裡達·斯維奇，出生於美國的一個四國血統家庭：古巴、阿根廷、西班牙和克羅地亞；以及我們在英國的特約編輯阿梅爾·侯賽因：巴基斯坦血統，廣受歡迎的短篇小說家。

來自世界各地的專業編輯組成了一張牢不可摧的網，讓我們與眾不同：在眾多致力於世界文學的刊物中，唯有我們的編輯團隊遍布世界各地每一個角落。

答：我們積極地將優秀作品翻譯成英語以外的語言。我們的團隊成員和特約譯者已經協力實現了這個目標——許多作品都被譯為不同的語言，尤其是西班牙語和中文。比如最近，響應墨西哥人對暴政的抗爭和對正義的呼籲，我們登載了戴維·赫塔的詩歌《Ayotzinapa》及其20種語言的譯本——附帶譯者的朗誦閱聽，並邀請到Valeria Luiselli為這首詩和此次事件撰文。另外值得一提的是，我們在西班牙和中國的社交網絡平台已經擁有了相當數量的讀者，通過這些平台，我們能更有效地將雜誌的內容和理念傳達給兩國的讀者。我們的目標是將每一篇登載在《漸近線》的作品翻譯成英語以外的作品。

在每一期雜誌中，我們都為大家帶來當代作家和譯者首次出版的優秀作品。去年，我們刊登了諾貝爾文學獎得主約翰·馬克斯維爾·庫切和赫塔·米勒的作品，還有2014年新加坡文學獎得主Amanda Lee Koe和2013年歐盟文學獎得主Faruk Šehić的作品。從台湾，我們呈現了羅福全傳記文學《榮町少年走天下》228事件的片段，黃麗群的短篇小說《入夢者》，來自邱妙津《蒙馬特遺書》的書評。從香港，我們呈現了王良和的詩歌《甜椒》以及李維怡的《遊園》。我們也呈現了兩位新加坡文化奖得主英培安與韓勞達的戲劇，以及政治家陳碩茂的採訪。我們還與眾多著名作家和藝術家進行了訪談，殘雪、奈良美智的訪問都以她們的母語進行，我們為了方便讀者閱讀將其翻譯為英文。在漸近線成立的四年中，我們一共為大家呈現了來自95個國家、67種語言的小說、散文、詩歌、戲劇、評論和訪談。

在過去的這一年裡，我們又招募了來自世界各地的編輯：比利時、波斯尼亞、黑塞哥維那、中國、古巴、丹麥、厄瓜多爾、印尼、墨西哥、羅馬尼亞、新加坡、泰國和越南。
來自世界各地的專業編輯組成了一張牢不可摧的網，讓我們與眾不同：在眾多致力於世界文學的刊物中，唯有我們的編輯團隊遍布世界各地每一個角落。











問：你們的雜誌似乎主要是以英語為載體的，那你們打算如何突破當今社會以英語為中心的訊息潮流呢？
答：我們積極地將優秀作品翻譯成英語以外的語言。我們的團隊成員和特約譯者已經協力實現了這個目標——許多作品都被譯為不同的語言，尤其是西班牙語和中文。比如最近，響應墨西哥人對暴政的抗爭和對正義的呼籲，我們登載了戴維·赫塔的詩歌《Ayotzinapa》及其20種語言的譯本——附帶譯者的朗誦閱聽，並邀請到Valeria Luiselli為這首詩和此次事件撰文。另外值得一提的是，我們在西班牙和中國的社交網絡平台已經擁有了相當數量的讀者，通過這些平台，我們能更有效地將雜誌的內容和理念傳達給兩國的讀者。我們的目標是將每一篇登載在《漸近線》的作品翻譯成英語以外的作品。 






「《漸近線》並不是翻譯雜誌中為數不多的例子，而是絕無僅有的範例。」
——邁克爾·斯泰因，Literalab
問：我非常支持你們的雜誌！我可以做些什麼幫助你們呢？
答：我們目前最需要的幫助是支持這個募款計畫，並捐款援助。請在右方欄位選擇你要捐助的金額或者選擇CONTRIBUTE NOW並填上你要捐出的金額。 可接受VISA、PAYPAL的支付方式。或者你也可以提供下列的協助：
1. 將這個頁面分享給你的家人和朋友，告訴他們為什麼這個籌款項目對你來說很重要！
2. 關注我們的臉書， 豆瓣和微博，並向志同道合的朋友們介紹我們和此次籌款項目！
我們的微信帳號：asymptotejournal





謝謝你！
對於你的支持和幫助，我們感激不盡。你的捐款將成為我們2015年和未來發展的基石，我們將用所募款項為你帶來更精彩的刊物。


“Asymptote的首頁那兩個既對稱又有變化的大圓圈，就像一副潛望鏡，勾引我們在文學慾海裡窺探向神秘的異域。＂－侯俊明

"Asymptote 重心燃起讀者對於「比較文學」的熱望，讓歌德嚮往的「世界文學」得以復活。"
－紀大偉
"Asymptote是一艘大船，來自世界各地的作家在船裡或臥或坐，一起沾英文的醬汁，共同分享食用各式精緻的文學語言。如果你僅僅只是遊客也沒關係，Asymptote隨時都會靠岸讓你上船，用舒服的海浪節奏邀你來參觀。"－葉覓覓
"Asymptote是將文學萬花筒旋轉對焦的手。"－張淑英








奈良美智為我們慶祝四週年所繪製的作品。

Welcome

Hello everyone! Thank you for taking the time to check out our project. We hope that you are able to enjoy our project as it comes to life one donation at a time. Crystal Falk, established author of Sophia's Broken Crayons: A Children's Book about Surrogacy and Kim Roman first time author, Air Force Veteran and owner of Square Foot Garden 4 U join together for this children's book. This Daughter-in-law/Mother-in-law team is excited to bring the world a touching story to help children understand loss and the beauty that can come after it in the story "The Rainbow after the Storm." 


What is a Rainbow Baby?

"A rainbow baby is a baby who is born after the mother has experienced a miscarriage, stillbirth or infant loss. 

The thought is, the loss is like a storm and the baby who follows is like the rainbow. After a storm, a rainbow filled with hope may appear. Although there are still dark clouds above, there is hope and joy that follows the storm."


Short Summary

The Rainbow After the Storm is a touching story about a baby bird and his family. One day while his mother is out looking for food, a fierce storm rolls through. Alone and scared, his mother soon returns to the nest and comforts him. This seems the perfect time for her to tell the story of the little sister he never met and a beautiful hope that sometimes follows a storm.

Sketch of Momma Bird comforting Baby Bird in the storm

Sketch of the loss of their Little Baby Bird

We’ve finished writing the story and had it reviewed by a mental health care professional. Now this is where you come in . . .  Kim and I are raising money to have the book professionally edited and illustrated so that we can self publish to keep the cost of the book at a reasonable price even on outlets like Amazon and Barnes & Noble. This will allow more people to have access to it. Without your help, this book will only be a story.



What We Need 

    • The funding from this campaign will be used to hire a professional children's book illustrator who will produce 23 colored pages as well as the front and back cover. 
    • If we reach some of our stretch goals, we will also hire professional translators to enable this book to be read internationally.

The Impact

This is much more than a story, an explanation, words on a page, or drawings in a book. This book will help teach children about loss and the storms that come our way in life as well as the beauty that can follow. The children will also learn how they are special and how the ones before them are never forgotten. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support

  • Word of mouth of the campaign and book is always welcome and encouraged. One of the best ways to help support is using the Indiegogo share tools!

Stretch Goals

$850 (Kindle Version) - Reaching this stretch goal will allow us to have this book formatted for Kindle to be published and available on Amazon. 
$950 (Spanish Version) - Reaching this stretch goal will allow us to have this book professionally translated in Spanish to allow it to reach more families around the world. 
$1050 (German Version) - As with the previous stretch goal, reaching this goal will allow us to have this book professionally translated in German as well.
$1150 (French Version) - Once the Spanish and German Version goals have been achieved, and we reach this stretch goal, we will be able to have this book professionally translated to French.

story:
Have you been screwed by a greedy, greaseball lawyer? Do you still long to kill him? This may be your best/only chance.

I've written a screenplay, titled KILL ALL THE LAWYERS, in which a lot of lawyers get killed! WHA HAHAHAHA!

It's a dark, dazzling dramedy.

In my dreams, I see Johnny Depp and Lady Gaga in the lead roles, with Terry Gilliam directing.

The story starts with 365 lawyers being incinerated. After that, three more lawyers are killed, but not burned to death, by the arsonist.

Those dead lawyers can bear the names of the lawyers you hate. Any sleazy miscreant lawyer - perhaps an ex husband or wife? - who managed to screw you over can be killed off in my soon-to-be cinema classic

Or, YOU can kill as many lawyers as you want! There's a scene in the story where a person goes nuts and slaughters a whole office full of lawyers. That person can be YOU! Those lawyers can be your lawyers.

Minimum price - $1000 per lawyer, or $2000 to be the killer and name the lawyers you want to kill.

I'll email you the script, so you can see how and why your lawyer will be killed. Murders can be customized, although I'm sure you'll all want the slow, extremely painful and preferably humiliating fashion.

I'm trying to raise money to cover my living expenses while I transform the screenplay into a novel and simultaneously shop the script.

Obviously, I can't guarantee that the screen version will ever be produced but a book will be completed and sold as an ebook for $1. You can have as many ebooks as you desire.

Book will be available no later than December 23, 2013, just in time for Christmas. 


HUBBA HUBBA, boys and girls, let's slaughter those stinking swine already!

This is how the screenplay opens:

Scene 1           Disclaimer     

A lawyer walks into the camera’s view. He has some papers in his hands. He clears his throat and starts speaking

LAWYER

Before we can allow you watch this film we must take a number of legal precautions.

This is a work of fiction. It is a potentially dangerous piece of art. It is, in no way, meant to incite you, the viewer, to kill, or in any way harm, one or more lawyers.

By purchasing a ticket to watch this movie you have entered  into an implicit contract that indemnifies everyone who had a role in the production and/or distribution and/or promotion of the film against any legal action that may result from damages, physical or financial, that you, the viewer, may visit upon one or more lawyers, at any time in the future, at any location on this or any other planet.

Should you, the viewer, while watching the film, or at any time thereafter, feel a strong urge to run amok, slaughtering lawyers, you are strongly advised to seek professional help from a qualified mental health professional.

The preceding sentence is in no way to be construed as a libelous, actionable questioning of your present, past or future sanity.

Now, if you would be so kind as to raise your right hands, and repeat after me…

The lawyer fumbles his papers and drops them to the floor. The papers are all connected, like the old dot matrix printers used to use. The pile of papers is very long

LAWYER      

…we can get on with the show. Should you have any questions about the following contractual pledge, we advise you to leave the theater immediately and consult a lawyer

Shakespeare, comes out and shoots the lawyer in the face before saying

SHAKESPEARE

Fuckin’ lawyers. Alright, on with the show!

Scene 2           Young Pablo gets an idea

Young Pablo is in a juvenile detention facility, behind bars. He’s reading Henry VI and laughing. Camera comes in tight on the line, “First thing we do is KILL ALL THE LAWYERS.” Pablo laughs maniacally

Scene 3           Opening credits

Opening credits roll over the screen as a gang of lawyers rape Lady Justice

so, while i'm trying to figure out how to drive raffic to this campaign, and raise money, i'm going to proceed with the transformation and post my efforts here

Surely someone, somewhere has, at some point, attempted something similar to what I’m about to try, but here it goes, anyway. I’m going to “talk to you” in the story. And I’m going explain to you what I’ve done, and why I did it, after each chapter.

CHAPTER 1

Some FBI schmuck was staring at an NSA babe and thinking of a sexually deviant congressman he’d arrested six years earlier. The NSA babe was talking to another FBI schmuck, who was probably thinking of sexual deviance that had nothing to do with a congressman. “So, why did the Muslim terrorists burn 350 lawyers to death,” the girl asked the other FBI schmuck.

The congressman was yet another one of those upstanding middle class Americans who campaigned, vociferously and perpetually, for ‘family values’ - whatever the fuck that means these days - while secretly pondering how much elasticity there was in the Ten Commandments and all those Sunday morning sermons he’d managed to sit through since his childhood.

The FBI schmuck hadn’t been tipped off to the congressman’s perversions. The congressman was not under investigation when he got caught, literally, with his pants down at a high school football game. The congressman had simply lost his mind for a moment. He wasn’t even drunk. And he’d probably have gone on to a long career in politics, if not for the fact that the FBI schmuck saw him, out of the corner of his eye, as he was pulling his pud while staring out onto the field from a dark corner of the stadium on a Friday night.

The FBI schmuck didn’t even know the congressman was a congressman when he snuck up behind him and slapped the cuffs on him. The congressman had been pulling it hard for a couple minutes. He’d rounded third and was heading home when the FBI schmuck had grabbed him by the back of the neck (no, I am not guilty of mixing my metaphors because the football story is a true story and the baseball analogy is a metaphor, dumbass).

The congressman spilled his seed the second the FBI schmuck collared him. He was tugging with his right hand and splooged on his left hand. The FBI schmuck was unaware that the congressman’s left hand was covered in a prodigious amount of man chowder until their left hands made contact, as the cop reached around to pull the pervert’s hand behind his back. Once the cuffs were locked, the FBI schmuck examined his hand and HOLY FUCK was he disgusted. So disgusted that he kicked the cuffed congressman to the ground and started laying the boots to the pervert.

When the congressman pitifully cried out, “Stop! I am a United States congressman,” the cop was stunned. The copper ceased the assault and laughed. Then he found the pervert’s wallet. He pulled out the driver’s license and called his station. Sure as hell, the creep was a congressman.

When the congressman went to trial, he swore up and down on a stack of bibles that he was staring at the cheerleaders, a single specific cheerleader, in fact, not the football players, when he was, for a horrible moment, “caught in a trap laid by Satan himself.”

It was, in the judge’s mind, vitally important that he be absolutely sure on this point. For, if the congressman was, in fact, fantasizing about having his way with one of the football players, he was going to do some serious time.

 If, on the other hand, he had been bewitched by one of the ‘rah rah sis boom bah, I know you wanna fuck me, oolala!’ teasing, tarty teens, he would cut the poor fool some slack. ‘I’ll give him a couple years,’ thought the judge, staring at the congressman’s buxom cougar of a wife and thinking impure thoughts. ‘Perhaps wifey over there will show some gratitude.’

In order to believe the congressman’s charges of witchery, the judge ordered the girl in question to make an appearance in court. The girl, all of fifteen, could have been traumatized by the attention, but she was not that kind of girl. She lived for the attention and she got more than any other girl in town, by a country mile.  The second the FBI schmuck saw the girl in court he felt bad for the congressman. She was a dead-on strumpet. None of that girl next door bullshit. The fucking harlot showed up wearing a Hello Kitty tube top, a micro mini and a pair of thigh-high fuck-me-hard fuck-me-now boots. In court! The fuckin’ whore!

The congressman got two years, less a day, the judge got the congressman’s wife, the tart got the front page of the paper three days in a row, and the FBI schmuck got on with his life.

And now, six years later, here was that bewitching babe, all grown up and standing ten feet in front of him, sipping a coffee and shooting the shit with some other FBI schmuck. He was pretty sure it was her. It had to be her.

“So, why did the Muslim terrorists burn 350 lawyers to death,” the girl asked the other FBI schmuck. The other FBI schmuck smiled and shrugged.

“Because Allah fucking Akbar, baby!” roared the girl. The two of them exploded in laughter and high fived.

Just then, Phil Head walked into the room. Head looked at the clock. Seven a.m. on the dot. Right on time. “Okay, everyone, shut the fuck up.” Everyone shut the fuck up. “The Mayor brings greetings from the President.” Mayor Jose Cuervo walked into the room, five feet behind Head. 

The Mayor was a big, fat Mexican. Shut up. Don’t tell me I can’t say he was a big, fat Mexican, because he was a big, fat Mexican. A big, fat, jolly Mexican. Cuervo was a funny guy. Funny as in hahaha funny. He excelled at taking the piss out of himself (in case you don’t know, that’s how a Brit would say he had a habit of engaging in self-deprecating humour and was very good at it – if you don’t know what that means, Google it).

Cuervo weighed 270 pounds when he first became Mayor of New York City, two years earlier. Trailing his main opponent by as much as 27 points with a month left in the campaign, Cuervo gambled his whole political career on a joke. He convinced his friend, the head of the Bronx Zoo, to let him shoot a faux candid video with the elephants.

It was claimed that the video was shot by a pair of tourists from Japan. The couple just happened to stumble across Cuervo at the elephant enclosure, where, get this, the elephants were throwing peanuts to the fat Mexican. Cuervo was catching, shelling and eating the peanuts. And laughing! Jose Cuervo, a big, fat Mexican was laughing like a gas-huffing hippopotamus. It was a deep, booming, baritone, infectious laugh. His laughter set the Japs (oh, fuck you, I can so  say Japs) giggling in a high pitch. Combined, the trio’s laughter proved to be more infectious than SARS

The female of Nipponese oriental persuasion (there, you happy?) asked Cuervo, “What you do?”

To which Cuervo replied, “What it look I do? I eating peanuts.” The Japs (yeah, yeah, fuck you, go back to reading Mother Jones, ‘cause you ain’t gonna dig the rest of this yearn) giggled and giggled. Cuervo snorted laughter and said, “I’m so fat that when I go to the zoo, the elephants feed me peanuts.”

The video went viral over night. Cuervo claimed that he had been so distraught about his political plight that he went to see, “the only fuckers in New York that are fatter than me,” to ask their advice. And when he started asking questions, the elephants felt his sadness and decided to cheer him up by feeding him their peanuts. It was, he said, a transcendental experience.

Even the New York Times, the New York fuckin; Times, my friends – a paper so stiff that it had never even printed the word fun in its august pages in its entire history – was so thoroughly charmed that it loosened up and dubbed him Elephant Man. The Post trumped that by declaring him Mayor Elephant Man.

Cuervo rode earthquakes of laughter and waves of awwww! all the way to the Mayor’s office.

Saying that it was important for him to be seen in the city’s eateries, Cuervo had put on another 50 pounds by the time he waddled into the room. He was a dead ringer for Ralph Steadman’s drawings of Hunter S Thompson’s 300 pound Samoan lawyer in Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas. Yeah, the big, fat  Mexican looked like a Samoan cartoon. Don’t all big, fat Mexicans look the same as big, fat Samoans? Well, they do to me.

The Mayor understood the gravity of the situation – more than 350 lawyers had been incinerated when some kind of evil genius arsonist had torched the New York State Bar Association Annual General Meeting the day before. This was supposed to be a dour, dead serious briefing. Gathered before him were the best available agents of the FBI, CIA, NSA, and NYPD.

Cuervo started well, “I’ve just returned from meeting the President at the Whitehouse. She has asked me to head up this joint task force.”

That meeting had not gone well. Although he had backed her bid for the Presidency, Cuervo did not like the Nation’s first female President. She was, to put it mildly, a humourless cunt. Cuervo once quipped, in an off-the-record drinking session with a couple journalists, that she was so wound up that she could crack walnuts with her sphincter.

The President had summoned the Mayor to the Whitehouse the minute she heard about the inferno. A lawyer herself, she wanted to ride the point on this one. The Mayor wanted to wear the white hat. He knew that some of her good friends had been roasted, and that made her the wrong person to round up a posse and start hunting. “Dirty Harry with tits,’ he thought to himself when he saw her.

In the end, Mayor Cuervo convinced the President to let him run this circus.

But no matter how he tried, the Mayor just couldn’t feel the pain. Like most everyone else, Cuervo hated lawyers. He even hated his mother, a lawyer, and you know how Mexicans are about their mothers… or, is that Italians. Well, you know, Italians, Mexicans, Samoans, what’s the difference?

So, as he stood before his task force, he couldn’t resist the temptation to crack wise.

“She’s asked me to congratulate those of you who lost your lawyers in the liar’s pyre, yesterday, and say better luck next time to those of you who did not.”

The room exploded with laughter. Cuervo knew how to play a room, although he need not have been The Amazing Kreskin to figure out that his audience didn’t have much liking for lawyers, either.

“Okay,” said Cuervo, “that’s the last dead lawyer joke I want to hear,” but, again, he couldn’t      resist, “… unless you’ve got a really good one.”

The NSA babe didn’t hesitate for a second, “Why did the Muslim terrorists burn 350 lawyers to death?’ Cuervo knew he was gonna love the punchline. He already wished it were his joke. He smiled, shrugged and waited.

The FBI schmuck, who had busted the pervy congressman, had always been a shameless suck-up to authority figures. He saw an opportunity to curry favour with the Mayor and pounced before the NSA babe could spit out the punchline, “Because Allah fucking Akbar, baby!”

It worked. The Mayor howled with laughter, a s did the rest of the room. Only the NSA babe remained silent. She was pissed. The FBI schmuck instantly understood that he was not going to get so much as a whiff of the babe’s fuck-me-hard fuck-me-now boots. But he didn’t care because the Mayor, Mayor Jose Cuervo, had laughed at his joke.

“Okay, everyone settle down,” said the Mayor. “Seriously. That’s it for the dead lawyer jokes. The official death toll now stands at 358. Going up in flames is a horrible way to die… even for lawyers.

“It falls to you to find out who is responsible and to bring them to justice.

“Phil Head, here, will be overseeing the investigation and reporting directly to myself and the President.

“I’ll leave you all to get better acquainted and get to work.”

****

And that’s the last you’ll see of the FBI schmucks and the NSA babe. They are so unimportant to this story that they didn’t even get names. The vast majority of this chapter was a pointless exercise in page filling. The “because Allah fucking Akbar, baby,” joke came to me and I had to create something to put it in.

 

  • I need to establish the farcical side of this story right from the start because, if some nut case actually goes out and starts killing lawyers, after reading this, or watching the movie, I’m not gonna do time for it.

 

  • Back in 94, in Vancouver, I wrote a piece in Terminal City titled Booze Up and Riot. In the piece I encouraged readers to booze up and riot on the night the Canucks should have won the Stanley Cup. The Canucks lost, but the riot erupted anyway.

 

  • The cops investigated me and the mag and contemplated laying charges against myself and the editor. Eventually, the cops decided not to attempt a prosecution against us. The police report stated:

"SALMI is known to the author as a person with extreme views, a high intellect but a non-violent and a bark worse than his bite… Very few intelligent readers take SALMI seriously. However, he writes with great conviction and in the language of the street to the extent that persons of street-level intellect might take him seriously.”

The report continues, "SALMI wrote this article with a tongue-in-cheek attitude perhaps with no intent to actually incite the riot. He may not have realized what the consequences of his actions might have been."

Most importantly, it concludes, "given the ridiculous nature of the entire article," it would be next to impossible to take it seriously enough to recommend charges be brought.

  • In the screenplay version of this story, I immediately establish the all-important “ridiculous nature” of the entire work in the first scene, when Shakespeare comes out and shoots the lawyer

 

  • That scene doesn’t work in a book, so I need to open with something that immediately establishes the all-important “ridiculous nature” of it all, and that’s why I’m leading with the “Allah Fucking Akbar, baby!” joke and a big, fat Mexican mayor of NYC, named Jose Cuervo, cracking wise after a terrorist attack

 

 

  • No matter how serious this story gets, and all good socio-political satire must have a serious side to it, this is a joke, so fuck off if you think you’re going to make any criminal charges stick against me

 

  • Most books are full of filler. I generally disdain filler but I’m playing around with the concept, hoping that I can at least make my filler somewhat entertaining, unlike the miles of meandering, meaningless mumbo-jumbo that many meandering, meaningless writers spew forth.

 

  • You will see Mayor Jose Cuervo again, but not for a while. And you’re not going to like him nearly as much as you do now.

And that’s the last you’ll see of the FBI schmucks and the NSA babe. They are so unimportant to this story that they didn’t even get names. The vast majority of this chapter was a pointless exercise in page filling. The “because Allah fucking Akbar, baby,” joke came to me and I had to create something to put it in.
 

I need to establish the farcical side of this story right from the start because, if some nut case actually goes out and starts killing lawyers, after reading this, or watching the movie, I’m not gonna do time for it.
 

Back in 94, in Vancouver, I wrote a piece in Terminal City titled Booze Up and Riot. In the piece I encouraged readers to booze up and riot on the night the Canucks should have won the Stanley Cup. The Canucks lost, but the riot erupted anyway.
 

The cops investigated me and the mag and contemplated laying charges against myself and the editor. Eventually, the cops decided not to attempt a prosecution against us. The police report stated:
"SALMI is known to the author as a person with extreme views, a high intellect but a non-violent and a bark worse than his bite… Very few intelligent readers take SALMI seriously. However, he writes with great conviction and in the language of the street to the extent that persons of street-level intellect might take him seriously.”
The report continues, "SALMI wrote this article with a tongue-in-cheek attitude perhaps with no intent to actually incite the riot. He may not have realized what the consequences of his actions might have been."
Most importantly, it concludes, "given the ridiculous nature of the entire article," it would be next to impossible to take it seriously enough to recommend charges be brought.

In the screenplay version of this story, I immediately establish the all-important “ridiculous nature” of the entire work in the first scene, when Shakespeare comes out and shoots the lawyer
 

That scene doesn’t work in a book, so I need to open with something that immediately establishes the all-important “ridiculous nature” of it all, and that’s why I’m leading with the “Allah Fucking Akbar, baby!” joke and a big, fat Mexican mayor of NYC, named Jose Cuervo, cracking wise after a terrorist attack
 
 

No matter how serious this story gets, and all good socio-political satire must have a serious side to it, this is a joke, so fuck off if you think you’re going to make any criminal charges stick against me
 

Most books are full of filler. I generally disdain filler but I’m playing around with the concept, hoping that I can at least make my filler somewhat entertaining, unlike the miles of meandering, meaningless mumbo-jumbo that many meandering, meaningless writers spew forth.
 

You will see Mayor Jose Cuervo again, but not for a while. And you’re not going to like him nearly as much as you do now.

Twenty-six year old Jane Baker, blond, beautiful, bright and extremely ambitious, sipped a coffee as she walked into the office of Pius Akecheta, a captain in NYPD’s homicide department. She threw her copy of the first edition of the New York Post on Akecheta’s desk and asked, “What the fuck do you make of this, chief?”
Akecheta, a Mohawk Indian from upstate New York, looked at the 120 point headline on the front page – LAWYERS BURN IN ‘HELL’ - and answered, “I’d say the Post’s headline writers have outdone themselves this time.”
Jane agreed, “Yeah, it’s a beauty. Al Queda?”

Jane chuckled. “You know the problem with Islam?”

“Yeah?”
Akecheta put his pen down, looked up at Jane and said, “Never mind. What‘s the problem with Islam?”
“The Muslim world never underwent an Age of Enlightenment. Science and reason never beat fanaticism into the dark shadows of disrepute. Had that happened, Muslim fanatics would be far less dangerous. They'd be on a par with our Christian lunatics.”

story:
Short Summary

We need support in order to bring you the 5th National RAWI Conference with Mizna– three days of performances, readings, workshops, panels, a film screening, a mixer, and a culminating celebration which will include the Arab American Book Awards ceremony.  The conference will take place at Open Book in Minneapolis, MN,  9/18-20.

The conference is open to the public and will feature writers, artists, translators, editors, performers, and educators. This gathering will include a series of panels, workshops, and seminars on the topic of writing and Arab American literature, readings and performances, as well as several networking opportunities. As part of our goal to foster and support new voices within Arab American literature, we will be highlighting workshops and panels designed specifically for emerging writers. 

Who We Are 

RAWI is a non-profit 501(c)(3) literary organization dedicated to supporting and disseminating creative writing and scholarly writing by Arab-Americans.

This time around, we are working with Mizna, an organization devoted to promoting Arab-American culture, providing a forum for its expression. 

What We Need 

The Radius of Arab American Writers - RAWI - aims to raise $5,000. These funds will be used to help support guest speakers, student scholarships, and readings at the conference and beyond. We are a 501 (c) (3) organization, so your donation is tax-deductible. 

Why Is This An Important Event?

RAWI is the only national organization that provides mentoring, community, and support for Arab American writers.

Despite the fact that Arab American voices continue to become more prominent, opportunities for us to share our experiences and insights, as well as to discuss the trajectory of Arab American literature, is limited.  Therefore, RAWI’s biennial conference provides a rare opportunity to bring a large number of Arab American writers and scholars (and their readers and admirers) into the same space so we can engage in various dialogues otherwise unavailable to us.

The conference also provides us the opportunity to continue our rapid growth and act as representatives of the literary arts in Arab America. 

Who Are RAWI's Members?

Members of RAWI include Naomi Shihab Nye, Lawrence Joseph, Suheir Hammad, Laila Lalami, Randa Jarrar, Khaled Mattawa, Mohja Kahf, Fady Joudah, Etel Adnan, Steven Salaita,  Sam Hazo, Rabih Alameddine, Elmaz Abinader, and many more. 

RAWI’s work has been featured on the US Department of State website and has been covered by the New York Times, Aramco World, and The Washington Report on Middle East Affairs. Its members have been featured in The Huffington Post, NPR, Guernica, PMLA (the journal of the Modern Language Association), and elsewhere. Our members have also been recognized by the Academy of American Poets, the US State Department’s Arabic Book Program, and the National Endowment for the Arts, as well as many state and regional arts associations and councils. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Thank you for supporting Arab-American voices!

story:
I want to tell a story of self search and development through my experiences. A year ago, I was so out of it...I was about to hit rock bottom. I was stuck in a rut, and didn't know how to get out of it. Whatever I tried to do, failed for some reasons, and I ended up in a depressed state where nothing was making sense to me. I was looking for something to relate to in all the wrong places..clubs, people, things, etc. but always ended up feeling empty.

All the while, I always had a smile on my face, being the 'rock' for my friends, and doing presentations for my network marketing company like a pro, inspiring others. but deep down, I was empty. I didnt know who the hell I was! And it was stopping me from seeing a clear future for myself.... I was 21. I got so angry with myself because I KNEW deep down that i was meant for something more, because I'd been TOO blessed with a LIFE, to become a 'Nothing'. So, Somehow, something told me nothing is going to ever work for me if I dont figure myself out first...

I had to figure out how I ended up in that Brooklyn NY Room in Flatbush. So I started from the beginning, just writing down where I've been and what I'd seen. It started in Rwanda, where I was born. In the book, I talk about my life there, and the genocide that happened in 1994, where we had to flee the country, along with thousands of other people. I talk about the refugee camps we stayed in for months in tents during the genocide, and I also go into life in Kenya, where we lived for 5 years in conditions that many can't even fathom. 

I also go into the process of us coming to the USA in 1999, and my life in Ohio, and the culture shock that my family went through, that basically tore me apart from my parents. Any country we moved in, I was quick to adapt. Doing so in the US was too much for my traditional Catholic family. 

I also talk about my decision to move to NYC as a sophomore in HS, and the preparation to my moving... and how I ended up in NY with two suitcases at 18 with $28 and a dream...

NYC was an experience that was so sweet and so bitter. I talk about my being homeless there, to being on set, in music videos, on Tyra, and an MTV commercial too, and eventually getting my own radio show at 19 years old... 

All the while, with no support, and basically having to hustle... And it came to a point where I was so lost and bruised by all that was happening, I felt myself begin to slip away... which caused me to want to figure myself out by writing a journal... which turned into my book.

And wow, have I really become whole. I know what I want, and my purpose.... all I went through was MEANT to be, and My life is not my own...I have to use it to help others in anyway that I can, and be a vessel that can be used for greatness.....

story: My name is Jason Jones. I have spent the last 18 years documenting the decline of the family farm. I was born with an identical twin brother in Bobby Knight country. I also was diagnosed with a rare blood disorder known as hemophilia. Thru these events and others I have had the pleasure of making many reknowned acquaintances. Ryan White "The Kid of courage".Kenny Aaronoff The drummer for My Mothers lounge act and whom went on to work for Mellencamp and the Smashing pumpkins.Etc... I have enlisted the help of Tom Parker whom is a New York times best selling Author to edit these notes I've meticulously kept. The money raised will go to editing,publishing and marketing this Gumpian novel which is all based on true events. This story is remarkable,true and will one day be made into a motion picture as long as Ted Demme or Tom Hanks will do the work.......The monies raised will go thru my accountant whom Is an Indiana University grad with a masters degree in pychology. I cannot move forward in editng since the funds have run out. I have personally invested 40,000 dollars and I am in the red 20,000 to my accountant. This story has to be told,needs to be told,and will be told thanks to your funding. We welcome you aboard the story of this Gumpian like silly farm boy who wrote a beautiful true story of his life and times on the declining farm that he intends to save with the funds generated.MY only dream is to preserve the ground I was born on as a 6th generation farmer. This book is the life and times of us in its raw form wildly outrageous funny and in its worst tragic and tried and true.Sometimes life takes you all the way.

story:
The Petal Project
The Petal Project is an ongoing portrait photography series shot in my Greenpoint Brooklyn, NY studio, from 2010 to present.

To Pre-Order the book :
http://talfotoshop.bigcartel.com/product/petal-project-photo-book-is-now-available-to-pre-order

Continuation of all Perks for Book Campaign - still possible via Email: Talfoto@gmail.com Thanks!

Reinforcing the relationship between natural forms, underlines the essential inter connectivity of all beings.

The project began with a portrait of a friend. Exhibiting this first Petal Portrait in a Chelsea gallery, people immediately responded to the provocative expression of femininity, inner power, fragility, strength and sensuality I was able to capture between woman & petal. I decided to continue with a series, restaging that initial photo with different women and flowers.
I began photographing women around me that I found inspiring: friends, family, colleagues.  As the project grew, a mosaic emerged; an increasingly dynamic and diverse group of women brought their individually unique presence to each sitting creating a rich and complex dialog. 
The Petal Project has been chosen to be in the Saatchi online Curated Collection, and featured in Creem magazine. I want to make this record into a printed photo book.

About The Photographer:  

My name is Tal, I am a fine art portrait and fashion photographer. My work in photography and image-making has been published and exhibited nationally and internationally, and featured in HBO, MTV, TOPMAN Generation Magazine, Rolling Stone, Italian Vogue, Creem, Kid- In & W Magazine.
What We Need & What You Get; 

My goal is to print a First edition photo book, limited printing of 500 copies. To do this, I need to raise $8,500 to cover printing and shipping costs. The Petal Project will be printed  with an international fine art publisher, ensuring the highest quality edit and color printing.

The Impact: 

Each Petal Portrait has been an empowering and collaborative experience. Since 2010, this project has grown taken hold and become very dear to my heart. It is also a tribute to all the amazing women who gave of themselves to participate in it and been the inspiration for it.
I am now asking you to be an expanded part of it: with your support, I can realize this publication-based art-object and further the reach of this shared adventure in book format.

The Perks:

The Book!! Portrait & Petal Sessions, Large Photo C-Prints, Paul Richard Drip Painting, Petal Stationery Card Box Set, Lots & lots of personal Thank Yous across social media and in my book!!!

Other Ways You Can Help :

Please feel free to help promote the Petal project on Facebook and all of the other share tools found here on Indiegogo!  

All images © Tal Shpantzer 2014

www.talfoto.com

Thank you

Additional Texts:
Written by Marilena Hatoupis

In The Petal Series, Tal Shpantzer both enhances and challenges the traditional relationship, symbolism and depiction of flowers associated with female subjects.

Inspired by the Dadaist movement and the works of Anna Therese Johanne Höch – critic of the mass culture beauty industry and pioneer of the art form known as photomontage - Tal Shpantzer blends fashion conceptualization, fine art painting stylistics and documentary photography techniques to construct a fictional scenario in which the pain and pleasure of personal experiences emerge with eerie and foreboding qualities. The natural levity and softness of each petal contrast with the explicitness and strength of its symbolism.
“I am captivated by the dialogues that emerge through each woman and petal portrait. A raw and unpretentious moment can reveal complexities, evoke imagined histories, and hidden truths,” she says. The series is rooted in Ms. Shpantzer’s own experience with the reconfiguration of personal memory after a yearlong period of amnesia.


Written by Tracy Ann Essoglou, PhD. SituationDesign, Inc. & OffSiteLab :

The Petal Project by Tal Shpantzer is an exploration in female portraiture. Photographing women is fraught. Taking pictures of women immediately ventures success or failure in terms of the ability to retrieve the image of woman – any image of the woman, any woman, every woman, women… – from the coded manipulations of what stands for beauty and belonging, against the creation of singularity and individuation. In Shpantzer’s Petal Project, each woman is marked by the presence of a flower’s petal, bud or blossom covering the woman’s mouth. This element provides the visual echo uniting the series without dictating any single question or prerogative. 


Some of the portraits present an easy fit: as if the petal were a favorite flavor, a selected rouging or beguiling accessory. Other images poise on the edge of inescapable historicism: where the mouths of women are never neutral, single or simple, where covering invokes silencing or censorship, and the beauty of the flower-addition courses the continuum: conscious departure, frustrated coding, uneasy glorification, contentious complicity. In other words, not all of the images succeed, or succeed equally, at distancing us as viewers from seeing what we have mostly likely and most often ‘seen’ before – the staged and un-innocent serializing of women and the sexualizing of anything that involves us.
Fortunately and strategically, the variation of faces, features, styles, angles and personal elements keeps the series grounded in exploration and vibrancy. Different postures individuate – even as the flowered mouth of each portrait builds the theme of the project. The women of these images are not reduced to one version, style or statement. Beauty emerges in the variations of the more subtle, observable elements: eyes, bones, brows bangs, freckles…It also appears in the stark willfulness of those ‘sitting.’ There are no wall flowers in this project, no shrinking violets, or ambivalent participants. The series plays the tension: female, floral, futurity… before capturing the irreducible certitude of women choosing to… and ultimately, the beauty of the gaze not just returned, but active and attuned, self-aware and integrated.

The Petal series will be turned into a book and exhibition.

story:
"Close Combat" - a Red Army Knife-Fighting Manual

Get in touch with history.

Learn time-tested skills and tactics.

Over the years, the weapons and tools of humanity evolve. Spears. Rifles. Cruise missiles. Drones. But some things stay the same. No matter how advanced the weapons, there is still a need for men to close face to face with their opponent, to engage him in a direct manner. Sometimes there are sentries that must be eliminated. Sometimes a soldier is attacked suddenly, and does not have the time to raise his rifle before he feels the enemy's breath on his face. Sometimes it the last minutes of the infantry advance, when men stand face to face with their foes. Sometimes it is simple personal defense.

This book had been developed by Red Army martial arts expert, N. N. Simkin, based on the combat experience of Soviet soldiers and sailors as well as NKVD special operatives. He wrote: “In those circumstances where the firearm is unavailable or malfunctioning, or when a soldier must operate in silence – then the knife becomes a powerful defensive and defensive weapon in the hands of a brave warrior, provided he possesses knife-fighting and martial arts skills.”

Based on his extensive knowledge of both real-world military experience and scientific work at the Soviet Union's institute of Physical Training, Simkin wrote this textbook, to be used both in training Red Army soldiers and students in Soviet schools, “allowing them to become true defenders of the Motherland from a young age.”

Where the first Soviet military manual published by DiLernia Publishing covered all aspects of what the military terms 'hand-to-hand combat', - including storming enemy positions, throwing hand-grenades and using the issue rifle at close range - this manual, titled "Close Combat" covers a far more specific and brutal topic.

This classic manual manual covers a wealth of information on knife fighting and other non-ranged combat, such as utilizing one's bare hands, and bayonets (such as portrayed in the image above) to engage one's opponent in circumstances where a firearm is not available or cannot be used.

We require a small sum of money to fund the translation of the book – first published by the Soviet Union's Voenizdat in 1942 – into English and preparing it for publication with DiLernia Publishing. The book is of interest for those in interest in military history or personal preparedness.

The translator, Boris Karpa, has previously translated into English books such as Vadim Shutikov's "The Entrenching Tool – A Lecture Course", and the Soviet manual, "Destroy the Enemy in Hand-to-Hand Combat", now available on Amazon Kindle and as a paperback, and The Soldier and Squad in Night Combat, available via Amazon Kindle.
