story:
It Takes Love (and some other stuff) to Make a Baby 

"Mommy, how are babies made?"  

Any parent who's fielded this question knows how essential a good book can be to help guide a tricky conversation. But what if your family doesn't fit the standard mold? How do you explain pregnancy and birth if your child has two moms?

It Takes Love was written for lesbian families formed through donor insemination, and authored by family doctor and writer, LL Bird.  The art and design is by award winning illustrator Patrick Girouard, whose work you can see in hundreds of children's books, Oxford University Press, Highlights, Kid City, National Geographic, and many other magazines. It will be published as the first project of Catadon Press, an indie publishing company dedicated to books that make a difference. To see the rest of the book art go here.   For more about LL or Patrick click here or here.  And to actually buy the book click here.


LL says why she wrote the book 

Hi, LL Bird here. I'm a family doctor, writer, and mom to a very curious and persistent little boy. When my son asked me how the sperm got to the egg, I couldn't get to the library fast enough. The books I found about sex and reproduction were all wonderful; still I noticed how queer families and families formed via adoption, DI, and IVF were like footnotes in the larger story, which was about straight couples and straight sex. Where are the books for the rest of us, I wondered? So I went looking for all the sex ed books that didn't make it into the libraries or the standard recommended reading lists, and found even more great ones. What I didn't find was one for lesbian families with kids born via donor insemination that put their child's story at the center, so I decided to write one myself.

As for me, I spent fifteen years explaining asthma, fixing boo boos, and helping patients through the most sensitive times of their lives. On the side I wrote for San Francisco Bay Area newspapers, and was a medical consultant for local social justice and human rights organizations. I am an aging backpacker and beach bum, world music lover, futbol fanatic, and founder of Catadon Press.  I live in Richmond, California with my family, a white Easter bunny, and a family of squirrels who have taken over the redwoods in our back yard.

Why support this book? 

Because every child has the right to know their origins and see their family reflected in the books they read. This sweet, beautiful little book is a tool for parents to begin a conversation of a lifetime. It will be available online from the Catadon Press website, libraries, sperm banks, and all over the world. Your support will help get the book to families that can use it. 

Crowdfunding is like your local radio station pledge drive except everything is done through social media and online networks. Even if you can't contribute, you can still help get the book out. If you love It Takes Love, let everyone know. Share this campaign with your community.  See the little icons at the top of the page?  As easy as a click.

OK, so what will you do with my money?

The book is ready to go to the printer (hurray!). $3500 will pay for 2000 paperback copies plus shipping and campaign fees. Of course, the more money there is, the more books can get printed. If we do well, we can print a small number of hard cover copies, which will make it easier to get into libraries. Two-mom families speak all sorts of languages. The plan is to eventually do a Spanish and German translation. If we do really, really well, we can do that a bit sooner.

Perks! Perks! Perks!

Another great thing about becoming a supporter (aside from all the good karma you will receive) is that you are entitled to perks:

1) It's a great way to get a copy of the book. Get one for your own family. Get one for friends and relatives, or for the school library. Send one to the Texas Board of Education (note: if you do this I will pay shipping).

2) Patrick's It Takes Love line drawings make a cool coloring book.

3) Marriage equality gift wrap!

4) I love Patrick's use of color and sense of humor. Own a signed print of his work.

5) Improve your personal SEO. Your name posted on the Catadon Press Donors Hall of Fame.

**International contributors should contact me with any problems in paying shipping charge.

                                                         Sexuality Health Educator

“I love it! Short, sweet, straight-up, and just what kids need to understand how many two-mommy families come to be…”

                                                        Amy Lang, MA

                                                       Author of Birds + Bees + YOUR Kids 

Note from publisher

Some truth in advertising: We did the video last year before some of the final decisions were made about the content of the book. Don't worry, it's still great and doesn't affect the main part!  Instead of a dedicated page for talking about donors, we have to refer you to the website. Sorry about that. There was just too much information for one little 8X8 page, and it was impossible to decide what to keep and what not to keep, and what would be appropriate for little eyes that may be reading it.   Instead the website will link to some good online resources.   

Lastly, I wanted to thank the stars of the video, Jenny Fosket, Virginia Bellis, and Taz Brandebaur. You guys are naturals.

It Takes Love (and some other stuff) to Make a Baby 
"Mommy, how are babies made?"  Any parent who's fielded this question knows how essential a good book can be to help guide a tricky conversation. But what if your family doesn't fit the standard mold? How do you explain pregnancy and birth if your child has two moms?It Takes Love was written for lesbian families formed through donor insemination, and authored by family doctor and writer, LL Bird.  The art and design is by award winning illustrator Patrick Girouard, whose work you can see in hundreds of children's books, Oxford University Press, Highlights, Kid City, National Geographic, and many other magazines. It will be published as the first project of Catadon Press, an indie publishing company dedicated to books that make a difference. To see the rest of the book art go here.   For more about LL or Patrick click here or here.  And to actually buy the book click here.LL says why she wrote the book 
Hi, LL Bird here. I'm a family doctor, writer, and mom to a very curious and persistent little boy. When my son asked me how the sperm got to the egg, I couldn't get to the library fast enough. The books I found about sex and reproduction were all wonderful; still I noticed how queer families and families formed via adoption, DI, and IVF were like footnotes in the larger story, which was about straight couples and straight sex. Where are the books for the rest of us, I wondered? So I went looking for all the sex ed books that didn't make it into the libraries or the standard recommended reading lists, and found even more great ones. What I didn't find was one for lesbian families with kids born via donor insemination that put their child's story at the center, so I decided to write one myself.As for me, I spent fifteen years explaining asthma, fixing boo boos, and helping patients through the most sensitive times of their lives. On the side I wrote for San Francisco Bay Area newspapers, and was a medical consultant for local social justice and human rights organizations. I am an aging backpacker and beach bum, world music lover, futbol fanatic, and founder of Catadon Press.  I live in Richmond, California with my family, a white Easter bunny, and a family of squirrels who have taken over the redwoods in our back yard.Why support this book? Because every child has the right to know their origins and see their family reflected in the books they read. story:
Talent for Humanity is an international non-profit organization conceived by a group of people drawn together by a single vision of serving humanity, and by the idea that it is possible to create a better world through entertainment and the performing arts.

The writing of the Talent for Humanity  book has mobilized many talented people over the past 2 years. Each book sold will help to support the Talent's endeavors going forward.  We need your assistance to be able to finish our work so this book - which brings people to light, recognizes their talent, allows the world to learn about them, and help them to become a source of inspiration to others- can find its way to you. 

For each donation (tax-deductible), you will receive an equivalent gift. Any amount received above our goal will go towards the development of the Letter to Humanity website  and project (see below).  We thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity.

Please make some noise on social media for us and talk about the campaign! Thank you for your time and support.

Talent for Humanity Inc. is a public charity (501C3) incorporated in Las Vegas, NV – USA.

Our partners in this adventure:
Book Distribution: Greenleaf Book Group 
Publicity Company: Smith Publicity

All of us dream of a kinder world, a more equal world, a more inclusive and imaginative world where our common vision somehow matches up to the vast and mysterious beauty of being human. How often do we stop to consider a simple question like “what does it mean to be alive as a human being”? And in this very brief time we have here on earth, have we calculated what we are going to do with this life of ours? We might wonder how we are going to choose to behave and act in our community and contribute to an endangered world, or ask ourselves what we understand by the word responsibility. We may tell ourselves we desperately want to do something to help. Will we just settle for business as usual though, merely following the unconscious, automatic, ravenous bidding of ‘my needs’ and ‘my feelings’? What part are we going to play?

The six stories in this book trace the lives and actions of a group of people who have found answers to these questions, and made an incredible contribution to their fellow human beings. In one way or another, they have all taken a stand and fought against poverty, apathy, closed-mindedness, oppression and prejudice. They embrace the entire planet.


The book and the Talents  (extract of the book introduction)

These six stories are all wildly different, some of them poetic, others more down-to-earth, but what they all have in common is the way in which these men and women have uncovered something within themselves which empowered them to help and create opportunities for others, often on a massive and until then unthinkable scale. They all have used the arts, whether film, theatre, photography, drama, dance or music, and allowed their gifts and talents to reach out and infuse others, often young people and children, with values and understanding that are vital for their future and the community.

As they tell their stories in their own words, it will become clear that this book is neither another self-help book, nor a set of moral directives about what anyone is supposed to think, believe or put into action. Far from it. It is a book about passion and creativity, about friendship and kindness, determination and, as we will see, focused and undistracted attention. It is a book about compassion, because everyone in it has been driven by a compelling desire to alleviate suffering, along with its causes. It is a book about courage and resilience as well, as they all in their own ways had to overcome obstacles and hardships, and sometimes the most gruelling and brutal of ordeals. It is about transformation too. Some people like to make a distinction between change and transformation. They say that change is an improvement or alteration of what already exists, whilst transformation, like a butterfly freeing itself from the chrysalis, means a new creation, where the only limits are our imagination and commitment. 

This is also a book of discovery, and as we read we might find it is full of clues and insights and ideas, that might strike and move through our minds like a rush of mountain air. But that is up to us, as we meet and make eye contact with the women and men in these pages. They are human beings just like us. And to be a human being is to be creative. We all have the capacity to transform ourselves, change the world and inspire others.

None of these men and women set out to be catalysts for change in the world or the source of hope and help for so many other people. It so happened that each of them possessed a deep affinity with art and creativity, be it in the form of music, dance, networking, photography or theater. All of them had significant artistic talents. But what transpires as we follow them through the formative years of their lives is that they each experienced a dramatic moment of transformation, and so came to realize that those very gifts required, demanded almost, that they put them to the service of humanity, whether it be to help children or women or ordinary people in Afghanistan, the United Kingdom or Palestine. There was a point where they could no longer bear the suffering of others, and to the same extent they could not stand the thought of inaction. In this sense, they all fought against convention, against the communal delusion that we are separate and independent entities. They all possessed the courage to be different and so make a difference, shining a light through the fog of normality, a light made all the brighter because it had its source in the heart of humanity, the living flame of love. And so this is a book about love as well, about connection and the wish to bring the greatest possible well-being and freedom to others.

When ten more children in Los Angeles at risk from the revolving door of gang warfare and juvenile crime find their way to a better, more hopeful life, bringing the best of themselves to the community, or when one young woman finds the hand of friendship without being murdered for simply seeking freedom and the right to choose her own life, then we can see how the impact of these people, each working in their own way, is exponential, affecting the lives of innumerable other human beings in an ever-widening cascading torrent of interconnections.

The themes and the insights in this book are a formula for our world today, a message for us all; in fact nothing could be more relevant or more urgent. These stories are at one and the same time intensely personal and profoundly universal. They are about humanity, in both senses of the word, from the collective, our species, to those essential and most noble qualities of the human heart: kindness and benevolence, altruism and love.

What did our story-tellers find on their journeys? Definitely they will have encountered the great paradoxical and counter-intuitive truth of the human condition, that taking care of other human beings is the surest and most reliable way of take caring of our self. Because for all their gifts and abilities, what they, and we, discover, is that these seven individuals had one more talent, perhaps the most precious and far-reaching one of all, a talent for humanity.


Letter to Humanity

Each of our story tellers here was invited to compose a Letter to Humanity, which follows immediately after their story. In their letters, they crystallize what they would like to say, from their hearts, to all of us in the world. At the end of this book, we will find an invitation, where we too can write our own letter, and express our deepest or most urgent feelings to people everywhere. In that way, we will gradually become part of an open-hearted community of people who are passionate about transforming the world, each in our own different way. 

The final chapter of this book belongs to you. The blank page that ends it is offered for you to open your heart, and write your "Letter to Humanity". This will be the beginning of our communal story. 

Do join us and take part.

We are convinced that each and every one of us can achieve something by using our talent—whatever it may be—to help make this world the place we dream of living in.

story:
PLEASE DO NOT DONATE!

Hi Everyone,

We have decided to close this campaign.  Please do NOT donate. Thanks to all of you who initially supported this campaign. All money will be returned.  

As business people and marketers, we like to try new things and see how they work.  It's great if they work out, and it's almost as good if they are a spectacular failure such as this. At least we now know what doesn't work and can focus energy elsewhere.

We gave it a great try. We individually approached more than 200 friends and blasted out the link through our media and social media resources garnering more than 5000 hits in less than a week.  Since only 11 people decided to donate we have to be smart and decide that either the product or marketing missed the mark.

It was a great opportunity for us to learn, and now it's time for us to work on projects that will be much more rewarding for us and our loyal followers.

Thanks to all,

Amilya and Kevin


What is The Happiness Library?

Have you ever been truly happy? Not just content or pleased, but really deep inside, at peace and long-term joyously happy. Everyone should have the chance to feel this way, but so many people struggle to get there. There are all sorts of excuses and reasons why people can’t or won't achieve happiness.  Most of them can be overcome with the right tools and the will to use them.

We can’t provide the will, but we can certainly help out with the tools. This Happiness Library will include 6 books for starters that provide just what you need to achieve and maintain the happiness you deserve. Now some will ask if this is really a Success Library. We considered that concept but have learned over the years that all happiness requires a modicum of success, but not all success leads to happiness. So you will find tools in this library that address both success and happiness.


What's in The Happiness Library?

The Happiness Library includes 6 books averaging 50 – 100 pages each.  The books have specific thoughts, stories, methodology, exercises and best practices for achieving and maintaining happiness in your life. The books will be available electronically, and also nicely printed and bound. We hope to develop more volumes in the future. Here are the first 6 titles:

Volume 1 - The Happiness Boosting Manual

Volume 2 - Kevin’s Preferred Destiny Primer

Volume 3 - Amilya’s Vision Board Tutorial

Volume 4 - The Confidence Builder Exercise Book

Volume 5 - The 365 Happiness Idea Calendar

Volume 6 - The Gratitude Guide


Why do this here?

The answer is simple, engagement. Sure we could just create a product and hope it sells, but we like the idea of getting people involved in early stages and including them in the fun of the project.  Plus, many of our friends and fans have been asking us for ways to engage in big and small ways.  We felt this was a wonderful way to connect with our community.


Who are you people?

For those of you who don't know, Amilya Antonetti and Kevin Daum:

Amilya is an entrepreneur and radio host whose books, speeches and advice help many people find their way to happiness and success. See more at Amilya.com.

Kevin is an entrepreneur, best selling author, and popular columnist for Inc.com who inspires people to pursue the awesome experience. See more at Kevindaum.com.


Why should I participate?

Maybe you should and maybe you shouldn’t.  It's not our intention to should all over you. If this project doesn’t appeal to you, no problem, don't participate.  But if you are on the bubble, here are 6 reasons you might just pull out the credit card…

  1. You like the product
  2. You like 1 of the Perks
  3. You want to support Amilya and/or Kevin
  4. You want to connect with Amilya and Kevin
  5. You think this whole thing is really cool and want to be a part of it.
  6. You want to help other people get happy.


What will you do with the money?

There are many costs associated with a project like this.

We will need to take time and resources to fully develop the product.  In addition to investing our time for writing and curating the material, we will need to hire several people for:

  • Editing
  • Proofreading
  • Design and Layout
  • Digital management
  • Photography
In addition there will be hard production costs such as:
  • Printing
  • Packaging
  • Shipping

Lastly, there are expenses associated with the crowd-sourcing process:

  • Fee to IndieGoGo
  • Credit Card Fees
  • Travel, meals and gifts to deliver the promised Perks

The $30,000 should cover all of the development costs and make sure we can deliver the Perks. If we raise more, we can expand and improve the product. Also we can begin to market it as well. Just like with any product offering, we are bound to make mistakes along the way. With a good cash base, we can make sure that we have enough resources to deliver a quality product.


Isn't this a bit self-serving?

Maybe, but really aren't all crowd-sourcing projects somewhat self-serving? Yes we want to sell Happiness Libraries, raise money and get people involved with us. But if we didn't believe we were bringing value to people through our writing, speaking, consulting and media Perks, we would just fold up our tent and go home.  We love what we do and we love giving people value through our content. We are blessed that we can make a living from it and that just encourages us to do more of it.

Here is what we won't do in this project:

  • We won't lie to you.
  • We won't exaggerate our purpose
  • We won't leave you hanging
  • We won't take money and then ignore you
  • We won't let you down.


Anything else I should know?

Good question!

Here are some additional clarifications:

  • All of the delivery dates reflect the last possible date we will deliver the Perks.
  • We will deliver the Perks as they become available or as schedules permit.
  • We will cover our travel and shipping expenses unless otherwise stated.
  • Printed items are unavailable internationally due to shipping cost. But if you really really want them, we can make arrangements for you to pay extra for the shipping. 
  • Yes, we know our video is a bit casual and silly, but then, so are we. 
  • We will update information after the raise on HappinessLibrary.com
  • We will be updating information on this project at least once a week here through the campaign and more often through social media.

Hopefully we have answered all of your questions and if not you can always reach out and ask us. We are happy to help. So now that you have no excuse, come on along, join us, and get happy!

Thanks to all for your support and consideration.

Amilya and Kevin

reasons why people can’t or won't achieve happiness.  Most of them can be overcome with the right
tools and the will to use them.
We can’t provide
the will, but we can certainly help out with the tools. This Happiness Library
will include 6 books for starters that provide just what you need to achieve
and maintain the happiness you deserve. Now some will ask if this is really a Success
Library. We considered that concept but have learned over the years that all
happiness requires a modicum of success, but not all success leads to happiness.
So you will find tools in this library that address both success and happiness.

What's in The Happiness Library? 

The Happiness
Library includes 6 books averaging 50 – 100 pages each.  The books have specific thoughts, stories,
methodology, exercises and best practices for achieving and maintaining
happiness in your life. The books will be available electronically, and also nicely printed and bound. We hope to
develop more volumes in the future. Here are the first 6 titles:
Volume 1 - The
Happiness Boosting Manual 
Volume 2 -
Kevin’s Preferred Destiny Primer
Volume 3 -
Amilya’s Vision Board Tutorial
Volume 4 - The
Confidence Builder Exercise Book
Volume 5 - The
365 Happiness Idea Calendar
Volume 6 - The
Gratitude Guide

Why do this here? 

The answer is
simple, engagement. Sure we could just create a product and hope it sells, but
we like the idea of getting people involved in early stages and including them
in the fun of the project.  Plus, many of
our friends and fans have been asking us for ways to engage in big and small
ways.  We felt this was a wonderful way
to connect with our community.
Who are you people?

For those of you
who don't know, Amilya Antonetti and Kevin Daum: 
Amilya is an
entrepreneur and radio host whose books, speeches and advice help many people
find their way to happiness and success. See more at Amilya.com.
Kevin is an
entrepreneur, best selling author, and popular columnist for Inc.com who
inspires people to pursue the awesome experience. See more at Kevindaum.com.
Why should I participate?

Maybe you should
and maybe you shouldn’t.  It's not our
intention to should all over you. If this project doesn’t appeal to you, no
problem, don't participate.  But if you
are on the bubble, here are 6 reasons you might just pull out the credit card…


You
like the product
You
like 1 of the Perks
You
want to support Amilya and/or Kevin
You
want to connect with Amilya and Kevin

You
think this whole thing is really cool and want to be a part of it.
You
want to help other people get happy.

What will you do with the money?There are many
costs associated with a project like this.We will need to
take time and resources to fully develop the product.  In addition to investing our time for writing
and curating the material, we will need to hire several people for:

Editing
Proofreading
Design and
Layout
Digital
management
Photography
In addition
there will be hard production costs such as:
Printing
Packaging
Shipping

Lastly, there
are expenses associated with the crowd-sourcing process:

Fee to IndieGoGo

Credit Card Fees


Travel, meals
and gifts to deliver the promised Perks

The $30,000
should cover all of the development costs and make sure we can deliver the
Perks. If we raise more, we can expand and improve the product. Also we can
begin to market it as well. Just like with any product offering, we are bound
to make mistakes along the way. With a
good cash base, we can make sure that we have enough resources to deliver a quality
product.Isn't this a bit self-serving?
Maybe, but really
aren't all crowd-sourcing projects somewhat self-serving? Yes we want to sell Happiness
Libraries, raise money and get people involved with us. But if we didn't
believe we were bringing value to people through our writing, speaking,
consulting and media Perks, we would just fold up our tent and go home.  We love what we do and we love giving people
value through our content. We are blessed that we can make a living from it and
that just encourages us to do more of it. 
Here is what we
won't do in this project:

We
won't lie to you.

We
won't exaggerate our purpose 

We
won't leave you hanging
We
won't take money and then ignore you
We
won't let you down.
Anything else I should know?Good question!Here are some additional clarifications:
All of the delivery dates reflect the last possible date we will deliver the Perks.
We will deliver the Perks as they become available or as schedules permit.
We will cover our travel and shipping expenses unless otherwise stated.
Printed items are unavailable internationally due to shipping cost. But if you really really want them, we can make arrangements for you to pay extra for the shipping. 
Yes, we know our video is a bit casual and silly, but then, so are we. 
We will update information after the raise on HappinessLibrary.com
We will be updating information on this project at least once a week here through the campaign and more often through social media.
Hopefully we have answered all of your questions and if not you can always reach out and ask us. We are happy to help. So now that you have no excuse, come on along, join us, and get happy!Thanks to all for your support and consideration.Amilya and Kevin

story:
Laptop for a crafter of prose

I'm a terrible writer.  I'm not even sure if "prose" is the correct word.  This campaign pitch is probably the worst thing you'll read today.  That's exactly the reason we need people who treat the English language as art rather as some utilitarian vessel for communication.

He needs a laptop

Last year I replaced his huge airtcraft engine sounding laptop with a tiny asus netbook.  It's slower than the DMV line on a Saturday morning and it's frustrating the hell out of him.
  • This isn't anything fancy
  • It costs $410 with tax
  • http://tinyurl.com/writerlaptop
  • No matter how much is donated, he'll get the laptop
  • If the full $500 is funded I'll swap out the hard drive for an SSD

Do it for art

Everyone knows how tough it is to be a writer.  People don't write to make money, they do it because they must, and our world is a better place because of their efforts.

story:
¿Qué?

Misión se apoya en el género fantástico para cuestionar aspectos del mundo real en el que vivimos.

Como antaño hiciera su padre el Rey Seffir El Pacificador, Izdubar deberá salvar Ägorahn. 

Acompañado por leales compañeros, deberá iniciar su búsqueda en una tierra desconocida, de un enemigo aún más desconocido. Pero debe darse prisa y ser precavido, pues debe encontrar a su adversario antes de que los males que encontrará en su viaje lo corrompan y hagan de él un esclavo del mal.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Ángel S. Melian.

Nacido en la Nochebuena de 1991, pasé mi infancia en Las Palmas de Gran Canaria y la adolescencia en Ingenio. Durante ambas etapas desarrollé mi creatividad a través de la literatura y, durante este último periodo, la música.

En los años posteriores, tras diversos percances personales que me alejaron de la senda de la creatividad, me convertí en Ingeniero Técnico Industrial enriqueciendo (o así me gustaría creer) el contenido de mis relatos.

Actualmente, dedico mi tiempo a desarrollar mi carrera profesional en el campo de las energías renovables, y la artística, a la par que trato de vivir una vida sana y feliz con mi pareja familia y amigos en Gran Canaria.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Un destello entre los pinos. Alguien corre con una brillante estela en la cabeza. Es rápido, ágil y está alerta. Su atuendo se compone de prendas de cuero ceñidas y lleva una espada corta envainada en la espalda.
            Detiene su carrera en los límites del bosque, en una roca al borde de una caída al lago. Hinca la rodilla en la piedra y controla la respiración a la espera… Los escucha venir y se prepara para saltar, cuando una piedra cae a su lado. No la había visto venir. Pierde la concentración. Error. Otra piedra cae contra su boca y lo manda al suelo.
            Alguien se le ha puesto encima. Una mujer. También con la misma apariencia. Sus ojos verdes miran a los dorados ojos de él. Divertida mientras sostiene un cuchillo en su garganta.
            ―Ni siquiera me has visto venir.
            Él reacciona rápido, la desarma, le da la vuelta y acaba sobre ella.
            ―Miro al frente, no hacia abajo.
            La besa y se levanta, dejándola en el suelo con los ojos aun cerrados, pero reacciona a tiempo de que lleguen sus compañeros; veinte elfos más.
            ―¿Otra vez bajando la guardia, Nínive?
            ―No, Akkad. Esta vez ella sí me tumbó.
            ―Pues acepta la derrota, cabrón ―le dice Endiku.
            ―Si no me da muerte, ¿qué derrota acepto?
            Tiamat cogió rauda una flecha y se la lanzó a Izdubar mandándolo al suelo.
            ―Ya estás muerto ―le dijo entre risas mientras él se quitaba la flecha despuntada del cuero. Todos se reían del descuido, incluso Izdubar reía mientras Nannar lo ayudaba a levantarse.
            ―Veo muchas risas por aquí ―les dijo serio Tishpak, provocando un silencio reverencial―. Vaya forma de entrenarse.
            Tishpak se veía más mayor que el resto del grupo, más curtido, con más pelo y siempre con su gran maza de acero a la espalda. Una maza que había llevado siempre consigo desde los últimos días de la Guerra.
             ―Disculpad, maestro ―le dijo Izdubar con respeto―. El final de la ruta está en ese lago de ahí abajo, a un salto de distancia.
             Tishpak se acercó serio a Izdubar. Le sacaba tres cabezas.
             ―Pues acaba el recorrido ―le dijo agarrándolo con sus enormes brazos y lo tiró al lago entre las risas de todos.
             Los demás le siguieron»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Misión que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ángel S. Melian vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
I'm Sara Secora, a creative being with the thirst of expression. I am a full-time international voice actress as well as an accomplished author. I have two publications under my belt, and a Goodreads average rating of about 4.5-stars to boot! In the last few years, I've learned that self-publishing has many layers to it; the undeniable ones being that it's arduous and expensive. 

Some of you may remember that I held a campaign for my first book in the Amethysta trilogy back in 2016. With your invaluable help, I was able to take some of the burden off my plate as I chased my dream to publish my debut novel, Throne of Lies. Nothing was quite as touching as the feedback by those who had believed in me by supporting my previous campaign. Now I am back, hoping to expand the story I began so many years ago. And I'll need your help for that!

In the nail-biting sequel, Amethysta is leaping directly into the action. She will be met with familiar faces as well as some unforgettable new ones. The world of Vataenya is ripe with diverse kingdoms and unique cultures, each a marvel of its own and ready to be explored.

With this new installment, you will experience a belly full of laughs, a heart of sorrow, and the sweet adrenaline laced excitement of a new chapter as you return into Amethysta's shoes. Her adventure is ready start, but will her burning questions will be answered? 

And that's all I'll say for now! However, I am thrilled to tell you that where it stands, I am at a whopping 75% completed with my draft! I've been much more proactive this time around and while I've been busy writing I've begun other steps! Such as the cover art is in motion (by artist Serafluer), an original map of Vataenya has been created (by artist Thomas), and my editor is gearing up to bring this story to the finish lines.

Lastly, I am  beyond thrilled to announce the official name of the second book.

Ready to hear it?

Add Untoward Awakening to your Goodreads 'want to read' list!

Here's what people are saying about Throne of Lies:

Preeti: As a reader, I have been fortunate to have read a number of good books but it is also true that there are very few instances, which I can recall, when a book has enraptured me from the very first page itself. This book is surely one of them. It was my pleasant surprise when I felt ‘the pull’ immediately after reading the first few lines. My heart said to my mind – ‘This is the book which both of us will surely enjoy together’ :)

Angela: This debut is stuffed with the ornate descriptions that are a hallmark of engrossing high fantasy. Secora captures the reckless emotional turmoil of young Amethysta in perfect mimicry of any teenage girl, and her magical allegory is well-used. The world-building is extensive, and it's clear there's a lot more in store. Familiar favorite elements of a romantic fantasy are given refreshing new faces, and the balance between answered questions and new mysteries is perfect. I'm looking forward to the next book!

Nathan: Wonderful, intense, heartbreaking, and hopeful. Sara has created a brilliant piece from the heart. I highly recommend reading this book for those that enjoy the tensions and struggles of finding oneself amongst the turmoil of duty and the heart. I look forward to the continuation of the trilogy and what may come from Amethysta's hidden past.

(Click here)Continue to read reviews about the first book in Amethysta's story

 

Transparency is a must! So here is what I will use the funding toward:

  • Most critically, I will spend the bulk of the money on a few rounds of editing. The key to a good book is having it well edited. Since I've been through this process before, I have my editors selected and the book will be in the best of hands.
  • The art. I have already begun to shell out my own money by enlisting experienced artists and cartographers. This is in an effort to bring the book to life visually. The book will come with an outstanding cover, original illustrations, and even it's own map!
  • Marketing. Of course any product needs this step, and it is an important one. This will help the word get out about my book, and thus help my sales. Since what's the good in writing a story if no one knows it exists? Blah!
  • Interior Layout Design. A simple process that really changes the format of ones book. I intend to be more critical of this step on round two.
  • Audiobook Production. This is no small task, and requires a great deal of time and work. I will hopefully be hiring the same voice actress from Throne of Lies, Holly Lindin.
  • Fees such as ISBN and other various steps that all matter in bringing the book to shelves.

Final Thoughts

Like before, I will be selecting flexible funding for this campaign because regardless if my goal is met I will finish the book. This funding will effectively take a heft weight off my shoulders financially, and also allow the process to speed up. Any bit truly does help! Thank you!

story:
If Not Now: a book for social and environmental justice 

Given a platform to speak, diverse voices have the power to educate and drive positive change. My name is Elke Numeyer-Windshuttle and I am the founder and editor of If Not Now, a publication for contemporary art, culture and storytelling aligned by visions of an environmentally-harmonised and socially-just future. I am an Australian photographer based in Copenhagen, Denmark where I recently graduated as a photojournalist at the Danish School For Media and Journalism.

I am very interested in the ways humans adapt to unpredictable circumstances, with a particular fascination for our resourcefulness and compassion for one-another during difficult social or environmental transitions. This project aims to give authority to our individuality, to our learned knowledge and to our lived experiences, and serves to demonstrate how these gifts are opportunities toward manifesting large-scale positive change. 

With adequate financial support, INN’s first instalment The Resurrected Issue can debut in its appropriate format; a physical, visually compelling book exhibiting projects, initiatives and thought-provoking ideas that inform on and challenge some of the greatest issues of our time. INN aims to fill a gap in contemporary cultural media by connecting ethically-tuned readers with today’s flourishing and diverse climate of artistic and cultural activism. Further, it will give those directly affected by contemporary injustices a platform to raise awareness on important subject matters.

 

Where will the money go?

Should INN receive the modest financial support it needs, your donations will go a long way! 

70% of raised funds will go directly toward printing costs
20% of raised funds will allow fair payment to contributors who have made issue one rich with impact.
10% of raised funds will assist with website maintenance, a launch event, and promotional material like posters and merchandise.
Surplus funding (should INN  be so lucky) will provide the freedom to work with the most sustainable and fair production possible. Meeting this priority first, any extra surplus will go directly back into the production of INN.02: The Surface Issue.

Naturally, there are some goodies to claim with your donations such as a copy of INN.01,  Collection 01 merchandise,  a fine-art print, or printed advertisement space. Additionally, you have the opportunity print your name in the contributors page with special thanks, or receive an INN Culture List, curated by INN.01's contributors (available at checkout). See the 'perks' for more info!

Print

As a collectable ten-part series, If Not Now aspires to be a visually-compelling archive of cultural and artistic activism. Through interviews, feature articles, art, photography, and creative writing, INN.01 will be an opportunity to engage with diverse voices, ideas and fields of action that address some of the social and environmental concerns that have surfaced since 2020 and COVID-19 lock-down. Onwards from issue two, each issue will work with content that operates within a specific field of relevance: 

INN.02. The Surface Issue: pollution, oceans, climate
INN.03: The Leave No One Behind Issue: migration, poverty, sex workers' rights
INN.04 The I.D. Issue: race, gender and identity
INN.05 The Fashion Issue: safe, sustainable fashion production and fair workers' rights
INN.06 The Design Issue: multidisciplinary design and architecture driving positive change
INN.07 The Tech Issue: data, AI, bio-tech or robotics: technology that drives positive change
INN.08 The Edible Issue: sustainable consumption and innovative cultures around food
INN.09a The Health Is Wealth Issue, part one: All In The Mind (mental health)
INN.09b The Health Is Wealth Issue, part two: Flesh And Blood (physical health)
INN.10 The Women Issue: a book to celebrate female and female-identifying voices, actions, creativity and contributions to social and environmental justice.

With several-hundred followers and subscribers on social media already, If Not Now is engaging with a growing digital community. With the help of your donations, INN.01 can be sent to print and launched as a real-life 100+ page magazine, the first of a collectable 10-part series to hold in your hands, shelve in your library, adorn your office space or keep at your bedside.

Risks & Challenges

Failing I meet the funding target, some challenges will naturally surface. Prioritising fair wages to INN.01's contributors means that any shortage of funding will come out of the modest print budget, resulting in a limited distribution reach. A solution to this hurdle could be the release of a digital pdf-format magazine, readable on any screen device. Given the visual language and tangible values of the project however, this would affect engagement with INN.01's content, and reduce the magnitude of the eventual ten-part collection.

Other support

Can't support financially? You can support the launch of INN.01 by sharing this page with friends, family and anyone in your network who would align with INN's values. This will nurture the growth of INN's community, call in a relative network and lead to positive outcomes in the future, financial or otherwise. Please know that all support in any form is greatly, greatly appreciated.
 

Engage Now

If Not Now: a book for social and environmental justice 
Given a platform to speak, diverse voices have the power to educate and drive positive change. My name is Elke Numeyer-Windshuttle and I am the founder and editor of If Not Now, a publication for contemporary art, culture and storytelling aligned by visions of an environmentally-harmonised and socially-just future. I am an Australian photographer based in Copenhagen, Denmark where I recently graduated as a photojournalist at the Danish School For Media and Journalism.
I am very interested in the ways humans adapt to unpredictable circumstances, with a particular fascination for our resourcefulness and compassion for one-another during difficult social or environmental transitions. This project aims to give authority to our individuality, to our learned knowledge and to our lived experiences, and serves to demonstrate how these gifts are opportunities toward manifesting large-scale positive change. 
With adequate financial support, INN’s first instalment The Resurrected Issue can debut in its appropriate format; a physical, visually compelling book exhibiting projects, initiatives and thought-provoking ideas that inform on and challenge some of the greatest issues of our time. INN aims to fill a gap in contemporary cultural media by connecting ethically-tuned readers with today’s flourishing and diverse climate of artistic and cultural activism. story:
The eternal joy of never-ending splendor.

Thirty years into their career, Phish continues to play music from the soul to the soul. Combining masterful composition and open-hearted improvisation with grade-school humor and collective devotion to the muse, there's nothing like the communal exploration of a Phish concert.

 

Except, of course, any other communal gathering for the sake of increasing joy in the world.
 
Music is my community, my spiritual path, and so is Judaism. 'Round about the time I became a Bar Mitzvah, I discovered Phish's timeless tunes. The process of learning how to be a Jew in the modern world has, for me, always been intertwined with the journey on the road to the next show and the endless discussion that ensues when the concert ends.
 
In compiling and writing the first volume of the Phish Talmud, I hope to capture this moment in time: Phish at the top of its game 30 years down the number line, and the community of commentary and prayer around this music flowering as never before. It's a history both personal and collective, spanning generations and millennia.

Askin' for some change.

For the past four years, I have been writing and researching this project. Many have the milestones been during that time: Graduating from college, moving cross country, starting a career, meeting my soulmate, moving across the world with her. All this growth and change and opportunity has not afforded me much of what I need to finish this book: time to sit and write. 

Meanwhile, all of those years of research has revealed two major themes: a) I have a limited understanding of and access to the depth of the Jewish tradition, mostly due to insufficient Hebrew and Aramaic skills and b) my affinity for these two seemingly disparate phenomena (Phish and Judaism) is neither unique nor outlandish.

Here's why I need your funding help:

  • Dwell: The plight of a freelance journalist/editor in a foreign country is fraught with financial  insecurity. Add to that a desire to further my education by learning Jewish texts part-time in a traditional yeshiva setting, and paying rent becomes quite a challenge. Your contribution will help keep a roof over my head and allow me to focus my energy on completing this book, which includes conducting in-depth (time-consuming) interviews with some key figures in the relevant spheres.
  • Design: One of the main goals of this endeavor is to show that there is virtually no difference between the legal/literary discussion that evolved from Torah to Talmud to the never-ending splendor of the modern Jewish text and the vast creative output of Phish and its many fans. A key component of this book will be pages of modern Phish-related commentary that mirror the textual puzzles of the Talmud. Your donation will help me pay a graphic designer to make this dream a reality.
  • Develop: As mentioned above, this book is not just about my thoughts on Phish. It's an anthology of collective wisdom. I aim to develop an eBook version of the Phish Talmud that incorporates social media so that anyone who purchases the book can add their own commentary to the text and interact with other readers. The best of the discussions that emerge from here will be collected and printed, God willing, in later volumes of the Phish Talmud project. With your contribution, I can recruit people with programming know-how to help create a truly open-source book.

Enlightened by the writings.

In Hebrew, each letter in the alphabet has a numerical value. The letter "Lamed" equals 30, and the word "lamed" means both "to learn" and "to teach." With that in mind, I hope to publish the first iteration of the Phish Talmud during the band's 30th anniversary year.  Spiritual actualization, in any faith tradition, is a life practice. Musical exploration and Jewish learning are essential aspects of my path. To get a glimpse of some of the ideas that will be unwrapped, explored and learned in the Phish Talmud, please read some of my past work:

  • "The Eternal Joy of Never-Ending Splendor: An Introduction to the Phish Talmud" on Medium
  • "Phish and Judaism: Going to Synagogue at Madison Square Garden" on The Huffington Post
  • "Readings from the Torah of the Dead: Mickey Hart Rebuilds Jerusalem" on Relix
  • "A Psychospiritual Odyssey Among Two Lost Tribes of American Pop Culture" on Hidden Track
  • "Moving Letters All Around: A Fanatical, Phonetical, Mystical Meditation" in Surrender to the Flow Magazine and on Please Me Have No Regrets 
  • "A Shabbat Tent at the Phish Festival" on The Jewish Week

Sharin' in the groove.

So, yeah, you blew all your cash when you "won" the lottery for the max number of tickets to all 4 nights of YEMSG, and none of the friends for whom you bought the tickets are even coming to New York. You're broke. I get it. Here's how you can help:

  • Follow @PhishTalmud on Twitter
  • Reach out via email (phishtalmud@gmail.com) to contribute your own Jewish-Phish story or wisdom
  • Volunteer your graphic design and app programming wisdom to make this dream a reality
  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Google+ and/or in a chain email that your grandparents will have no choice but to forward to 12 of their friends, all of whom will be forced to share with 12 more people and on and on until all the Bubbes and Zeides across south Florida will be clamoring to donate to this campaign in honor of little Mike Gordon's upcoming Bar Mitzvah
  • You are alive and can read and have heard of the band Phish! Give thanks and praise to the Lord

story:
William Addison Dwiggins (1880–1956) was among the most influential and innovative designers of the early twentieth century. He was a master calligrapher, type designer, illustrator, private press printer, and a pioneer of advertising, magazine, and book design. Despite this, too few contemporary designers and design enthusiasts are familiar with the full scope and remarkable creativity of Dwiggins’s work. With your help, we will change that!

 

The Book

W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design will offer an engaging and inspiring overview of the designer’s wide-ranging creative output and lasting impact on the graphic arts. Bruce Kennett’s careful research, warm prose, and inclusion of numerous personal accounts from Dwiggins’s friends and contemporaries portray not only a brilliant designer, but a truly likable character. 

  

Advance Praise for W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design

“A book to spend a year with. This book is many things, but most of all it is proof positive that if there is any doubt about the origin theory of graphic design, Dwiggins did more to promote, diversify, and integrate the graphic, typographic, and printing-arts disciplines than anyone of his generation.” — Steven Heller, author, art director, and design historian 

“One of the many strengths of this book is that it deals both with Dwiggins’s familiar typefaces — Metro, Electra, Caledonia — and with his less well-known types, illustrated with drawings or trial cuttings. The result is the most complete conspectus we have of an extraordinary variety of type designs, and an appreciation of Dwiggins’s virtuosity in full flower.” — Matthew Carter, type designer 

“To call W. A. Dwiggins a consummate American type designer, calligrapher, book designer, and illustrator is just to get started. Gifted with a superb literary sensibility and a flair for the dramatic, he wrote plays, stories, and crafted marionettes in a theater of his own devising […]. Bruce Kennett has brought Dwiggins to life in this impeccably written and designed biography.”  — Carl Rollyson, biographer of Susan Sontag, Thurgood Marshall, and Rebecca West, among others

“Dwiggins’s radical explora­tions in marionette theater stand even today as a remarkable contribution to the field. Puppeteers and puppet-interested audiences around the world will be excited and inspired by Kennett’s perceptive analysis of Dwiggins’s essential puppet modernism.” — John Bell, puppeteer and theater historian

“W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design reminds us that living is an art. Bruce Kennett has written and designed a highly satisfying account of the life of the graphic artist and designer that fuses the life and work in a way that Dwiggins himself would have appreciated.” — Stephen Enniss, Director, Harry Ransom Center, University of Texas, Austin

 

 

 

Production Details

W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design will be produced in standard and deluxe editions. Both will be 9 × 11 inches, with 480 pages including end notes and index, 88,000 words, 1200 illustrations, printed full color throughout with stochastic screening on Sappi Opus paper, Smyth sewn and manufactured entirely in the USA.

The standard edition will be case bound with photographic covers and satin mylar lamination.

The deluxe edition will include a specially bound version of the book, accompanied by a signed and numbered letterpress portfolio, housed together in a slipcase. The deluxe book will be bound in Dwiggins-designed decorated paper over boards and a genuine leather spine stamped with Dwiggins ornaments and hand lettering by Richard Lipton.

PLEASE NOTE: Preorders for the deluxe edition have now closed. 

 

Special Features

Portfolio of Dwiggins’s Writings

Dwiggins’s visual inventiveness was matched by his verbal wit, and he left behind a number of charming stories and playful but potent essays that helped to define the fields of graphic, advertising, and book design. Using original Dwiggins typefaces for each piece, the portfolio will contain twenty pages of Dwiggins’s writings (some never before published), printed letterpress from Linotype cast metal slugs, and housed in a handsome portfolio that will accompany the deluxe edition of the book. 

The texts — five essays and two works of fiction, plus a title page and colophon — will be set on the Linotype in Dwiggins’s Caledonia, Electra, Eldorado, Metro, and the very rare Falcon, accompanied by an assortment of Caravan ornaments. Twenty-two illustrations, hand-lettered titles, and decorated initials (all made from original Dwiggins pen-and-ink artwork in the files of Boston Public Library) accompany the text, reproduced via high-quality copper photoengravings. The portfolio pages will be printed by letterpress on Mohawk Superfine, in single sheets and four-page folders. The colophon page will be signed by all members of the letterpress production team. The outer portfolio, made from Strathmore Grandee cover, will feature a Dwiggins ornament blind-embossed on the front cover. 

PLEASE NOTE: The deluxe edition has sold out. However, the author and publisher feel it is important for readers to see Dwiggins’s hot-metal types printed in the process for which they were designed. To capture the true typographic color of Dwiggins’s type designs and the impress of the letterpress printing, the pages of the letterpress portfolio will be photographed with raking light, then reproduced in offset using stochastic screening in both the standard and deluxe editions. 

 

New Digital Electra

To commemorate and renew Dwiggins’s contribution to twentieth-century typography, we have commissioned a revival of Electra, one his most important typefaces. Referring directly to authentic Linotype drawings in the collections of Letterform Archive and the Boston Public Library, master letterer and type designer Jim Parkinson digitally restored the sturdy yet elegant shapes, readability, and vigor of the metal original. Not only is this new Electra used for the book, but backers at certain levels will receive a commercial license for the three fonts: roman with small caps, italic (sloped roman), and cursive.

 

Additional Rewards

Backers at certain levels may elect to receive one or more of the following rewards:

Set of Postcards Featuring Dwiggins Illustrations and Designs

A set of nine generously sized (5 × 7 inch) postcards featuring an array of Dwiggins’s designs and illustrations. Perfect for display or correspondence, the postcards will use the same reproduction quality and printing technology as the book.

 

Linotype Slug

A little piece of printing history. A paper weight. The perfect gift for someone who has everything. A token of our appreciation. Backers at certain levels will receive a Linotype slug used in the printing of the letterpress portfolio of Dwiggins’s writings that accompanies the deluxe edition of this book. 

 

Backstory

 

Author Bruce Kennett discovered the work of W. A. Dwiggins in 1972 and has drawn inspiration from it ever since, writing articles, essays, and lecturing widely about the man and his many talents. Bruce has been working steadily on this book since 2003. Letterform Archive’s founder Rob Saunders has been collecting Dwiggins since the 1970s, making the Archive’s collection one of the most comprehensive in the world. Two years ago, Kennett and Saunders joined forces in a united desire to produce a thorough overview of Dwiggins’s life and a complete chronicle of his work across a range of different arts. Using material from the collections of Letterform Archive, the Boston Public Library, and Kennett’s private holdings, this lavishly illustrated book will celebrate Dwiggins’s remarkable output using the most advanced photography and printing technology available.

 

 

 

Project Credits    

EDITORIAL

Bruce Kennett (author/designer) is a designer of books and exhibits, photographer, writer, and teacher. He studied calligraphy and book design with Austrian artist Friedrich Neugebauer, and later translated Neugebauer’s book The Mystic Art of Written Forms. Kennett also served as manager and book designer at Maine’s Anthoensen Press. His client list ranges from the Folger Shakespeare Library and the Grolier Club to L.L.Bean and the Mount Washington Observatory.  

Steven Heller (contributor) is cochair of the MFA Design: Designer as Author + Entrepreneur program at the School of Visual Arts (SVA). He is the author or coauthor of over 170 books on design and popular culture, including biographies of Paul Rand and Alvin Lustig. 

Rob Saunders (publisher) is a designer, teacher, and management consultant with a lifelong interest in the letter arts. Rob taught at The Museum School in Boston, then published graphic design and children’s books through the Alphabet Press, Picture Book Studio, and Rabbit Ears Books imprints. After forty years of collecting graphic design and lettering, he founded Letterform Archive to make the collection available to students, designers, and admirers of the letter arts. 

Jennifer Sime (associate publisher) combines curatorial, publishing, and management expertise, having worked at the Baltimore Museum of Art, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, William Stout Publishers, and — just prior to joining Letterform Archive last October — as executive director of the Book Club of California. 

Doris Troy (editor) brings decades of experience in copyediting and proofing books, magazines, catalogs, newsletters, and menus. 

 

BOOK PRODUCTION

Penmor Lithographers (printer) of Maine is a leading printer for education, fine arts, financial, and commercial clients. 

AcmeBinding (binder) has been central to Boston publishing since 1821, offering edition binding for trade publishers, hand binding, book restoration, and library services. 

Jim Parkinson (type designer) has been designing letterforms professionally for over fifty years, starting as a lettering artist for Hallmark Cards in 1964. Parkinson’s digital revival of Dwiggins’s Electra typeface was commissioned expressly for use in this book.

Richard Lipton (lettering artist) is a calligrapher and type designer associated with Font Bureau and Type Network. He teaches at Rhode Island School of Design. Richard will hand letter the spine of the deluxe edition.

 

LETTERPRESS PORTFOLIO PRODUCTION

Michael Babcock (Linotype compositor) is founder of interrobang letterpress, a traditional hot-metal printing shop. Michael will provide composition in Dwiggins’s Metro, Electra, Caledonia, Eldorado, and Caravan decorative units. 

Andrew Steeves (Linotype compositor) is a designer and printer of books, a writer, and a founder of Nova Scotia’s Gaspereau Press. Andrew will provide composition in Dwiggins’s Falcon types. 

Darrell Hyder (letterpress printer) is a designer, compositor, and printer in central Massachusetts. His Sun Hill Press has worked with libraries, museums, and other cultural institutions since the 1980s. Darrell will print the portfolio on his Heidelberg cylinder press. 

 

VIDEO PRODUCTION

Joseph McMahon (josephdanielmcmahon.com), a freelance editor and director based in Minneapolis, edited the video.

Vitamin Productions (vitaminproductions.com), a digital video production company based in San Francisco, produced the video footage.

Andrew Foreman (andrewforemanmusic.com), a freelance bassist living in Minneapolis, provided the soundtrack, “Stella by Starlight” (with Ben Abrahamson and Zach Schmidt).

Sam Thompson (squawkproductions.com) created the modular ornament animation in the Kickstarter video, as well as the stand-alone animation of Dwiggins’s modular ornament process.

 

 

Press Materials

For high-res images, sample spreads, and a prospectus visit http://bit.ly/dwigginspress.

 

Project Schedule

Updated Dec 7, 2017

Fonts and licenses were distributed in October 2017 or within a week of subsequent font orders; all other rewards will ship with the books.

Book printing will begin in December 2017; binding in January 2018.

Standard edition books will ship January 2018.

Deluxe copies, each with a signed and numbered letterpress portfolio and handmade slipcase, will ship January 2018.
