Bruce Kennett’s careful research, warm prose, and inclusion of numerous personal accounts from Dwiggins’s friends and contemporaries portray not only a brilliant designer, but a truly likable character. Labels designed by Dwiggins for the spines of a five-volume publication, Limited Editions Club, 1936   
Detail of Dwiggins’s stencil illustration for  Treasure in the Forest, H. G. Wells, 1936 

 Advance Praise for  W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design

“A book to spend a year with. This book is many things, but most of all it is proof positive that if there is any doubt about the origin theory of graphic design, Dwiggins did more to promote, diversify, and integrate the graphic, typographic, and printing-arts disciplines than anyone of his generation.” — Steven Heller, author, art director, and design historian 
“One of the many strengths of this book is that it deals both with Dwiggins’s familiar typefaces — Metro, Electra, Caledonia — and with his less well-known types, illustrated with drawings or trial cuttings. The result is the most complete conspectus we have of an extraordinary variety of type designs, and an appreciation of Dwiggins’s virtuosity in full flower.” — Matthew Carter,  type designer “To call W. A. Dwiggins a consummate American type designer, calligrapher, book designer, and illustrator is just to get started. Gifted with a superb literary sensibility and a flair for the dramatic, he wrote plays, stories, and crafted marionettes in a theater of his own devising […]. Bruce Kennett has brought Dwiggins to life in this impeccably written and designed biography.”  — Carl Rollyson, biographer of Susan Sontag, Thurgood Marshall, and Rebecca West, among others“Dwiggins’s radical explora­tions in marionette theater stand even today as a remarkable contribution to the field. Puppeteers and puppet-interested audiences around the world will be excited and inspired by Kennett’s perceptive analysis of Dwiggins’s essential puppet modernism.” —  John Bell, puppeteer and theater historian“W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design  reminds us that living is an art. Bruce Kennett has written and designed a highly satisfying account of the life of the graphic artist and designer that fuses the life and work in a way that Dwiggins himself would have appreciated.” — Stephen Enniss, Director, Harry Ransom Center, University of Texas, AustinDwiggins, cover sketch for his book  Bronabejjia  (never published), 1950  Dust jacket of  Marionette in Motion, Dwiggins’s handbook for engineering and construction, 1939, with one of his marionettes, mid-1930s  Sample engraved banknote Dwiggins designed for  Towards a Reform of the Paper Currency, 1932  Dwiggins’s stencil studies for Thomas Dreier,  The Power of Print—and Men, Mergenthaler Linotype Company, 1936 
  Production DetailsW. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design  will be produced in standard and deluxe editions. Both will be 9 × 11 inches, with 480 pages including end notes and index, 88,000 words, 1200 illustrations, printed full color throughout with stochastic screening on Sappi Opus paper, Smyth sewn and manufactured entirely in the USA.The standard edition will be case bound with photographic covers and satin mylar lamination.The deluxe edition will include a specially bound version of the book, accompanied by a signed and numbered letterpress portfolio, housed together in a slipcase. The deluxe book will be bound in Dwiggins-designed decorated paper over boards and a genuine leather spine stamped with Dwiggins ornaments and hand lettering by Richard Lipton.PLEASE NOTE: Preorders for the deluxe edition have now closed. Sample spreads from  W. A. Dwiggins: A Life in Design  Special FeaturesPortfolio of Dwiggins’s WritingsDwiggins’s visual inventiveness was matched by his verbal wit, and he left behind a number of charming stories and playful but potent essays that helped to define the fields of graphic, advertising, and book design. Using original Dwiggins typefaces for each piece, the portfolio will contain twenty pages of Dwiggins’s writings (some never before published), printed letterpress from Linotype cast metal slugs, and housed in a handsome portfolio that will accompany the deluxe edition of the book. The texts — five essays and two works of fiction, plus a title page and colophon — will be set on the Linotype in Dwiggins’s Caledonia, Electra, Eldorado, Metro, and the very rare Falcon, accompanied by an assortment of Caravan ornaments. Twenty-two illustrations, hand-lettered titles, and decorated initials (all made from original Dwiggins pen-and-ink artwork in the files of Boston Public Library) accompany the text, reproduced via high-quality copper photoengravings. The portfolio pages will be printed by letterpress on Mohawk Superfine, in single sheets and four-page folders. The colophon page will be signed by all members of the letterpress production team. The outer portfolio, made from Strathmore Grandee cover, will feature a Dwiggins ornament blind-embossed on the front cover. PLEASE NOTE: The deluxe edition has sold out. However, the author and publisher feel it is important for readers to see Dwiggins’s hot-metal types printed in the process for which they were designed. To capture the true typographic color of Dwiggins’s type designs and the impress of the letterpress printing, the pages of the letterpress portfolio will be photographed with raking light, then reproduced in offset using stochastic screening in both the standard and deluxe editions. Prototype of the letterpress portfolio that will accompany the deluxe edition  New Digital ElectraTo commemorate and renew Dwiggins’s contribution to twentieth-century typography, we have commissioned a revival of Electra, one his most important typefaces. Referring directly to authentic Linotype drawings in the collections of Letterform Archive and the Boston Public Library, master letterer and type designer Jim Parkinson digitally restored the sturdy yet elegant shapes, readability, and vigor of the metal original. Not only is this new Electra used for the book, but backers at certain levels will receive a commercial license for the three fonts: roman with small caps, italic (sloped roman), and cursive.Original drawing for Dwiggins’s Electra typeface, 1930s (left), and Jim Parkinson’s process sketch, 2016 (right)  Additional RewardsBackers at certain levels may elect to receive one or more of the following rewards:Set of Postcards Featuring Dwiggins Illustrations and DesignsA set of nine generously sized (5 × 7 inch) postcards featuring an array of Dwiggins’s designs and illustrations. Perfect for display or correspondence, the postcards will use the same reproduction quality and printing technology as the book.Set of nine postcards available as an additional reward for backers at certain levels  Linotype SlugA little piece of printing history. A paper weight. The perfect gift for someone who has everything. A token of our appreciation. Backers at certain levels will receive a Linotype slug used in the printing of the letterpress portfolio of Dwiggins’s writings that accompanies the deluxe edition of this book. Page proof from letterpress portfolio with Linotype slug  BackstoryBruce Kennett inserting a Linotype slug into a galley of type for the letterpress portfolio Author  Bruce Kennett  discovered the work of W. A. Dwiggins in 1972 and has drawn inspiration from it ever since, writing articles, essays, and lecturing widely about the man and his many talents. Bruce has been working steadily on this book since 2003. Letterform Archive’s founder  Rob Saunders  has been collecting Dwiggins since the 1970s, making the Archive’s collection one of the most comprehensive in the world. Two years ago, Kennett and Saunders joined forces in a united desire to produce a thorough overview of Dwiggins’s life and a complete chronicle of his work across a range of different arts. Using material from the collections of Letterform Archive, the Boston Public Library, and Kennett’s private holdings, this lavishly illustrated book will celebrate Dwiggins’s remarkable output using the most advanced photography and printing technology available.Letterform Archive Reading Room, San Francisco, CA  W. A. Dwiggins in his studio, 1940s  W. A. Dwiggins, childhood drawing, late 1880s  
Project Credits    EDITORIALBruce Kennett (author/designer) is a designer of books and exhibits, photographer, writer, and teacher. He studied calligraphy and book design with Austrian artist Friedrich Neugebauer, and later translated Neugebauer’s book  The Mystic Art of Written Forms. Kennett also served as manager and book designer at Maine’s Anthoensen Press. His client list ranges from the Folger Shakespeare Library and the Grolier Club to L.L.Bean and the Mount Washington Observatory.  Steven Heller  (contributor) is cochair of the MFA Design: Designer as Author + Entrepreneur program at the School of Visual Arts (SVA). He is the author or coauthor of over 170 books on design and popular culture, including biographies of Paul Rand and Alvin Lustig. Rob Saunders  (publisher) is a designer, teacher, and management consultant with a lifelong interest in the letter arts. Rob taught at The Museum School in Boston, then published graphic design and children’s books through the Alphabet Press, Picture Book Studio, and Rabbit Ears Books imprints. After forty years of collecting graphic design and lettering, he founded Letterform Archive to make the collection available to students, designers, and admirers of the letter arts. Jennifer Sime  (associate publisher) combines curatorial, publishing, and management expertise, having worked at the Baltimore Museum of Art, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, William Stout Publishers, and — just prior to joining Letterform Archive last October — as executive director of the Book Club of California. Doris Troy  (editor) brings decades of experience in copyediting and proofing books, magazines, catalogs, newsletters, and menus. This chart, from a 1919 Dwiggins essay on book production, is a good example of his wit  BOOK PRODUCTIONPenmor Lithographers (printer) of Maine is a leading printer for education, fine arts, financial, and commercial clients. AcmeBinding  (binder) has been central to Boston publishing since 1821, offering edition binding for trade publishers, hand binding, book restoration, and library services. Jim Parkinson  (type designer) has been designing letterforms professionally for over fifty years, starting as a lettering artist for Hallmark Cards in 1964. Parkinson’s digital revival of Dwiggins’s Electra typeface was commissioned expressly for use in this book.Richard Lipton  (lettering artist) is a calligrapher and type designer associated with Font Bureau and Type Network. He teaches at Rhode Island School of Design. Richard will hand letter the spine of the deluxe edition.Prototype dummies of standard (left) and deluxe (right) editions. Spine designs not yet completed  LETTERPRESS PORTFOLIO PRODUCTIONMichael Babcock (Linotype compositor) is founder of interrobang letterpress, a traditional hot-metal printing shop. Michael will provide composition in Dwiggins’s Metro, Electra, Caledonia, Eldorado, and Caravan decorative units. Andrew Steeves  (Linotype compositor) is a designer and printer of books, a writer, and a founder of Nova Scotia’s Gaspereau Press. Andrew will provide composition in Dwiggins’s Falcon types. Darrell Hyder (letterpress printer) is a designer, compositor, and printer in central Massachusetts. His Sun Hill Press has worked with libraries, museums, and other cultural institutions since the 1980s. Darrell will print the portfolio on his Heidelberg cylinder press. Thank you card for Dwiggins’s private press, Püterschein-Hingham, 1952  VIDEO PRODUCTIONJoseph McMahon  (josephdanielmcmahon.com), a freelance editor and director based in Minneapolis, edited the video.Vitamin Productions  (vitaminproductions.com), a digital video production company based in San Francisco, produced the video footage.Andrew Foreman  (andrewforemanmusic.com), a freelance bassist living in Minneapolis, provided the soundtrack, “Stella by Starlight” (with Ben Abrahamson and Zach Schmidt).Sam Thompson  (squawkproductions.com) created the modular ornament animation in the Kickstarter video, as well as the stand-alone animation of Dwiggins’s modular ornament process. A spread from the chapter on Dwiggins’s marionettes  Press MaterialsFor high-res images, sample spreads, and a prospectus visit  http://bit.ly/dwigginspress. Project ScheduleUpdated Dec 7, 2017Fonts and licenses were distributed in  October 2017 or within a week of subsequent font orders; all other rewards will ship with the books.Book printing will begin in  December 2017; binding in  January 2018.Standard edition books will ship  January 2018.Deluxe copies, each with a signed and numbered letterpress portfolio and handmade slipcase, will ship  January 2018.

story:
The Story of The Fried Chicken Pedicure

"I’m gonna tell you stories about my life growing up mixed in America, and living mixed in Saudi Arabia, strap in and enjoy the ride."

My name is Hannah Yasmine Al-Kabour and I'm the author of the fried chicken pedicure. I wrote this book because I wanted to see more stories of mixed kids from the third culture. Writing this book has helped me tackle the more complicated and challenging issues related to my background and made me more confident in my identity.  My Hope is that in reading this book you will discover different viewpoints on identity, upbringing, and family. I'm also hoping you learn more about the underbelly of dateline news America and its long-lasting effects on future generations. I hope you can see this book as a chance to take a quick break from the world and have a laugh with stories from a different walk of life.  Laughing along with wedding debacles in Saudi Arabia and then forgetting for a moment that we are anywhere particular in the world but we're all just people with drama on our wedding days.

You will love this book if you love to follow stories with real people. If you love to laugh and learn about new worlds seen from a unique perspective. All the while reflecting on hilarious relatable challenges from characters, which face universal obstacles that we are all faced with every day.

Fried Chicken Pedicure speaks to mixed kids and people who want to learn about lives from a different perspective. My book has characters from different walks of life with identity struggles up front and center.

Ultimately, I hope that The Fried Chicken Pedicure inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging topics such as:

  • How can identity be shaped or created?
  • Am I totally prepared when I leave the house?
  • As human beings should we have a goal to connect more through shared experiences? 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.

 

What We Need & What You Get 

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in The Fried Chicken Pedicure.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this "Winter of 2021".
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About The Author

Hannah Yasmine Al-Kabour is an author and communication specialist who lives and works between Saudi Arabia/Dubai and the United States of America.
Hannah wrote this book to share short personal stories and explore the path and journey of identity and the tightness of family values. 
Hannah loves horses, spending time with her family in Northern Michigan, and swimming all day in a beautiful lake. She loves to travel but is terrified of flying.

For more information, you can connect with Hannah Al-Kabour at halkabour@gmail.com and

  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/hannoytee/?hl=en.
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hannah.kabour/
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/hannah-al-kabour-60...

    International Preorders

    For international preorders, please do the following:
    • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
    • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
    • Message me to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via Paypal/Venmo.

    Risks & Challenges

    The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you.

    • I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.
    • The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you.
    • We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
    I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

    1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)
    2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
    3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

    Please use #TheFriedChickenPedicure and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
    Tag:
    Instagram - hannoytee / @newdegreepress
    Facebook - Hannah Al-Kabour / @NewDegreePress

    Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

    Thanks again,
    Hannah Al-Kabour

story:
*Ah, também em português abaixo.

                                                                                    ------------------

Many people say we are what we eat. Others say that we are what we read.

Believing in these two sayings we made this book, that wants to encourage children to enjoy reading and also enjoy eating more healthy foods and maybe even love vegetables.

The book is entitled "O Bairro da Minha Barriga”, meaning “The Neighborhood in My Belly". And this first version is written in Portuguese, but if we have the support at the beginning and if children enjoy it, we plan on having in other languages as well.

Written by Camila Ferraro and illustrated by Renato Lopes, the book brings a girl character that instigates the readers to also have the curiosity in finding out about what we don’t know.

"Every time I think I already know many things, I discover something new that I didn’t know yet."

The story comes to encourage children to give chances to food they may not like very much but that are nutritionally essential and that if consumed in their childhood will make the process of, later in life, having a healthier and more conscious eating habits, that respect their bodies and the environment.

But all this in a playful way, so that the little ones can dive into the narrative, awakening the use of their imagination and amusing them too, thus feeding the children's affection for the books and encouraging them to be great readers.

If you believe in these values ​​as we do and would like to help make this book a reality on the shelves of children's bedrooms who will love books and rocket salad, be a part of those who collaborate on producing it.

Any value is welcome, but when making a donation to the project that it’s equal or over the book value, you guarantee a copy for yourself with a personal dedication text from the author and illustrator sent to you.

From us and the future devourers of books and vegetables, a big thank you!

 

                                                                                    ------------------

 

Muitos dizem que somos o que comemos. Outros dizem que somos o que lemos.

Acreditando nesses dois dizeres fizemos esse livro, que quer estimular as crianças a gostarem de ler e a gostarem de comer de forma mais saudável. E, quem sabe, até amar verduras.

O livro intitulado “O Bairro na Minha Barriga”, escrito por Camila Ferraro e ilustrado por Renato Lopes, traz uma personagem que instiga a curiosidade em descobrir sobre o que ainda não conhecemos.

“Cada vez que acho que já sei muitas coisas, descubro algo novo que ainda não sabia.” 

A história vem para incentivar as crianças a darem chances a alimentos que podem não gostar muito ainda, mas que são essenciais nutricionalmente e que, se consumidos na infância, tornarão mais natural o processo de seguirem no futuro com uma alimentação mais saudável e consciente, com respeito ao corpo e ao ambiente.

Mas isso tudo de forma lúdica, para que os pequenos possam mergulhar na narrativa, despertando o uso da imaginação e divertindo-os também, para assim alimentar o carinho dos miúdos pelos livros, encorajando-os a serem grandes leitores.

Se acredita nesses valores como nós e gostaria de ajudar a tornar esse livro uma realidade nas estantes dos quartos de crianças que irão adorar livros e rúcula, faça parte dos que colaboram com a produção do livro.

Toda doação é bem-vinda, mas ao fazer uma doação ao projeto com o valor igual ou superior do livro, garante uma cópia para si com dedicatória da autora e do ilustrador enviada por correio.

De nós e dos futuros devoradores de livros e verduras, um muito obrigado!

 

                                                                                    ------------------

story:
The book is now live on Amazon!

Model Breakers is about the struggle we all experience, the struggle to be fully ourselves.

The most important stories are often left untold in the cultural dialogue. This is certainly the case for Chinese Americans. The insidious model minority stereotype rampant in America has affected the lives of every Chinese person living in the US, who feel vulnerable or invisible. I hope to shatter the model minority stereotype and show why our individual stories and histories matter.

My name is Charlene Wang and I am the author of Model Breakers. I wrote this book because I wanted to help my little brother Warren avoid the pitfalls and overcome the stereotypes in America. I started writing to my brother through a series of letters titled, “Dear Warren” that went viral. I investigated the hurdles for Chinese Americans and questioned how to have a fulfilling college—and life—experience in America. While I wasn’t sure how many letters Warren had actually read (he only responded to one), I got overwhelming responses from readers who asked for more. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to break up with the model minority stereotype. In turn, we can change the immigrant narrative at large.

I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the pain and pride of being Chinese in America. You will learn about how lack of self-awareness made Chinese Americans vulnerable and how lack of community made us victims of the model minority stereotype. You'll learn how to challenge the beliefs that kept us quiet, appeal the rules that limited our dreams, and turn limiting stereotypes into powerful narratives.

I want to redefine where we stand in society.

You'll hear stories such as...

  • How model minority reinforces that we are “minor” and distant from our true selves
  • How self-awareness and growth mindset redefine stereotypes in a powerful way 
  • How emotional and social awareness helps us go from surviving to thriving
  • How it is okay to not feel okay

You will love this book if you are a Chinese Immigrant who took the risk to come to America and start a new chapter or a Chinese American who does not see themselves as Chinese but does not feel American enough. You will also love this book if you are a curious citizen who wants to learn more about the people in your life that are Chinese.

Model Breakers is a work of nonfiction that speaks to people like my brother Warren—all the first, second, and third-generation Chinese Americans—and allies who want to create empowering identities for themselves. 

The Book - Model Breakers

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3.

In the 2016 United States Presidential election, the Chinese American voting demographic had one of the lowest voter turnouts. This would indicate Chinese Americans don’t organize, or feel disenfranchised around American politics, which supports the toxic myth that Chinese are “naturally” quiet. Nothing could be further from the truth. We are, after all, talking about the same people who organized the Tiananmen Square Protests — one of the most revolutionary movements in recent history. Now is the time to defend against fragility, redefine the stereotypes, and start our own movement.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-8.

Chinese immigrants need a job to survive and a visa to stay — all that could be taken away if we don't fit in. While it is convenient to fit in and follow the rules, it is dangerous to hand our power away. If we don’t think for ourselves, we are subject to the stereotypes and judgments that limit us. To liberate us from the false expectations, we need to know who we are, take the risk to break the model minority, and build networks to change the perceptions at large.

Part 3 contains chapters 9-12.

Despite systematic racism, most of the harm is reinforced by the rest of us who have no intention to harm ourselves. We have invested so much into educating our next generations, but we forgot to invest in our community. We are so used to coping with microaggressions and bullying that we forget that the world doesn’t have to be this way. We are weaponized as a political token, from “Model Minority” to “Chinese Virus.” It is time for all of us, whether we're studying, starting our professional careers, or becoming a role model to start these conversations and tell our own stories.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this upcoming Spring. 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Charlene Wang is a model breaker. She is the founder of LivingOS, an online community dedicated to helping high achievers get more out of life. Charlene has spent years coaching high achievers and her pioneering coaching practice has helped startup founders, angel investors, and seasoned operators find their true values and motivations in life. 

She wrote this book to break the model minority stereotype and change the Chinese immigrant narrative at scale. 

Charlene received her B.Sc. from Brown University and works as a product manager at Google. Charlene lives in the Bay Area with her fiancé and is a bit obsessed with oolong tea. 

For more information, you can connect with Charlene Wang at charlene@mylivingos.com.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ModelBreakers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Charlene

story:
Campaign Update

With the $8,000 goal surpassed, all pre-sale members will receive a signed soft cover edition in December along with audio book when it releases in 2021. 

The outreach for my book has been humbling.  I am grateful for your support!

See a brief write up on the book from an interview with Georgetown University here:

https://msb.georgetown.edu/announcements/creati...

Given so many are in need right now, 25% of all contributions above the $8,000 audio book goal will be donated to the Georgetown University COVID-19 Resilience & Response Fund.

The COVID-19 Resilience & Response Fund secures Georgetown's health, safety, and educational mission by meeting a range of emergency needs including: public health infrastructure (community PPE, testing protocols, contact tracing), virtual learning tools, and flexible pedagogy design; medical research on COVID-19; and programs to mitigate COVID-19's inordinate impact on communities of color.

Story of My Book

The Optimizer, Lifting the Curve


My name is John Saunders and I am the author of The Optimizer, Lifting the Curve. I wrote this book because I’ve found so many talented people in my life that never fulfilled their gifts because they see change and innovation as something enormous with a high probability of failure. If you can build trust with your team and a safe road map for their growth, I believe everyone can be a contributor to driving incremental change in your organization. Not every idea will be an immediate game changer, but you can develop a process to consistently draw out your teams' creativity and value generation while delivering results.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to build a culture of optimization within your team. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leading this change in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you build and lead a team of serial optimizers, ultimately engaging everyone in your mission, empowering them to grow and delivering your purpose.

In this book, you'll learn about how innovation has evolved, the principles of the optimizer, and how to build and lead this kind of team:

Thomas Edison didn’t invent the lightbulb. He took thousands of iterations and made it accessible to all.

David Gardner, co-founder of Motley Fool, displays extraordinary vulnerability to build trust and drive results.

Rick and Josh, two of my perennial top performing team members, were empowered to lead a multi hour “offsite” training workshop to up-skill their peers, driving engagement of a new strategy.

You will love this book if you want to grow and know your team is talented, but feel they’re not operating at their peak.

The Optimizer is a non-fiction book that speaks to private and public leaders and entrepreneurs  who need to lead change, drive innovation, and ultimately, enhance their organization's output, through creating a culture of optimizers.

 

The Book - The Optimizer Inside, Lifting the Curve

The book is written in 3 Parts....


Part (1) How We Got Here: Introduction + Chapters 1-3.
We explore the history of innovation and see why innovation is best done through a series of optimizations, as illustrated by Thomas Edison making over 1,000 attempts to not invent the light bulb, but to make it commercially viable. Then we look at how for centuries people have viewed innovation and change quite negatively and why that is. We wrap up part one with a solid example of what serial innovation looks like through the Lean Start Up method, which has broad applications beyond just new companies.

Part (2) Principles of the Optimizer Mindset: Chapters 4-7.
Here we dig into specific examples of what the optimizer principles are and what this mindset looks like through a variety of examples, such as the extraordinary level of vulnerability that the Co-Founder of the Motley Fool displays to impact his business. We also look at a Microsoft game studio head and how he blends his optimizer mindset with problem solving and has proven this strategy successful over and over again.

Part (3) Building and Leading a Team of Optimizers: Chapters 8-11.
In the final section we’ll reveal how to build this team as well as enable, empower, and sustain this serial optimizer mindset. We’ll see how Kodak fought this mindset and buried a world leading company into a shell of what it was. We’ll also focus on strategies to build trust with your team, as trust is the anchor to building and leading this type of team. Additionally, we’ll get a look inside at how one of the top financial advisors in the country has built trust and leads by example each and every day for her team of 25.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor and I will work together to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in the winter of 2020

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author


John Saunders is the founder of Forward Advisory Solutions and was a former Wall Street Senior Vice President and sales team leader. He earned a BS from the University of Wisconsin and a MBA from Georgetown University.

I wrote this book because I’ve seen so much talent go underutilized over the years, and believe it has largely been due to many people having a natural aversion to innovation, which always brings change. Change is necessary in today’s business world and building a team of serial optimizers who seek constant incremental improvement can be just the strategy to get your team on board.

Outside of writing, John enjoys time with his wife and two young boys traveling and being in the outdoors, hiking, biking and swimming. He is also a life long learner with relentless curiosity to better understand the world.

For more information, you can connect with John at jcs301@georgetown.edu as well as on LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #innovation #leadership #authors #mindset and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
John Saunders

Hello there!

Do you think youth should be more present in the polls this coming October in the Canadian Federal Election?

Well, we sure do!

We're going to make a comedic video about Harper to mobilize Youth in Canada to vote in the coming October election.

We've got the brains, the guts and the glory, but we lack a few essentials!

The funds collected from this campaign will go towards:

Location Rental
Craft Services
and Film Equipment

If you want to see a change in youth's attitudes towards democracy, lend us a hand!

Here we go Canada, it's time to exercise your right to vote!

story:
In the world of Beagle adventures

(Croatian backers keep scrolling :)

When you hear a loud bark in the morning, you know it’s time to get up and go out. Whether it is dark, rainy and cold November or hot sunny July, I’m blessed to have adventures every day. Everyone who had a beagle pet in their lives will know about this feeling, and hopefully all the others will find out through Adventures of Oscar The Beagle.

Many times, Oscar’s nose got him in trouble, but we kind of look at it as though it was his superpower, and if we compare his sense of smell to human, it certainly is. The series of books is therefore appropriately named Adventures of Oscar the Beagle. Oscar has been a devoted family member for nine beautiful years, and he is also a fictional character in the series of children books, along with his fictional friends based on real life characters, a boy Noel, Dear Dave, Moe the Jolly Rabbit, Noel’s mother and many other. 

Broken Chair is the title of the first book in the series. Tom Skerlets, the illustrator, finished his great job on maiden book, and now he is in the process of illustrating Little Yellow Ball. The Trouble with the Pie is waiting its turn.

(more on Oscar's stories )

I’m (Dinko) the author of the books. I am a long time short stories writer and a professional journalist and editor. After the birth of my son I turned to children literature. We love to read children books to our son, and in all those rich and inspiring titles, something was missing. In reading/telling stories family ritual I realised that our Oscar was true inspiration. His funny, sometimes mischievous adventures started to become stories that aspire to fulfil this void.

With your help, we could reach much wider audience and that is our main goal. The plan is to publish the first three picture books on Amazon in mid October, and Indiegogo campaign will help us make that deadline reality.

 

Ask not what campaign can give you, ask what you can give to the campaign

In short, we will spend the campaign budget on production and promotion. More specifically, 35% will go for finishing illustrations in Adventures of Oscar the Beagle books. The next 15% are the costs of proofreading and professional editing support, while the remaining part of Indiegogo funding will go for promotion after we publish first three books in autumn.

For your support there are a few cool rewards. Our gratitude and personal note is the first step and it will go to everyone that help us. Adventures of Oscar the Beagle in an ebook form, tabloid size poster, paperback edition, t-shirt, custom illustration and hardcover copy for most enthusiastic supporters are in store. Check out our perks and pick one, we think they are worth the money.

 

Wonderfull Beagle world

“Once upon a time” is probably the most used first sentence in fairy tales. For me, it brings out great feelings of being around your children just before they go to sleep. Reading to your kid is surreal experience, time for bonding and learning about words, things, language and situations while being totally relaxed at the same time.

Wonderful world of Oscar’s adventures will try to insert itself into this sacred ritual of reading to or with children.

#realoscar

Oscar came to us in a box. Once freed, Oscar instantly went into a Beagle frenzy sniffing around the flat, looking for who knows what. He had the squeaky voice, clumsy legs, and infinite cute factor. This anarchist, cat among dogs, punk rocker out of the box became our pack member with a bit of his own agenda. Years passed by, and Oscar enjoyed long walks, running on the river bank, in a dog park, playing with other dogs and his pack. Then in his fourth year, we moved to the countryside, he got his backyard, frequent encounters with rabbits and deer, and a lake where he would swim almost every day. Oscar was (and still is) a proud and strong male Beagle, so handsome that he became popular among female Beagle owners, and in a couple of love meetings, he got a total of 16 little Beagle pups.

Oscar's health issues

Oscar developed allergies, and first blooming of plants sends him in itching and scratching phase, and as though that wasn’t enough, in his eight year he got diabetes. We check his sugar levels couple of times during the day and he gets his insulin shots accordingly.

Besides his not so great health, and a couple of gray hairs, he is same untamed Beagle hound. If you come to our garden party, chances are you will throw him his yellow ball a few hours. Loud bark, and waving his tail like crazy is his way to say welcome. Woof, woof, don’t just stand there, throw me the ball. So, you see, Oscar is a true inspiration, real life character for a fictional tales in Adventures of Oscar the Beagle children book series.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our main goal is promotion of our work. We feel confident about the Oscar books, children so far liked them and main hurdle is to wrap up production on time and make quality promotion. Books are already written, illustrations are half way through, but there is a lot to do in postproduction and once published we need funds to let people know that extraordinary Adventures of Oscar the Beagle are just one click away.

 

Support Adventures of Oscar the Beagle

  • Share our campaign on your Facebook page
  • Promote Indiegogo campaign on Instagram and Snapchat
  • Follow and share Oscar on oscarbeaglebook.wordpress.com, Instagram adventuresofoscarthebeagle, Twitter @Oscar_Beagle and Facebook page Adventures of Oscar the Beagle and spread the word about upcoming book series
  • Send us your funny Beagle (or other dogs) moments at oscarbeaglebook@gmail.com with subject funny dog moments and we will publish it on our web and maybe it can became one of Oscars next adventures

 

Meet the Team Behind the Book

 

Dinko Kadi- author

I’m an editor in a technology magazine, ex TV journalist and with brief career in daily newspapers and radio. When my family expanded, one of the best ways of bonding with my son was reading. World of children books and picture books lured me, and step by step the idea for Adventures of Oscar the Beagle came, partly because our beagle hound is full of inspiration. Entering the world of children literature changed my perspective on the writing process. It’s an experience I would recommend to every aspiring writer.

Tom Skerlets – Illustrator

Tom Skerlets is an acknowledged Croatian illustrator, writer and designer. He wrote many science fiction short stories for domestic collections and webzines, as well as many comic book scripts. He is best known for doing comic stories about famous Croatian athletes, Janica Kostelić and Goran Ivanišević. Tom primarily illustrates children books and picture books. He is the official illustrator for “The bear detectives” children book series. Somewhere along the way his path crossed with Dinko’s, and their similar interests blend together in creating world of Oscars adventures. Oscar the Beagle and other characters came alive under Tom’s magic pen. Professionally, he works as a designer in a German animal food corporation, but also for many other clients.

Avanture bigla Oskara

Dragi backeri, Tomislav i ja radimo na tri slikovnice u seriji priča Avanture bigla Oskara. Rad na prvoj je završio, trenutačno se ilustrira druga, a kada se završi i treća knjiga krećemo u prodaju na Amazonu. Vaša potpora nam je bitna kako bi završili s produkcijom slikovnica, ali i zbog promocije i kako bi istaknuli Oskarove avanture u mnoštvu izdanja na Amazonu. Svi koji nas podrže svoje će perkove dobiti na hrvatskom jeziku, počevši od knjiga, postera, preko majica i ilustracija s posvetom. Avanture bigla Oscara traže svoj put na najveće svjetsko tržište, a u isto vrijeme se nalaze kod hrvatskih izdavača i čekaju zeleno svjetlo. U slikovnici Oscar je glavni lik, njegov najbolji prijatelj je dječak Noel, a stalni likovi su zec Mato i Jelen Luka, te majka. Dio u pričama je labavo utemeljen na stvarnim anegdotama, no veći dio je čista fikcija s nekim dodirnim točkama u karakteru likova. Oskarove avanture naglašavaju važnost povjerenja, obitelji i prijatelja, a glavna je ideja da postanu dio literature koju čitate djeci ili sa djecom. U mojoj obitelji, čitanje je jako važno i nastojimo to pretvoriti u svakodnevni ritual boreći se s televizijom i pametnim telefonima. Koristi su naravno višestruke, a iskustvo je toliko pozitivno da me je pokrenulo u stvaranje vlastitih priča za djecu u kojima je naš dugogodišnji član obitelji Oskar poslužio kao inspiracija, jer je svaki dan s njim u šetnji prava avantura :)

story:
Anna Claire: Diabetes Extraordinaire is a children's book written by the mother of a child with Type 1 Diabetes.  

I have served for almost ten years as a children's and diabetes advocate and volunteer for The Diabetes Foundation of Mississippi as a Family Outreach Ambassador. The first book began as a way to give back to this wonderful organization that has been instrumental in supporting and educating many Mississippi families. Anna Claire: Diabetes Extraordinaire has developed into a small book series, aimed at helping children and families affected by Type 1 Diabetes. My goal is for Anna Claire to guide children through new events, such as their first day of school, first sleep over, or a weekend at diabetes camp.

What We Need & What You Get

  • My goal is to print 400 books, donating at least 100 to The Diabetes Foundation of Mississippi to distribute in "We Care 2" backpacks for newly diagnosed children with Type 1 Diabetes. 
  • Funding would also be used to secure an artist to illustrate the first book.
  • Once funded, books will be available for purchase online.
  • If my funding goal is not reached, all funds not secured to a book order will be used for the publication of books for donation to The Diabetes Foundation of MS. Illustrations may be provided by a volunteer or student. 

The Impact

Every day hundreds of children are diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. T1D is an autoimmune disorder, in which the pancreas cannot produce insulin.A person with T1D must receive Insulin injections multiple times a day for the rest of their lives. Despite this, many live a completely normal life, with diabetes on board. However, many children have a hard time adjusting to changes that include shots, finger sticks and blood glucose testing. Spending time with children who also live with diabetes is often a huge inspiration once realize that they aren't alone and have a friend who understands. I hope that Anna Claire can be helpful to kids who do not have a friend "like them".
  • Anna Claire is a REAL little girl. Her name has been changed for privacy reasons, but each story is based on my daughters experiences and life since her own diagnosis.
  • Children also enjoy sharing these stories with their friends. Books about Type 1 Diabetes give children a chance to learn about this disease without putting their friend or classmate in the spotlight, this also allows questions without intruding on the privacy of the child with diabetes.

If you can't contribute, you can still help!

Please share this information so that other families affected by Type 1 diabetes can learn about this project. 

I chose to use Indiegogo for this campaign in addition to my own social media because they are extremely efficient at helping to get the word out.  Use their tools on this site to share Anna Claire's story. 

And that's all there is to it. Thank you!

story:
A Knight Before Christmas

A Knight Before Christmas is a children's rhyming story picture book. When a dragon appears in the North Pole and starts wreaking havoc, Santa must travel back in time to find a brave knight to help him! I wrote the story originally over 10 years ago and never released it. Thanks to the ease of digital publishing, this updated version will be illustrated and released as an e-book before Christmas this year. If you back this campaign you will receive a DRM Free PDF download of the book which can be viewed or printed from any compatible device, and everyone who backs from just £1 will get their name in the back of this special edition!

Season of giving and receiving!

Basically I'm hoping to raise funds to upgrade my computer and software used to produce the digital illustrations, any money raised will go towards that. In return you will get the PDF storybook as mentioned above (with YOUR NAME in the back!)* and on higher tiers I will also be offering original pencil production artwork made during the creation process!

*want to buy it as a christmas gift for a loved one? you could put THEIR NAME in the back instead!

The Impact

Having been busy on projects for other people most of the year I wanted to finally bring out my own book before Christmas (as it's a Christmas story). Your contributions will help to speed things up creating the book and just by sharing the project will help raise awareness about the story.

I recently illustrated a book www.sharesomesecrets.com for top UK author Christina Gabbitas which will give you a better idea of my art style. I'm also working on video game artwork and various cartoon strips and art which you can see on my regularly updated twitter account www.twitter.com/@cartoonsbyRic and website blog at www.puttycad.co.uk

Risks & Challenges

Having successfully completed a crowdfunded set of 12 digital comics as well as working on the book mentioned above I am confident I can deliver the digital PDF book on time. (original art will be at the mercy of the post office but I will do my best to get it out to backers as early as possible before Christmas!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project with everybody you can using the indigogo tools and through your social networking channels!

story:
Francis was a painter, a journalist, a designer, a rescuer of animals, a loving son, a beloved friend, and the love of my life for 41 years. However, if you asked Francis what he was, he would first and foremost have described himself as a poet. It was something he lived and breathed, it was the truest expression of his soul. It was so personal to him that for the most part he didn’t even share it with me, though we shared everything else. We were a couple for so long that people tended to see us as a single unit. I loved that he had this one part of his life that he called his own, one that was not absorbed into the “us” and “we” of “Francis and Bruce”. It was truly his secret world, where he could commune with his innermost spirit.
Over the years, I urged Francis to publish this book. While he often agreed, it seemed that he was reticent to let it out into the world. Public criticism and rejection of work that was so deeply personal hurt him immensely. He was so sensitive to the opinions of people he respected that the idea they might not understand or connect with his work terrified him. I think he knew that only after his death could this collection be published.
Over the last week, since Francis’ death, many have asked me if there is anything that they could do to make this time easier for me. My answer is this: please join with me to celebrate Francis’ life by publishing this work in the style and manner that a great painter, journalist, and poet would have wanted. While I have the resources to do this myself, it would mean so much more to Francis that gifts freely given by his friends, peers, and loved ones demonstrated their love for him and their belief in his great talent.
The money that I am raising for this campaign will go to independently publishing THE GREAT GODS, so that it may be distributed among his friends and colleagues. Regardless of amount, anyone who donates to the cause will receive two copies of the book, one for themselves and one to donate to their local public library. It was important to him, as the last of the Toohey line, that his work live on. THE GREAT GODS will be published in trade paperback form. It will be released and shipped in time for his memorial service, to be held this December in the Boston area. The book will also include an audio recording of Francis reading the poems, so that his friends may hear his voice once again. Any excess funds will be used to publish more copies to be donated to libraries and to friends who were not in a position to donate, or who may not have heard of the campaign in time.
In addition to the book, all donors will receive a small piece of Francis’ original artwork as a memento, and will be listed as contributors in alphabetical order. Next spring, they will also receive a copy of Francis’ unpublished short stories, which are currently being compiled and edited by Rebecca Baker. These include his final work “The Last Amanar”.
As most of you know, for 41 years Francis and I worked together on every project we set out to do. Thank you, to all our friends, for helping Francis and I with our final project together.
Any funds not used for publication, in addition to any royalties received from the sale of the book on Amazon or elsewhere, will be donated in Francis’ name to Rescate y Protección Animal, a no-kill shelter in our neighboring town of Jurica, México.

Thank you, to all our friends, for helping Francis and I with our final project together.Any funds not used for publication, in addition to any royalties received from the sale of the book on Amazon or elsewhere, will be donated in Francis’ name to Rescate y Protección Animal, a no-kill shelter in our neighboring town of Jurica, México.

story:
Hi and thank you for clicking on my page!

My name is Lauren and I am a freshman at Great Oak High School.  I'm also the president of our school's chapter of, I AM THAT GIRL!  

I am part of a Movement that is changing the way girl's perceive themselves in all aspects of their life today. I AM THAT GIRL (IATG) has been a major impact in my life, and has made my New journey into highschool a smoother one. This community has also been a positive impact on 18 other amazing girls and growing in our club today.  Our IATG family has sparked new friendships, discovered individual talents, created a positive outlet for everyday stresses through high school, and a group of future leaders committed to creating change for the better; while inspiring each other, our school mates, our community and seeing the Best in ourselves.  

I am honored to be chosen as one of fifteen chapter leaders (out of 100 Chapters Worldwide) to attend IATG's very first leadership retreat to cultivate connections, amazing conversations, and leadership skills, and learn as much as we can to bring back to our chapters and spread IATG's message even further in our community.  In order for me to attend this once in a lifetime experience, I need some help fundraising $500 (anything over is even better <3) by October 6th for this phenomenal organization.

Your support would mean the absolute world to me, and your donation, any amount would be greatly appreciated!   I will keep you updated on how IATG has impacted me, our school, and how it can continue to making ground-breaking leaps in the future.  As a bonus, IATG is also a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization so your donation is tax deductible.

 If you would like to learn more about I AM THAT GIRL, please visitwww.iamthatgirl.com . 

Thank you! BeYoutiful, BeStrong, BeYou!

Lots of Love,

Lauren Suthers

story:
Over the past years I have come to realize one thing: "How are you?" is a loaded question - almost as potent as "Who are you?" and "Where have you been?".

These questions haunt us, and if we were to be really honest, test our willingness to be transparent about the things for which we are the most ashamed.

What if you were sentenced to carry around a suitcase of regret every day for the rest of your life? How would you respond to an invitation to set it down, and exchange it for unconditional love? 

This is a book about the walls we build around our hearts, and the grace that chases the shame away. It is first and foremost a love story founded on the building blocks of an invitation, an open door, and a light that remains.

So pull up a chair and sit down at the Table.

Let me tell you a story...

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello!

My name is Tyler Talbert and on June 8th, I will be traveling to South Korea for two weeks in preparation for future mission work. I am a Junior Religious Studies major at the University of Findlay and am looking at a future in mission.

I will be going to South Korea for two purposes. The first is to learn about and absorb as much of the culture as I can. The second is to make connections with churches and ministries so that I can be involved in there. I will be specifically looking for groups that minister to resettled North Koreans and that are preparing for missions to North Korea. During the past few years, God has given me a desire for justice for those who live on the fringes and I hope to do God’s will in both administering justice and the Gospel. This trip is the first step for me to do these things for the Korean people.

That being said, while this is a personal trip and I am not going through a larger organization, it is not a vacation. I will be doing a lot of work to learn the language and a lot of travel to speak with different churches and ministries.

Above all else, I need your prayers, Jesus name has the power to overcome and He ultimately holds the keys to his Kingdom, but I will also need help in funding this endeavor. If you are able, I would appreciate any donations that you can make toward this trip. Please share this with anyone who you think would be interested as well. It will be both a blessing and an honor to be a part of the mission of God with you. The ticket to get there and back costs about two thousand dollars and it’s estimated that I will need about eighteen hundred dollars for travel and expenses while I am there.

Thank you for your prayers and your time. I look forward to this experience and finding what God has called me to do.

God Bless,

--Tyler Talbert--

story:
I Want to Empower You

Return to Ease: Gently Reconnect with Your Body's Natural Mobility and Joy is more than a book.  It is a project that has taken on a life of its own.  I originally wanted to write a book to help people feel more comfortable in their bodies, easily and on their own, but it became so much more than that during the process of writing.

I have been in the business of empowering people for over 15 years.  I am a massage therapist, and I have seen the discomfort people experience in their bodies.  And I have also witnessed the profound opening that happens in a person's life when this discomfort is released.  Although I help my clients every day to achieve that release, I wanted to help people experience the gift of ease on their own and with their own hands.  A way to empower my clients and those around them to create a daily practice of returning to the natural ease, mobility, and joy we are all seeking.

Enter the idea for this book.  The most wonderful thing about that ease, mobility, and joy we are seeking is that we don't need to look very far.  That abundance is our natural state so it is within each one of us.  The ease we are searching for is hiding underneath the restrictions we experience - we just need some simple, easy tools to uncover it.

I wrote this book to empower you to claim your ease, your mobility, and your joy!

About the Book

What do you need to know about this book?  Only everything! Luckily "everything" is simple and easy, and that's what makes it so profound in my life and to everyone else who has read the book or participated in the book's creation.

The Basics: Return to Ease is separated in four major sections:

Let's Get Started:  This section explains the purpose of the book, the hidden messages of our discomfort and restrictions, how we can return to our natural state of joy and mobility, and how we can connect with the beauty within us and around us.

Let's Get Centered:  Before entering into a physical journey, it is important to align your mind and spirit with your body.  In this section, I've provided some great strategies and tools to help you do this: grounding techniques, a body scan and meditation, breathing techniques, and a gratitude practice.

Let's Get Moving:  Here's the physical movement to gently and comfortably create more ease in your body! I have compiled the most effective and enjoyable self-care available with foam rollers, the Super Pink Ball, gentle movement, and stretching.  This section includes written instructions for all of the techniques along with 49 professional photos of each technique in motion.  You don't need anything else but your body, a couple of simple tools (a soft foam roller and a Super Pinky Ball), and five minutes each day.  That's all - simple, enjoyable, and effective in the privacy of your own home and on your own time!

Expanding Your Skills:  So once you have explored and adventured through the book, I want to keep your expansion moving outward!  I have compiled the best resources to my knowledge to help further your journey.  These select books, websites, and other resources are available to you with a explanation from me as to why they have been helpful to me and the clients with whom I work on a regular basis.

The Beauty in This Journey

What you will notice as you are navigating and exploring your way through the mind, body, and spirit techniques is that this book is simply beautiful and breathtaking.  This is not an accident.  There are four photographers who have contributed work to this amazing project:

  • Greg Whitely: Austin, Texas
  • Catherine Murray: Columbus, Ohio
  • Megan Bohlander: Columbus, Ohio
  • Ivan Kislov: Russia

There are 15 nature photos carefully matched with inspirational quotes placed strategically throughout the book.  These photos are a reflection of the beauty within us and also the beauty around us.  We can only see that which already lives and grows within us, and that is why we are all drawn to the beauty and majesty of these photos.  I want everyone who picks up this book to feel, embrace, and embody their inner beauty.

Why Me?

I have experienced first hand with my own daily practice what works to identify and release the tension in our bodies.  Everything in this book is a product of my experimentation with myself and the work I do with my clients.

Why You?

At this point in the process, I need your help to bring this book to life and have it printed.  I have poured everything into this book: my heart and soul, all of the loving kindness and compassion within me, and the dreams I have for all of you.
I am so committed to my vision for this book that I realized early on I would need to self-publish.  I wanted to create the book that we all need, not a book that would fit into a publisher's niche.  This book is different.  It is beautiful and gentle and inspiring.  It wouldn't be all of those things if I had to adhere to a publisher's template and ideas for a book using foam rollers and balls.
It takes tens of thousands of dollars and a team of highly specialized people to publish the book that I envision for us.  And now is the time for me to turn over the reins:  to empower you to help us bring this book to life.  I need to raise $20,000 in order to print this book.  I can't do this alone, but together we can create the physical product that we all need and want.
Join me.  Together we can be ambassadors of Ease and Joy!

Risks & Challenges

This project is in its final stages.  All the printing details have been worked through, including the first prototype.  The editor, graphic designer, and photographers have all played their parts to bring you an excellent high-quality product.  The rewards are in place, the post office has been consulted, the cover design is finalized, the marketing plan has begun, and I am ready to do whatever it takes to share our book with everyone!

What could go wrong? Oh, plenty of things.  We could have a printing glitch, items could get lost in the mail...but I'm up for whatever challenges arise and I have surrounded myself with a cavalry of skilled people who believe in this project as much as I do.  We will be able to work through anything that comes our way.  Everything always comes together in the end.

This project is ready to come to you, but only if you lend your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Questions

If you have any questions about the Perks or anything else, please send us a message and we'll help find the answer!

More About the People Behind the Book

The amazing photographs of the techniques were taken by Catherine Murray. Amber Deafenbaugh did all the hair for the studio shoot, including an original braid and bun combo for Amelia.  Joy Macke had us putting our best faces forward with natural looking makeup.  Heather Doyle Fraser is the editor of the book.  The four models of the techniques deserve special thanks for their patience, humor and generous donation of time--they did a great job! The two adults models are my friends: Kim Larosa and Heath Sunkle.  The two youth models are my kids: Matt and Amelia Barnes.
And a huge thank you to Heather Doyle Fraser and Laura Walker for their help and assistance in getting this project off my desk and into the world.

About the Video

Filming and editing:  Kevin Schoot McIntyre: FWD: Video + Promotion.  Music: Scientist (Album: World Cookbook Instrumentals.  Song: Engagement). Hair and Makeup: Audrey Gabrill.

story:
Media makes a difference

  • Positive News is a media source that contradicts the destruction of corporate media, by highlighting stories of cooperation, kindness, peace, environmental justice, people power and so much more.
  • We provide free newspapers at newsstands, community centers, and cafes around the Bay Area as well as subscriptions delivered to individuals and communities all over the US.
  • We inspire others to make a difference and stand up. Our printed quarterly paper reached 30-50,000 people per issue. We inspire readers to think outside the box and be creative in the face of injustice.
  • We are building a FREE online database that will collect and organize Positive Historical events from the ancient past to the present.

We need to raise at least 40,000$ 

(You can contribute using credit card or paypal on this site. Also we accept cash, check or money order to: Positive News, PO Box 582, Bolinas, CA 94924)

Funds go to:

  • Printing
  • Editing and design
  • Distribution
  • Daily digital news
  • Positive History

Positive praxis

Our paper connects people with change makers and shows us how others are making a difference in this world.
  • When we see people doing well it inspires us to do well to.
  • People need to see that good things are happening all over the world, and that individuals and groups can make a difference.
  • Our readership has grown consistently since we began in 2002.
  • We have always operated on a shoe-string budget with each of us donating significant portion of our time because we care about the work that much.

Testimonial:

"As a documentary film maker I'm always on the look out for interesting stories, and ways of telling them that inspire people. The mainstream media puts so much emphasis on  destruction and violence, it leaves us feeling helpless. Positive News is an outlet that changes the narrative, showcasing the myriad of stories about people making a difference. We need more of this to keep us going, to shift the way we think, and inspire one another to make the world better together." 
~ Sam Green  (http://samgreen.to)

Why newspaper?

With so much attention on the internet and new digital devices some ask, why make a printed newspaper anyway?

  • Printed media is pleasing to the human brain. Studies have shown that people who read on printed paper retain more than those who read on screens. (University of Oregon) 
  • Pass it on! You can always email a story to someone, but its a real treat when someone cuts out an article that made them think of you. Positive News is a good way to connect with people you know, and can be a great conversation starter. 
  • We have seen that people want the paper and want to know where it is. This fundraising campaign will help us continue to grow our outreach and distribution. 
  • Our readership has been steadily growing over the past ten years and we want to keep that going! The growth of our paper depends on distributing widely, and the printed format assures that we reach people of all walks of life, including those who rarely use computers. 
  • Archivability is an important part of printed media. Once we print it we can't change it. We've seen how the internet has changed over the past twenty years, and recently with the battle for net neutrality we see even more reason to continue printing history as its made. 

How bout a tweet?

If you want to support us but can't spare a dime, you can make (perhaps) an even bigger contribution to our campaign by spreading the word!

  • Find us on Facebook and share with your friends: https://www.facebook.com/PositiveNewsUS
  • Tweet this link to your followers, and #positivenewus or @positive_source whenever you see something that reminds you of us:)
  • You can also volunteer with us if you have time...

Have you seen our perks?

Tote bags made by the feminist cooperative, Art Bison Design Coop and Kazoo Studios.

Hoodie sweatshirts made by the feminist cooperative, Art Bison Design Coop and Kazoo Studios.

A newspaper box made by the Positive News team with box and papers delivered to a location of YOUR CHOICE for the year of 2015. 

And much much more. Check out our perks and see what tickles you!
