We need more of this to keep us going, to shift the way we think, and inspire one another to make the world better together." 
~ Sam Green  (http://samgreen.to)
   Why newspaper?
  With so much attention on the internet and new digital devices some ask, why make a printed newspaper anyway?  Printed media is pleasing to the human brain. Studies have shown that people who read on printed paper retain more than those who read on screens. (University of Oregon) 
Pass it on! You can always email a story to someone, but its a real treat when someone cuts out an article that made them think of you. Positive News is a good way to connect with people you know, and can be a great conversation starter.  We have seen that people want the paper and want to know where it is. This fundraising campaign will help us continue to grow our outreach and distribution. 
Our readership has been steadily growing over the past ten years and we want to keep that going! The growth of our paper depends on distributing widely, and the printed format assures that we reach people of all walks of life, including those who rarely use computers. 
Archivability is an important part of printed media. Once we print it we can't change it. We've seen how the internet has changed over the past twenty years, and recently with the battle for net neutrality we see even more reason to continue printing history as its made.     How bout a tweet?
 If you want to support us but can't spare a dime, you can make (perhaps) an even bigger contribution to our campaign by spreading the word!   Find us on Facebook and share with your friends: https://www.facebook.com/PositiveNewsUS
 Tweet this link to your followers, and #positivenewus or @positive_source whenever you see something that reminds you of us:)
You can also volunteer with us if you have time... 
 

Have you seen our perks?


Tote bags made by the feminist cooperative, Art Bison Design Coop and Kazoo Studios.


Hoodie sweatshirts made by the feminist cooperative, Art Bison Design Coop and Kazoo Studios.A newspaper box made by the Positive News team with box and papers delivered to a location of YOUR CHOICE for the year of 2015. And much much more. Check out our perks and see what tickles you!

story:
Our Story

Imagine a child (poor or rich) facing life disruptions caused by divorce or relocation, finding out that even with such circumstances she/he can still become President of the United States.  Would that help keep their hope up and foster their belief in their own potential?  We think so and we want to tell that story using innovative technology.


At Sharing-Books We help authors of children books e-publish and find an audience.  And we invest time and effort in developping interesting children books into interactive books for tablets.  We do this because we believe tablets will soon become an important education tool for children, and because we have committed to give 1/3 of the sales revenue from these books to help Room to Read accomplish its mission to foster literacy and education gender equality in developping nations.  The author and illustrator get another 1/3 of the book revenue, and we operate a very lean team with the last 1/3. And of course we have a lot of fun building these interactive books!


We are seeking your investment to help us fund the development of an interactive tablet book called The Island Child.  This is a book relating the first ten years of Barack Obama's life.  It is not a partisan book.  It simply tells the story of a child with a disrupted early life who is now President of the United States.  It shows to children living similar circumstances that they have great potential.  We love the book and we want to create an interactive book with it.


This is our second interactive book.  You can find more about the first one at www.augusterodent.com


The Impact

Whether you are a democrat or a republican, right wing or left wing, you will see the value of the real lesson of this book.  Barack Obama's early life was highly disrupted.  This is the reality of a large number of children today who are caught in separations, divorces and multiple re-locations.  The universal lesson here, the hope to share with children, is that you can still become President of the United States even if your childhood has been disrupted by events outside your control. 


This lesson is intuitive, Oklahoma storyteller Loralee Cooley sticks to describing the first ten years of President Obama's life from a child's perspective.  She did extensive research and added a wealth of factoids about the various locations where President Obama lived.  These factoids offer us opportunities to develop interactive features to keep young readers entertained while learning.


The book has been illustrated by Kingston, Canada, artist Jilian Hulme Gilliland using a black and white ink drawing style that gives the book a great charm.  Sharing-Books designer Drea Morin, an Adobe Design Achievement Award Nominee based in Santa Monica, will enhance the book using a silouhette style and prepare it for interactive features.  Sharing-Books visual communicator Kelsey Armour, also an Adobe Design Achievement Award nominee will turn our ideas into reality.  This is a US-Canada collaboration of artists devoted to children.

What We Need & What You Get

Because we keep everything virtual, we are extremely efficient with our funds.  We are seeking $9,000 to pay for the time of the digital artists involved.  This is a minuscule budget for this type of project, but we have learned much from our first interacitve book and we know we can produce a quality interactive book very fast.


We hope that by investing in this project you will get the same sense of purpose we feel in telling a story that will inspire kids living a disrupted childhood. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, like all IndiGoGo campaigns, we need and appreciate your help in passing our project to all your friends who you think will see the value of inspiring kids to believe they can overcome unfavourable circumstances.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
DIARIO QDL

Salve a tutti. Ecco a voi la prima edizione del diario di “Quelli del linguistico”, l’unico diario dedicato agli studenti del liceo linguistico. Siamo 2 ragazzi che hanno l’obiettivo di alleggerire le infinite ore di scuola, cercando di strapparvi una risata in mezzo a russo, francese, spagnolo, tedesco e chi più ne ha più ne metta. Durante quest’anno abbiamo dedicato moltissimo tempo ed energie alla realizzazione di questo progetto, e questa campagna è la realizzazione di un nostro sogno e il vedere ripagato ogni nostro sforzo. La parte fondamentale del progetto siete voi. 

COME FUNZIONA?

Per acquistare un diario e far sì che arrivi direttamente a casa tua entro l’inizio della scuola basta cliccare su una delle opzioni d’acquisto che si trova qua sotto. Seleziona l’opzione che preferisci e Indiegogo ti guiderà nell’acquisto. Il sito è assolutamente sicuro e il pagamento verrà confermato attraverso una ricevuta via mail. Tutta la procedura del pagamento è esclusivamente gestita dal sito.

COME UTILIZZEREMO I SOLDI RACCOLTI?

I soldi raccolti verranno utilizzati per pagare la stampa e la spedizione in tutta Italia del prodotto. Infatti noi, essendo normali studenti, non abbiamo la possibilità economica per auto-finanziarci. Per potervi fornire un diario di qualità abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere un obiettivo minimo, grazie al quale potremmo dare il via alla stampa e iniziare le spedizioni. L’acquisto su questo sito equivale a una prevendita: acquistando il diario durante i giorni della campagna, lo riceverete direttamente a casa entro fine agosto/primissimi giorni di settembre.

COSA RICEVERETE?

Facendo un ordine riceverete entro i tempi previsti il diario QDL direttamente a casa vostra. Ci sono varie opzioni d’acquisto: il diario QDL  base è lo stesso per ogni pacchetto, ma è possibile ricevere un diario firmato dagli admin oppure avere il proprio nome fra la menzioni speciali in fondo al diario. E’ inoltre possibile acquistare anche più diari contemporaneamente così da ricevere uno sconto (classi, amici, scuole). Per usufruire di questa possibilità è necessario contattarci attraverso la mail (quellidellinguistico@gmail.com) o tramite Instagram (@quelli_del_linguistico).

ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARE

L’acquisto del diario non è l’unico modo per supportare il progetto. Per aiutarci infatti potete parlarne con i vostri amici, i vostri compagni di classe e magari anche con i professori. Ci aiutereste infatti a spargere la voce il più possibile. 

Comunque vada la campagna ci teniamo a ringraziarvi per il supporto che ci avete dimostrato in questi mesi sulla pagina e che siamo sicuri continuerete a dimostrarci durante questa campagna. Ci state aiutando a realizzare un sogno, a portare avanti un progetto del quale voi siete la colonna portante. 
Grazie mille linguisti!

story:
Brina is a picture book that uses catchy rhymes and engaging illustrations to explore magic and modern witchcraft. Join Brina on an exploration of magical paths like green witchery, kitchen witchcraft, Wicca, and more as she considers the question: Which witch will I be? 

 

The final product will be a hardcover book with full color illustrations designed to inspire readers and expose kids to Pagan practices. This enchanting story will leave children and parents with the magical reminder that finding your path can be a bewitching journey -- even if you aren't sure where you'll end up. 

 

After fully funding on Kickstarter in less than 10 hours and meeting all of our stretch goals, we decided to roll the pre-order over onto InDemand for those who still wanted to order copies of the book while we work on illustration and production. 

 

There's a standard depiction of a witch in children's media: she has green skin and warts; she lives on the outskirts of society; and she's probably going to turn you into a frog.  Most books and movies about witches tell stories of Halloween, and consider the witch among the ranks of vampires, ghosts, mummies, and werewolves. In short, witches are scary. 

 

Enter the modern day where Wicca, witchcraft, and other forms of Pagan spiritualities have seen a huge resurgence. Estimates put the number of people in the United States practicing witchcraft in any form between 1 and 3 million. Despite this thriving and growing community, children's literature has not caught up. Brina fills this space by providing a fun and engaging book for kids that covers different paths and pantheons under the Pagan umbrella, tools used in witchcraft, and the journey of one little witch exploring facets of her spirituality.  

 

 

We've simplified the perks down from the original campaign to offer three tiers: the e-book, the book, and the wholesale bundle. Backers who order the e-book will receive it as soon as illustrations and formatting are complete, with an estimated date of December 2019.

 

The book tier includes the hardcover book and the e-book to read before you get your physical copy. A mock-up design of the book shows how the cover artwork looks in print, and what you can expect from the hardcover copies. Because we hit stretch goals on our original Kickstarter campaign, books will also have silver foil stamping on the cover and a linen bound spine. Books ordered during the campaign will be signed by the author, and U.S. shipping is built into the cost of all rewards. 

 

 

The wholesale bundle is available for retailers and small shops. Get 10 copies of the book at a wholesale discount, plus the e-book to check out before getting your copies to stock. This reward is also great for people who just LOVE books, and want to gift copies to friends, schools, libraries, and shelters. 

 

Hi, I'm Andi. I'm a first time children's book author living in Austin, Texas and raising one small, magical person. I love picture books, and after searching for a good book on witchcraft and Pagan practices for my daughter and coming up empty handed, I decided to write it myself. 

 

I was lovingly told by an editor that a traditional publisher wouldn't touch this book with a ten foot pole due to the "controversial nature" of the material, and I wanted to maintain creative control over the style and format, so I made the decision to self-publish. In the past six months, I've done a deep dive into the industry and researched the best way to get Brina printed as a high quality, hardcover book.  

 

 

I knew I needed an artist committed to the project who understood the content and the importance of this type of book, and then I met Cayce, owner and illustrator behind Earthereal Design here in Austin. We were immediately on the same page about what a book could look like, where to draw inspiration from, and who we needed to get this project in front of. We're working together to make Brina a reality, and we used Kickstarter to raise the initial costs for illustration, printing, shipping, and more. 

 

 

We're hit our goal and we're definitely going to print, but every book ordered still makes a difference. We're continuing the pre-order because people are still interested in buying the book for children in their life, and we'll keep raising funds to order more copies and put towards our next project! 

 

The book will completed according to the timeline outlined on Kickstarter in the original campaign, which can also be found here. 

 

If you have questions about the IGG perk levels, how to pledge, how crowdfunding platforms like this work, or virtually anything related to children's books or witchcraft, please shoot us an email at moondustpresspub@gmail.com and we'll be happy to chat. You can also find us online on our website, and on Facebook and Instagram. Thank you so much for your support of this project, and we're thrilled to be able to share this book with you.

story:
Story of My Book

Theory of Reality is the story of Emily, a closeted transgender male stuck in a seemingly constant environment, and Cole, a freshman new to the area and the idea of exploring identity, and their unique experiences with ethnic/LGBTQ+ identity, mental illness, and environment.

My name is Eli Mendoza and I am the author of Theory of Reality. Growing up, as absorbed as I could become in the worlds of young adult novels, I never felt fully reflected in them. Having a childhood filled with diverse people and experiences, I wanted to write a book based in my vastly underrepresented world. My hope is that, in reading the book, you will either see yourself in my characters or you will learn to see life through a new perspective.

Welcome to Rosedale. A mainly upper-middle-class suburb home to an influx of various cultural groups, known for its high-quality public schools and safe neighborhoods.

A trans teen who must go by Emily has lived here his whole life, and that’s far too long for him. Starting yet another year of high school while under the roof of an unaccepting mother and no father to be heard of, Emily is forced to live as a girl and endure bullying from his peers.

Cole just moved to Rosedale from the predominantly white suburb of Plano with his Spanish-speaking mother, so freshman year at Rosedale High is his fresh start. Having generally gone with the flow in life, how will being confronted with so many new situations affect Cole?

How could one person connect Emily and Cole and change their worldviews forever?

You will love this book if you love diverse, fleshed-out characters, alternative subcultures, and exploring mental health in teens.

Theory of Reality speaks to those with more complicated identities and those interested in mental health who want to grapple with ethnic/LGBTQ+ issues and undiagnosed mental illness in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Theory of Reality inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How do my reactions to certain situations relate or differ from the reactions of others based on our prior knowledge?
  • How can and do people of multiple identities interact, and is this different than what we consider “normal” interactions? Should the definition of “normal” be changed?
  • At what point are risky life decisions justified?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing how intersectional identities, mental illness, and environment impact people we know will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April of 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Eli Mendoza is an undergraduate student studying psychology and data science at Rice University in Houston. He hopes to get involved in research that helps the disabled and neurodivergent communities get what they need, not what other people think they need, as well as the history of LGBTQ+ representation in various cultures.

Eli wrote this book originally as a way to vent while tackling middle school, but it has since blossomed into becoming a publishable work! Eli has a big interest in psychology and culture, so being able to explore how different people think and how undiagnosed issues manifest is something Eli wants everyone to consider.

Eli loves martial arts, music, and video games. He has practiced three different styles of martial arts and has competed in both Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and shotokan karate. Some of his favorite genres of rock music are hardcore punk, visual kei, nu metal, and Scandanavian heavy metal. Eli also loves playing video games and manages a virtual streamer channel on Twitch. His friends tend to joke about his shortness and experimental alternative fashion, which he gladly accepts.

For more information, you can connect with Eli Mendoza at izzygetschooled@gmail.com and at @ e.l.i_mendoza_author on Instagram .
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheoryofReality and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Eli Mendoza

Growing up, as absorbed as I could become in the worlds of young adult novels, I never felt fully reflected in them. Having a childhood filled with diverse people and experiences, I wanted to write a book based in my vastly underrepresented world. My hope is that, in reading the book, you will either see yourself in my characters or you will learn to see life through a new perspective.Welcome to Rosedale. A mainly upper-middle-class suburb home to an influx of various cultural groups, known for its high-quality public schools and safe neighborhoods.A trans teen who must go by Emily has lived here his whole life, and that’s far too long for him. Starting yet another year of high school while under the roof of an unaccepting mother and no father to be heard of, Emily is forced to live as a girl and endure bullying from his peers.Cole just moved to Rosedale from the predominantly white suburb of Plano with his Spanish-speaking mother, so freshman year at Rosedale High is his fresh start. Having generally gone with the flow in life, how will being confronted with so many new situations affect Cole?How could one person connect Emily and Cole and change their worldviews forever?You will love this book if you love diverse, fleshed-out characters, alternative subcultures, and exploring mental health in teens.Theory of Reality speaks to those with more complicated identities and those interested in mental health who want to grapple with ethnic/LGBTQ+ issues and undiagnosed mental illness in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Theory of Reality inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
How do my reactions to certain situations relate or differ from the reactions of others based on our prior knowledge?
How can and do people of multiple identities interact, and is this different than what we consider “normal” interactions? Should the definition of “normal” be changed?
At what point are risky life decisions justified?

Thank you for sharing the love this holiday season by joining us at Seven Seas Press, as we gift this magical book to 250 four through eight-year-olds served by Girls Inc.

We chose this empowering organization for their commitment to supporting young girls educationally, interpersonally, and creatively, and inspiring them to be “Strong, Smart and Bold.”

For more information about Girls Inc., and the awesome work they do, click here.

Mermaid Dreams is the story of a young multiracial protagonist, Maya, who meets her namesake, the Yoruba Ocean Goddess, Yemaya, in a dream. They go on an undersea journey that inspires Maya to overcome her fears of the ocean and her nightmares. Mermaid Dreams offers the opportunity for more children to see themselves reflected in the magical mythology of mermaids. 

"A magical story that gives voice to scary dreams and explores the power to change their ending. The discussion questions and activities at the end of the book create many opportunities to expand conversations about myths, dreams and personal power. Plus, who doesn't wish to be a mermaid?”  says, Terri Allison, co-author, Moon Mother, Moon Daughter ~ Myths and Rituals that Celebrate a Girl's Coming of Age

The team at Seven Seas Press is passionate about the well-being of children. We pay close attention to world events that are affecting children, and connect with local, national, and international groups providing support. We partner with them to get our books to children and their caregivers in a timely way. Learn more: sevenseaspress.org

And now we want to partner with individuals like you, who would like to help make the holidays a little sweeter for some wonderful little girls. Thank you for joining us, and enjoying these special discounted rates for the duration of the campaign.

Please click on a “Perk" for more detailed information. If you don't see a perk that fits your needs, just send us a message (click on the red letters: Ask A Question, in the upper right of the campaign page by our logo) and we'll make one especially for you.

Thank you for your generous support. And please share our campaign with friends.

Seven Seas Press is a 501(c)3 Public Charity EIN 83-0792556. Donations of books and funds are fully tax deductible.

Story of My Book

It Can Happen To You: The True Stories of Waltham’s Homeless Community includes stories and insights from over 20 individuals experiencing homelessness within my college town, Waltham, MA. Over the course of four months, I had the unique opportunity to learn about each of their stories and how they perceive their community. You will hear the stories of individuals with college degrees and stables jobs, those who immigrated to America hoping for a better life, army veterans, and those who grew up in abusive households, subjected to sexual assault and drugs. You will hear stories from people who will most likely remind you of someone you know.

Hi, my name is Renée Nakkab and I am the author of It Can Happen to You, the True Stories Behind Waltham’s Homeless Community. I was compelled to write this book after I overheard a conversation walking behind a couple in Manhattan. The couple was making rash assumptions and generalizations about the people experiencing homelessness they were passing on the streets. They never asked these individuals why or how they came into their current situations, and instead relied solely on stereotypes and labels. After I heard the couple calling the homeless “alcoholic bums with nothing to live for”, I’d had enough. Therefore, I created this book as a method of facilitation. I believe everyone should have a defense if they would like one, thus this book gives people experiencing homelessness an opportunity to share their stories in hopes of combating the stereotyping and labeling they endure as a community. The book is written to inspire change.

My hope for this book is that it resonates in the hearts of those who read it. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for helping the homeless in you. After reading the different but unifying stories of people experiencing homelessness, I want readers to feel an urge to go help through volunteering, donation and activism. I want this book to inspire the next wave of homeless rights activists

In this book, you'll learn about the commonality and blindness of homelessness:

Homelessness does not discriminate. If you were a runt of the foster care system who faced constant physical and emotional abuse, a forced drug addict from age nine, an immigrant chasing the American dream or a masters degree recipient from a well-to-do family, you can become homeless. You will read about Serena, who received her masters degree from North Eastern University and had a stable job out of college that she enjoyed. Serena was also gang raped in her first week of undergraduate university, and when she wanted to press charges her wealthy parents stopped talking to her. Serena lost her familial ties, and due to lack of support fell in with a bad crowd. Serena could never have imagined she’d be homeless, let alone be homeless for the past two years.

It can happen to you. The reality is that no individual is safe from experiencing homelessness. The tables can turn within the blink of an eye and your entire world can turn upside down. As you read these stories, you will most likely find similarities between you, your family and your friends and those you read about. I urge you to gain a new level of empathy for these individuals after reading about their lives and how they came to this point.

People need your help. There are ways for you to contribute your altruism and aid to this dire situation. Whether it be through hands on approaches such as volunteering in a soup kitchen or donating a winter coat, or through more quantifiable approaches such as donating money or giving a person experiencing homelessness a job, there is a lot you can do.

You will love this book if you are an individual who wants to help. If you want to learn more about the homeless community and how to protect it through different methods of activism, then this book is for you.

It Can Happen To You: The True Stories of Waltham’s Homeless Community is a non-fiction book that speaks to advocates and doers who are looking at the real accounts of people experiencing homelessness and related statistics for the first time.

The Book: It Can Happen to You, the True Stories Behind Waltham’s Homeless Community

The book is written in Three Parts:
Part I contains the introduction and an informational chapter: Here you will learn how I overcame my initial biases, in addition to a more detailed rationale as to why I wrote the novel. Then I will explain what homelessness is and describe the social history of homelessness from the 1980s to present.

Part II contains the true accounts of people experiencing homelessness: Each chapter is an interview with a person experiencing homelessness. The purpose of these interviews is to display a diversity of situation. Each person’s story is so different, essentially proving that anyone can experience homelessness— including you.

Part III explains how you can help: This chapter will review the primary causes of homelessness and the overall patterns I have noticed within the interviews. Additionally, you will learn how to take action through volunteering, donations and providing a variety of support for people experiencing homelessness.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
With your help...
100 pre-sell physical copies = the book gets published
150 pre-sell physical copies = an audiobook gets published 
200 pre-sell physical copies = the hardcover edition gets published 
The goal of the pre-sell = getting the book published! 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Renée Nakkab is a sophomore at Brandeis University majoring in English, history and creative writing. She will spend her next academic year as a visiting student at Hertford College, Oxford studying legal history and English. This past summer, she studied international law at Leiden University in the Hague and observed the practice of international justice, first hand, at the International Criminal Court. Additionally, she has worked as a golf instructor, news letter assistant editor and legal advocate for asylum seeking immigrants.

Renée is on a mission to give a voice to those who have been silenced. She believes that this book can be a catalyst for greater change in how we see and help the homeless population. She is a passionate individual who is excited and ready for her work to impact those who read it.

For more information you can connect with Renée at rnakkab@gmail.com and as Renee Nakkab on Facebook and @NakkabRenee on Twitter.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network 
  • Please use #Helpingthehomeless and tag me, as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it
  • Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again and hope enjoy!
Renee Nakkab

story:
The Story of My Book

Being Together : Exploring Your Full Yes in Relationship

Being Together: Exploring Your Yes in Relationship is a non-fiction, self-help book that brings forth the lessons and stories from those who have experienced the ups and downs of relationships, insights from expert psychologists and personal accounts of the author. It introduces you to some of the most essential principles and simple tools needed to have a deliciously happy long-term relationship.

My name is Padma Gordon and I am the author of Being Together. I wrote this book because in my experience maintaining a long-term relationship where both people are truly happy and fulfilled is rare. It’s as if relationship is a holy grail. Over the past couple of years, I have been a dedicated student of relationship and have grown immensely. I figured that if I have been challenged and if so many relationships fail; I wanted to understand how to succeed — how to do it well and thrive together.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you too can have an amazing long-term relationship. You will grow. You will bump into your edges and want to dig your heels in and this book will offer you possibilities for how to make different choices, how to be a more skillful human and ultimately, how to offer yourself to love in the deepest sense. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for relationship in you. After all, being in a healthy relationship teaches you about love and love is what we are here for, yes? And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a resource to help you learn how to team play in relationship, be more self-aware, more self-loving and share your loving self with another human being so that you may receive the benefits of this. This book gives you a roadmap to happiness and opens the door to freeing yourself from the obstacles that may be keeping you from experiencing true and long-lasting love.

In this book, you'll learn about how to be more self-aware, how to be present, pause and interrupt your triggers, how to be more loving and generous with yourself and in your relationship:

*You will receive the wisdom from couples who have been together for 20 plus years

* You will learn how to forgive yourself and keep your heart open

* You will gain insights and knowledge from renowned relationship experts

* You will be introduced to techniques for cultivating loving presence

* You will laugh and you will relate

You will love this book if your are struggling in your relationship, if you are at the beginning of a relationship adventure, if you are a divorcee in a second marriage, or if you want to take your relationship to the next level. The tools and advice in this book will help you find the direction you need to have a peaceful, healthy and respectful and fulfilling relationship.

The Book - Being Together: Exploring Your Yes in Relationship

The book is structured into 12 chapters and a conclusion. We will travel together through the domain of intimate relationship starting with the relationship to ourselves and you will learn about some of the foundational principles of relating from a psychological and spiritual perspectives.

In the introduction, we begin our journey by acknowledging what it takes to have a thriving relationship and how the relational field must be tended to as you would tend a garden. The first stop along the journey lays the foundation by introducing attachment theory and the 3 primary attachment styles which form the basis for our adult relationships. You will also be introduced to a the love cocktail which we all drink when we fall in love. In the next couple of chapters, you will learn about the WE, what it means to function as a couple and how it is essential to consider that your actions directly effect your partner. You will learn about coupledom through Jeanne and Bill who spent 6 decades together. I will also share nuggets gleaned by renowned psychologist John Gottman in his “Love Lab” over the course of more than 30 years of research.

In Chapter 3, I will share about the value of making a commitment to your partner and how deep healing of childhood wounds is possible in the safe container of a relationship. In Chapter 4, you will learn about the power of being on a team and working collaboratively rather than competing with your partner. You will be introduced to simple practices that you can do to cultivate mindfulness in moments of challenge that may interfere with team play. In Chapter 5, we explore the power of good listening and the healing potential of being fully seen and heard by someone who loves you.

Chapter 6 dives into the practice of gratitude and how essential it is to appreciate your partner. Expect nothing and appreciate everything. In Chapter 7, you will learn about the intersection of forgiveness and generosity and how important it is to forgive in relationship. Chapter 8 covers the rich terrain of vulnerability and how it facilitates intimacy in the sexual arena and in everyday life with your partner. Throughout this section of the book, practices and meditations will be offered to assist you in cultivating gratitude, forgiveness and vulnerability in yourself and with your partner.

Chapter 9 brings us to the interplay of rupture and repair and you will learn about how to have a clean fight and “make up” or repair quickly. You will also learn about how to create win win solutions and these feel good! Chapter 10 is a fun one because it’s about the value of shared humor in relationship. Laughter is good medicine and you will discover how to use it to create closeness and dissipate conflict. Chapter 11 speaks to the value of offering your partner unconditional acceptance and how allowing them to be themselves will free them up to love more fully. You will also learn about the need for giving your partner space. I will share tools for how to navigate your feelings when your partner has a different need for space than you do which is often the case.

Chapter 12 takes us into the domain of how being in a relationship is an opportunity to evolve together. It is here that you will learn how compassion and staying the course can open the door to the realms of higher love making. Lastly, you will discover how important it is not to take things personally if you want your relationship to flourish.

Finally, we wrap it up in the Conclusion section. You will be glad you made it to the end of the book. Your life and relationship will be forever enriched. If you take the invitations I have offered in the book, your heart and partnership will thrive. I have applied it and let me tell you, it has made a world of difference in my relationship. It is thriving and yours will too!
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July of 2020

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

About the Author
Padma Gordon is a self-employed Spiritual Counselor and Mindfulness Teacher. She helps individuals and couples come home to themselves and fall in love with themselves, each other and with life!

She wrote this book because she is passionate about relationship as an evolutionary container and because having a thriving and juicy relationship is incredibly nourishing on all levels. Padma’s vision is for everyone who is called to experience the powerful fruits of being in a happy and sustainable relationship, so they can learn about love in the deepest way possible.

Story of My Book


The Age of Taylor Swift: How power in the music industry is shifting

My book is about how the music industry is at a pivotal point of change. Artists from X Ambassadors to Taylor Swift are using social media, streaming, and touring to release music, interact with their fan bases, and create social change in a different way. The path to success in music lies more in the hands of the fans directly rather than through typical industry means.

My name is Emily Gumbulevich and I am the author of The Age of Taylor Swift: How power in the music industry is shifting. I wrote this book because as a music fan myself, I was curious about why some bands are able to grow and achieve success while some others are not. In trying to answer that question, I uncovered the mystery behind the music industry has it has been and where it is going — and it’s heading towards a future where ordinary fans like me have more power than we thought to make an impact on the success of our favorite artists.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how much of an impact you can have on the success of your favorite artists. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you contribute to building a new music industry that has artists at the center and the top, not the bottom.

In this book you’ll learn about the music industry through time and what it means to be a good fan, including:

  • how Taylor Swift has used social media to challenge the status quo of the “old” music industry and expose the forces at work to siphon money from artists
  • how seemingly successful artists like DREAMDIVE still have to work side jobs to pay rent
  • how fans I interviewed and I were able to meet favorite bands and become friends with them, producing an extra special live music experience

You will love this book if you love seeing live music and want to better understand how the industry works.

The Age of Taylor Swift is a non-fiction book that speaks to music lovers and supporters of the arts who are looking at a brief history of the music industry and how fans have power in the industry.

The Book - The Age of Taylor Swift: How power in the music industry is shifting

The book is written in 3 parts....

  • Part 1 gives an overview of the problems with the current industry and the importance of seizing the chance for change at hand, a brief history of the music industry to date, and an overview of the current state of the industry. In part 1, I share the story of how I met HOLYCHILD’s Liz and Louie in 2015 which set me down the path that eventually led to this book.
  • Part 2 dives deeper into the reasons why we’re at such a pivotal moment for change in the industry and how fans can further perpetuate those conditions for change (while still having fun and enjoying the music they love). Part 2 includes branding advice from a Director of Marketing at LiveNation, stories from fans who have enjoyed live music all over the world, and an inside look at the life of an emerging artist.
  • Part 3 explores some of the new technology startups that are seizing the moment of change in the industry to help artists and concludes with a call to all fans to seize the day and help move the industry towards supporting the artist.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Spring

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Emily Gumbulevich is a Senior Product Manager of LogoMix, a small business branding platform, at Deluxe Corp. and founder of Pie for Bands Inc., an online marketplace for fans to connect to and support musical artists.

Emily has always had a passion for music — from dancing around her parents’ living room to Edie Brickell and the New Bohemians as a kid to singing in a touring choral group in high school, music has played a large part in her life. However, it wasn’t until 2015 when Emily started attending several live shows per month at venues big and small that she started to see the mystery in the music industry behind the art she loved so much. She became determined to see behind that curtain and ultimately try to fix the issues she uncovered.

Though it seems to be all she talks about lately if you were to ask her friends, Emily fills her time outside of live music with rock climbing, cooking for her friends, doing the New York Times crossword puzzle, and playing board games. She strives to be a better product and people manager at work and is often found geeking out over the latest from Marty Cagan.

For more information, you can connect with Emily at emily@soundtrakd.com and on Twitter at @eekaygee.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AgeofTSwift and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Emily Gumbulevich

story:
Short Summary

Hello, ninjit don chaa, how are you? My name is Matt Gilbert. I’m Gwich’in Athabascan. I grew up in Arctic Village, but travelled a lot in my young life, but moved back home to write my books. I have a Bachelors of Arts in English-Rhetoric and I have a Masters of Arts in Rural Development.

This is a Crowdfunding campaign to raise funds to finish my regional climate impact report and print copies of my finished Gwich’in Cartography Book. I am right at the Finish line with my 15 years of work among my people. You will help me finish my work once and for all, so I can retire and do other things.

You will no less than help me save my Gwich’in people’s culture. The Gwich’in landuse mapbook took me eight years to write and it’s now finished. My people have forgotten most of this landuse knowledge, but thanks to Rick Caulfield’s 1980 traditional mapping work and building off it, I will be able to restore this knowledge. The mapbooks are on trails and placenames on those trails, but also traplines and camps too.

The Gwich’in mapbook encompasses all six Gwich’in villages and the mapbooks have been sent to all the village councils. The second book is a regional climate impact report for the three main Gwich’in communities: Arctic Village, Venetie, and Fort Yukon. I did the first report in 2005 when I won a prestigious fellowship from the National Wildlife Federation and a matching grant from Arctic Borderlands Eco-Knowledge Network.

It was very thorough and first of its king. Sadly, it’s still is the first of its kind 15 years later, which is why I am trying to put it out. The US Fish & Wildlife Service financed me writing and producing the 2005 Gwich’in Climate Report, but UA Press says they are interested but want an Update.

I am writing the second 2020 Update Report now. It will be a very important book, because President Trump has pushed to develop the Arctic and the book can give Gwich’in a voice on the matter. These two books are going to be magnanimous and significant to the Gwich’in.

What We need & What you will get

I need $2000. It should be enough to make print copies of the mapbook and postage to distribute them to villages. The rest of the funds should cover my living expenses as I finish the 2020 Updates to the Regional Gwich’in Climate Impact Report.

The perks are Gwich’in Life Postcards I made. In the past, I had a hard time making copies for the donors, so this time I will email you PDF copies of the Gwich’in Life Postcards. You can make as many as you want.

Most importantly, you will ensure the Gwich’in preserve their land knowledge by granting me funds to distribute the books out to the Gwich’in communities. You will also ensure the Gwich’in have their voices out on climate change, when our President is bent on destroying the Arctic. They will also have a better sense of their landuse from my Gwich’in Cartography books too.

There is a chance the project may not be completed even with your funds, because it tends to take a lot longer than I expect. Nonetheless, I will work on it, even if I’m broke. I will continue to work until it’s done.

Even if I don’t finish the Regional Climate Report with your fund, I will get a huge amount of work done with your fund.

The Impact

The two books are important to you, because the Gwich’in books will be great contributions to our literature on the Arctic and its indigenous peoples. The books will assist the Gwich’in in reviving their culture. For the world entire, the Gwich’in Voice can contribute to the global climate change discussion and it is an important one. The indigenous peoples have an unmatched knowledge of the environment and they can assist the world with adaption and disaster plans.   

My track record speaks loudly about my ability to do this work, because I’m basically the only one doing this work and the only one who can. I wanted to quit many times, but realized if I didn’t do this work, no one would, because no one can and these Elders were getting old, so it left me with no choice but to do it.

I completed my thesis in 2010 on Translations of the Ancient Elder Stories of my village, then, it lead to a film on my grandpa visiting sites, and then it lead to the Gwich’in Mapbook Series that took eight years and the two Regional Gwich’in Climate Impact Reports. I have made many sacrifices and have done this work impoverished, because it doesn’t pay well. It has made my life hard, lonely, and isolated, so I am ready for it to end. I want to retire and do other things, you will help me with this goal.  

Please help me finish this for good.  

Risks & Challenges

There may be more obstacles for this work to be completed, but I have overcome them many times in the past and I can overcome them again. I have been tempered by hardship of poverty, danger, and sacrifice from this work, so I feel there is little I can’t handle to finish these two books.

The biggest obstacle will be poverty and lack of funding, so that is where you can help me. I am use to doing this for free and using regular jobs to cover living expenses to complete it, but I hope this does not happen (as it has many times) this time. I am confident your funds will be sufficient and I can avoid this being too much of a hardship.

Other Ways You can Help

The other way you can assist besides funds is offering connections of who can assist me in funding this project and printing copies of the books, so I can get them to the Gwich’in. If you have access to printing services or know someone who has printing services, do let me know.

I can also use your connections to distribute and get the word out on these books, so the Gwich’in will have their voices heard.

You can use the Indiegogo Share tool and share it online, so maybe others can fund my campaign as well!

Thank you all very much in advance

Mahsi Cho

Short Summary
Hello, ninjit don chaa, how are you? My name is Matt Gilbert. I’m Gwich’in Athabascan. I grew up in Arctic Village, but travelled a lot in my young life, but moved back home to write my books. I have a Bachelors of Arts in English-Rhetoric and I have a Masters of Arts in Rural Development.
This is a Crowdfunding campaign to raise funds to finish my regional climate impact report and print copies of my finished Gwich’in Cartography Book. I am right at the Finish line with my 15 years of work among my people. You will help me finish my work once and for all, so I can retire and do other things.
You will no less than help me save my Gwich’in people’s culture. The Gwich’in landuse mapbook took me eight years to write and it’s now finished. My people have forgotten most of this landuse knowledge, but thanks to Rick Caulfield’s 1980 traditional mapping work and building off it, I will be able to restore this knowledge. The mapbooks are on trails and placenames on those trails, but also traplines and camps too.
The Gwich’in mapbook encompasses all six Gwich’in villages and the mapbooks have been sent to all the village councils. The second book is a regional climate impact report for the three main Gwich’in communities: Arctic Village, Venetie, and Fort Yukon. I did the first report in 2005 when I won a prestigious fellowship from the National Wildlife Federation and a matching grant from Arctic Borderlands Eco-Knowledge Network.
It was very thorough and first of its king. Sadly, it’s still is the first of its kind 15 years later, which is why I am trying to put it out. The US Fish & Wildlife Service financed me writing and producing the 2005 Gwich’in Climate Report, but UA Press says they are interested but want an Update.
I am writing the second 2020 Update Report now. It will be a very important book, because President Trump has pushed to develop the Arctic and the book can give Gwich’in a voice on the matter. These two books are going to be magnanimous and significant to the Gwich’in.
What We need & What you will get
I need $2000. It should be enough to make print copies of the mapbook and postage to distribute them to villages. The rest of the funds should cover my living expenses as I finish the 2020 Updates to the Regional Gwich’in Climate Impact Report.

story:
Who is Carl, and what makes Amongst the Rubble so different? 

Howdy Y'all!

My name is Carl McKay, author and resident DADPAT expert based out of the Eastern Panhandle of West Virginia. Raised an Army Brat where I traveled the world, you could say I've had no shortage of adventure. I have a Bachelor's of Science in Homeland Security from Eastern Kentucky University, and did two years with two AmeriCorps Disaster Response Teams. Tapping into this unique background, I hope to bring a fresh taste and sense of realism to my novels.

I have read my fair share of novels in the apocalyptic genre and noticed that a lot of them- especially a lot of the successful ones- all give the reader the same indescribable feeling, and many follow the same general template. My goal is to write a novel that not only stands out in an over-saturated genre, but also leave the reader with a describable feeling and leaves the reader on the edge of their seat, not knowing what will happen next. The feedback I have received from beta readers tells me that this goal has been accomplished; now I want to share it with all y'all!

The novel is six years in the making, from the dream that inspired it to sending it to my editor a couple months back. It has gone through rigorous rewrites and changes to make it the best-possible telling of the characters' experience as I can.

This all said, I am seeking help from courageous and adventurous Rubble Walkers such as yourself to make this dream come true. While I am self-publishing, there are still costs associated with getting a book published- if you want to do it right that is. I am asking for the campaign minimum help me complete the editing process that my novel- and my fans- deserve.

While I have the campaign set for 60 days, the sooner the goal is reached, the sooner I can wrap up the process and get it published in time for this holiday season!

Amongst the Rubble: A Summary

It’s 20 years after a series of catastrophic natural and man-made disasters, spurred by a meteor named Hellstorm hitting Central China, nearly wiped out Humanity. But after a long, hard road Humanity is slowly starting to recover semblances of civilization across the hostile planet.

Evan McCoy wakes up in the small survivor settlement of Emporia with no memory of how he got there- or who he is. After being taken prisoner, he is rescued by the local resistance movement led by Ellie Malone, who begs for his help in their effort. After initially refusing, a turn of events forces Evan’s hand.  He agrees to help the resistance overthrow the oppressive and corrupt “mayor” of Emporia Malcolm Carver in exchange for their assistance in recovering his memory.

But not everything is as it seems in this new and dangerous world, as Evan struggles to remember his past while simultaneously surviving everything the world throws at him. And to make matters worse, he keeps seeing visions of a beautiful red headed woman, of whom he has no memory of.

 Rated M for Mature for:

Graphic Violence

Graphic Language

Apocalyptic and Intense Themes

A Kick-Butt Post-Apocalyptic Industrial Dockyard Bar Fight

What We Need & What You Get

I am a man of total honesty, and as such I would like to state the following:

My original goal was $300, but since $500 is the minimum goal you can request, I have kept it at that minimum. The editor fees are approximately $300, and any money that is raised beyond this goal will be used for any unforeseen self-publishing costs associated with this release. Any remaining funds after the novel is released will be set aside for additional expenses, such as promotions, that may come up. Additionally, I would like to note that the $300 goal (let alone the $500) is a dream come true to me if reached. I do not expect to reach this goal, but every dollar donated greatly helps in the goal of getting this book edited and out to y'all without extreme delay. And as I mentioned before, if the goal is reached, barring any unforeseen circumstances, I am looking at a December 2018 release!

But don't worry! Much like apocalyptic survivors, I love a good barter system. If I may direct your attention to the right side of the page, you will find the various donation tiers and their associated perks!

The Impact

As I have said earlier in the introductory section, my novel has already had an impact on the lives of fans and beta readers. Some reviews include:

"What the [EXPLETIVE] is WRONG WITH YOU? Seriously??? That's the end? SERIOUSLY? WHAT"

"Why did you do that to meeeee? PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD TELL ME THERE WILL BE A SEQUEL."

These are actual quotes from just two of my beta readers, and if that isn't an impact I do not know what is! With your support, I can share this novel with the world and together we can watch as the world descends into madness.

But on a (only slightly) serious note, these reactions show that my six years of work on this novel, between college classes and AmeriCorps and paid disaster deployments, has not been in vain. It also helps show that I may not only be a contender in the apocalyptic-fiction genre, but also hopefully influence the genre as a whole.

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned before, I am a man of honesty. And while I am not quite living paycheck to paycheck, I no longer have the funds to pay for the editing service entirely by myself. I had funds set aside when it was sent off to the editor earlier in the summer, but due to circumstances outside of anyone's control it was delayed and as such those funds had to be used on other expenses.

Thus, this IndieGoGo campaign. Even if I do not raise a single dollar in this campaign Amongst the Rubble will still be published; however, instead of a December 2018 release, it will be pushed back indefinitely until finances stabilize a bit more.

And even if I raise all the money in the world, I still face the greatest challenge of any new author: nobody knows who Carl is.

Thankfully, I have spent the last year or so self-advertising on my social media platforms, and as a result have gotten a rather cult following. These Rubble Walkers (some of y'all are reading this) frequently ask for updates on my novel's release, and are all but throwing pre-orders through my window (simply because they're not available yet). So, while I am a rather unknown author, I have a small following online who have already expressed their support for my novel. And once they read it, I have no doubt that word of their experience will spread and garner more and more readers and fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you like a cause or project with all your heart, but you cannot financially support it yourself. We've all been there. However, even if you cannot throw a few dollars into the campaign, sharing it on social media is a fantastic way to support not only this campaign, but my novel release in general!

You can check out my official Tumblr page at:  carl-mckay-official.tumblr.com. This is where any and all official updates will be posted regarding my novels. This is also the best way to send any questions, comments or concerns, especially after the campaign ends.

 

Thanks all y'all for reading and supporting this campaign. I know with your help, together we can make this an apocalypse worth remembering!

story:
Short Summary

In 2015 I produced a Ferguson Film called Fire this Time  which aired at the Tivoli theater in University City.  During that production I also interviewed local experts on the issue of implicit bias and stereotypes. I recently produced an editorial documentary By Any other Name which helped unmask the power of implicit bias. The manner in which North St. Louis and their residents are perceived 

 The recent rash of homicides in the city of St. Louis, most of them in North St. Louis, exacerbated the belief that North St. Louis is awash with crime, and death. In my opinion, those stereotypes are an impediment to community healing, and regional growth. 

In 2008 when canvassing for then Senator Obama in North St. Louis, there were several canvassers who were not familiar with the community. They were stunned with what they saw. They did not expect to cross Delmar and see entire city blocks with beautiful homes manicured lawns, and a sense of peace and tranquility. 

Recently the BBC did a short film on St. Louis giving a name to the line of demarcation that segregates and separates this city – the Delmar Divide. My book and video project offers readers and viewers to see another aspect of North St. Louis at a critical time in this community’s history. 

The shooting of Michael Brown, and the aftermath has challenged a community in the middle of its 250th birthday, causing us to scramble for post Ferguson solutions. Addressing the negative stereotypes should be part of that equation. My book will include interviews of the homeowners, interior and exterior photographs, as well as the history of the homes and the neighborhood. 

In 2015 some of the homeowners that will be featured in the project and myself were interviewed on St. Louis Public Radio:

 http://news.stlpublicradio.org/post/north-st-louis-homeowners-push-revitalization-and-investment-one-block-time#stream/0

Recently I filmed residents of the historic Ville Neighborhood at a listening session talk with pride about their community, at the same time realizing the enormity of the challenge of reclaiming past glory. It is the hope that this project aids them in their effort.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Hidden Jewels of North St. Louis is a coffee table book with an accompanying DVD. The book will include photos and narratives that tell the story of these homes many of them are over 100 years old. The video will introduce you in rich detail to the homeowners. 

Budget:

Initial Book Purchase 25 8x10 Books Est 50 pages - $1100 (Including Delivery and e-book creation)

http://www.blurb.com

Video Production and Editing  - 10 Families - $2500.00

Photography 10 homes - $1500.00 (Photographer Kristi Foster)

https://kristifosterphotography.com

Graphic Designer for Book Design - $1000.00

Total: $6100.00

This project alone won't alter the thinking and biases toward North St. Louis but it will offer a look into real people, and real lives whose story runs counter to the negative images. At some point real development will take hold and there will be a #NEWNORTHSTL - it is our belief that Hidden Jewels will contribute to the change by helping people foster positive perceptions about our community. 

Who am I?

I am a lifetime St. Louis resident, author, filmmaker, husband, and son. I love North St. Louis and it is part of my personal vision to be a part of it's renewal. My wife and I started Johnson Kemp Foundation which focuses on Artists as Activists, Community Development, Social Justice, and personal empowerment.

My first book Barry! a Citizen Blogger's Commentary on the 44th President, reflected my observations of Barack Obama's Presidency, and included a letter he wrote to me in 2012.

story:
Summary

We are a community of young and emerging writers and artists from a variety of marginalized, silenced, and invisible backgrounds and experiences, especially POC, colonized and neocolonized artists. We create work that, in one way or another, challenges definitions of genre, form, theme and presentation. Our mission is to create a platform for creators like us throughout the world, to amplify our voices and throw light on our lived experiences while also forcing open the doors to new and unseen artistic modes.

What We Need

For the past year this has been a labor of love, with our small forces working for free and providing the necessary funding out of pocket. In order to go forward, we need to reach out for the generosity of our extraordinary readers and viewers. Contributions will go to the costs of:

  • Site building and maintenance including web editing services, domain, and email
  • Compensating our small, dedicated team of editors, designers, content managers, and social media personnel
  • Hopefully beginning to provide compensation to our gifted and deserving content contributors
  • Being able to hold events like art exhibits and poetry and spoken word readings when it is covid-safe
  • Ultimately creating an independent press for radical and avant-garde poets and authors from specially oppressed communities
  • Broadening our reach to be able to provide this platform to artists across the widest space possible.

The Impact

Already we have been able to showcase artists from throughout the country and the world, including numerous contributors from Nigeria, where the people are currently undergoing their heroic struggle to #EndSARS. By continuing to build, we can not only have an impact on mass understanding of the expressions of these communities, but also push forward the growth of experimental and avant-garde arts by broadening their cultural parameters. If there has ever been a time when these things are even more vitally important than ever before, we are living in it.

Challenges

We are attempting to be heard in the midst of the loud cacophony of the digital age, where there is extreme competition for space and the ones who monopolize and exploit the Earth's resources have the greatest access to it, to the exclusion of folk artists, the grassroots, and ordinary life. In order to make our mission viable, it must be done in the same way that we liberate ourselves: democratically, popularly, through the active collaboration of all of us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word as far and as wide as you can, let your friends, neighbors, family members, loved ones, colleagues and communities of artists know what we are trying to do, and let them know that we are in equal need of both talent and resources. If you want to be part of it, we want you here.

Site building and maintenance including web editing services, domain, and email
Compensating our small, dedicated team of editors, designers, content managers, and social media personnel
Hopefully beginning to provide compensation to our gifted and deserving content contributors
Being able to hold events like art exhibits and poetry and spoken word readings when it is covid-safe
Ultimately creating an independent press for radical and avant-garde poets and authors from specially oppressed communities
Broadening our reach to be able to provide this platform to artists across the widest space possible.


The Impact
Already we have been able to showcase artists from throughout the country and the world, including numerous contributors from Nigeria, where the people are currently undergoing their heroic struggle to #EndSARS. By continuing to build, we can not only have an impact on mass understanding of the expressions of these communities, but also push forward the growth of experimental and avant-garde arts by broadening their cultural parameters. If there has ever been a time when these things are even more vitally important than ever before, we are living in it.

Challenges
We are attempting to be heard in the midst of the loud cacophony of the digital age, where there is extreme competition for space and the ones who monopolize and exploit the Earth's resources have the greatest access to it, to the exclusion of folk artists, the grassroots, and ordinary life. In order to make our mission viable, it must be done in the same way that we liberate ourselves: democratically, popularly, through the active collaboration of all of us.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word as far and as wide as you can, let your friends, neighbors, family members, loved ones, colleagues and communities of artists know what we are trying to do, and let them know that we are in equal need of both talent and resources. If you want to be part of it, we want you here.

story:
Welp. In classic Hallmark Holiday movie fashion ....it appears that my family and I received coal for Christmas. Our unbeloved furnace caught our very beloved home ....on fire on Monday morning. The wife & kids are safe.

But Now - like the originators of Christmas - we're spending the holidays trying to find a hotel with Vacancy ( not even the Holiday Inn has room). 
We don't know where we'll live next as our the foundation of our home is too damaged to live in ... 



Instead of a Go Fund Me , the only way I feel I can get out of this depressed , anti- holiday mood is to throw myself into a creative work space.  Our children were born under a pound and spent their first Christmas barely alive in NICU, so it's impossible not to want to hustle for them to have a good one. 
So....
IF you are at a family dinner and need an excuse to leave - we will TEXT/CALL you ASAP and you can tell your family that Sean & Sara's house caught on fire and you have to help ( by contributing $10) 

 Forgot to get your nephew a gift because you sometimes forget that he exists ?  It happens. WE WILL WRITE THEM A LETTER explaining that UNFORTUNATELY.... because Sean & Sara Home Caught on FIRE that special gift will be delayed until things can get figure out.  It's on us , not you , this year. 

We'll send them photos, videos, and even legal documents from the local fire department if they think you're dodging the event.  
Let our tragedy be your excuse to have some peace of mind, and enjoy a less stressful Christmas.

Have A Happy Holiday 


Sean & Sara & The Kids 

PS: Even if you are not a holiday person , New Year's is Around The Corner.  Maybe you just want to stay home and watch Frasier by yourself instead of having to listen to a co-worker talk about how much they made in Bitcoin Cash this year.  We do offer that service.
