story:
Hello, my name is Arshaluys and I want to write a book about nonverbal communication. 

Some words about me. I have been interested in nonverbal communication since I was 16-17 and since then I read a lot of different books and articles about it. When I was doing my Masters degree in Peace and Conflict Studies, I decided to write a thesis on conflict transformation and the role of nonverbal communication in it. Later some articles were published and currently I am teaching nonverbal communication in cooperation with different organisations. The idea to write a book came to me last year, but at that time I was very busy with other responsibilities. Now, due to different circumstances, I have more time which can be devoted to the book. I commenced writing the book this autumn and it is planned to be published in May-June 2015.

About nonverbal communication. Whatever we feel is expressed by our nonverbal behavior. When we feel negative emotions, we send negative nonverbal messages and in case of positive emotions, nonverbal messages are positive. When emotions are aroused, changes on the face and body occur automatically, even the changes in outfit, perfume, etc are visible. These changes begin in one second and we can’t actively select what emotions we will feel. What we can do, is to develop our awareness about signals we send. And in order to better understand when and how we send those signals, we need to firstly be aware of them and then to know how they work. 

What is important about our nonverbal signals in everyday life? Once we are aware of nonverbal signals in our own social interactions, it is easy to follow nonverbal signals in others and make communication easy and productive. This book will help you to understand the importance of "your unspoken language" for productive communication.

About funds. Up to 60% of collected money will be spent on publishing and up to 40% to the illustrations, and you will like them.

If you need more information, contact me via Facebook or Twitter.

story:
My Story

I am in the finishing stages of a book about a trip I took to Thailand to ordain as a monk and live in Buddhist temples. My friend, a Buddhist monk, had told me that he was going home to visit his family and invited me to come with him and ordain for a short period. How could I pass up that opportunity? When I arrived I was unable to take the vows, so the story revolves around the adventures I had while in the country, both in and out of the monasteries.

 

The Thai phrase "chat na bai bai" is loosely translated as "next life in the afternoon." It is a lighthearted expression of frustration from plans not working out the way someone wants. I adopted this title on reflection of the trip and my lost opportunity, still hopeful that someday I will get this chance again.


The Impact

This book is a travel story but also a spiritual pilgrimage and an introspective personal narrative from a pivotal part of my life - a definite turning point in my own journey - and hopefully can provide hope to others with similar aspirations. Whether a person is a new or seasoned traveler, a spiritual wanderer or on a traditional road to ministry, this book will reach the audience in a unique way.


What We Need & What You Get

After nearly eight years I have finished my manuscript but need some help with the next steps, including hiring an editor and other miscellaneous publishing expenses. I am asking for $1500 of funding, which should be about right. However, any amount beyond what is needed will be donated to the Shriners Hospitals for Children, which provides important critical specialty care to children without regard for patients' ability to pay.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends. Post this all up on the Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other social media, talk it up on your blog, and send it to your friends via email. Thank you for your help!

story:
UPDATE 1: Weight Hacking has been getting a lot of attention since we launched. Check out these stories in BoingBoing, The Nerdist, Laughing Squid, The Jace Hall Show site, All Geek To Me, Geeky Hostess, GeekGirlDiva and Daily Bits.

And awesome geeks Neil Gaiman, Felicia Day, Jewel Staite, Grant Imahara and David Hewlett have mentioned Weight Hacking on Twitter. 

UPDATE 2: Wow, $13,000 $14,000 $15,000 $16,000 $17,151, you guys are amazing!


What's Weight Hacking?

Weight Hacking is a how-to book for geeks who want to lose weight and get fit, written by a geek who’s successfully lost 65lbs.

 

Why Are You Writing it? 

Like a lot of geeks, I grew up playing D&D, hacking on computers, watching TV and reading a lot. And like a lot of geeks, I was overweight, rarely got exercise and ate poorly. At my heaviest I was 225lbs, and at 5’ 7” that put me squarely in the “obese” category.

Sometimes I tried dieting, but either it didn’t work or it didn’t work for long. I concluded that diets weren’t for me because they weren’t compatible with my geeky lifestyle.

So I created Weight Hacking, my own personal weight loss approach that used my geeky nature to work for me, and one that I could incorporate into my daily life. I didn’t go on a diet, I permanently changed my diet. I didn’t “get exercise,” I re-arranged my life so that I was naturally more active. And it wasn’t particularly hard.

Since becoming a weighthacker I’ve lost 65lbs and now weigh 159lbs, or about 29% less than I used to. To say Weight Hacking changed my life is wrong: it’s given me a new, more awesome life. I feel better. I look better. I get more done. Every single medical measure of my health has improved. You get the idea.

All my geeky friends keep asking me how I did it, because they want to lose weight too. That’s when I realized Weight Hacking could help lots of geeks out there, not just me. So I decided I should write a book to explain how it works, and I’m raising funds on IndieGoGo to be able to finish and publish it.

  

What Makes Weight Hacking Unique?

Weight Hacking isn’t a new fad diet or some heretofore undiscovered but miraculous nutritional trick. It makes no new medical claims, and none of the science in it is in any way outlandish. In fact, all of the research referenced in Weight Hacking comes from impeccable sources like the Harvard School for Public Health and the Mayo Clinic. 

Weight Hacking is simply an operating system for nerds that shows them easy ways to incorporate better eating and sound nutrition into a geeky lifestyle. It also explains how geeky passions like playing games, surfing the Web, reading, and a love of gadgets can be some of the best tools to lose weight and get fit.

 

Featuring Geeks You Know And Love

Weight Hacking is not only written for geeks by a geek, it will also include many geeks you know and love. It will feature the stories of well-known geeks who've lost weight, like beloved writer/screenwriter/comic writer Neil Gaiman, science fiction author and BoingBoing editor Cory Doctorow, and geek scientist and healthy eating blogger Darya Pino. And other geeks will show you how to eat better, like Bonnie Burton, who wrote the Star Wars Craft Book and who'lll be creating new geeky-but-healthy "food crafts" for Weight Hacking.

 

Meet My Resident Expert

I'm writing Weight Hacking in consultation with nutrition expert Jessica Ess, MS, RD, CDN. Ess is a registered dietitian and New York State Certified Dietitian-Nutritionist. She earned her BS in biology from the University of Michigan and MS in dietetics from Eastern Michigan University.  She is a member of the American Dietetics Association and the Greater New York Dietetic Association, as well as ‘Dietitians in Integrative and Functional Medicine’ and ‘Nutrition Entrepreneurs’ ADA practice groups. 

 

Where Your Contribution Will Go

The funds raised on IndieGoGo will help me cover the costs of publishing a professional-level book, which include:

  • Editing
  • Proofreading
  • Art & Design
  • Contributors
  • Printing
More importantly, you'll be helping to create a valuable resource for all the geeks out there who struggle with their weight. And that's priceless.
 
 

Here's How You Can Help

Over on the right you'll see a bunch of perks, starting at $1. Just pick the one that seems right to you and click the link, and IndieGoGo will take you through the simple process of making a contribution. It's easy, and you can use any major credit card or your PayPal account. So choose a perk on the right and let's get started!

 

Other Ways You Can Lend Support

In addition to money, crowdfunded projects like Weight Hacker succeed or fail on word of mouth, so anyway you can spread the word helps. A post on Facebook, a tweet, a comment on your favorite geeky blog or even just e-mailing the link to this page to a friend make a difference. 

 

Some Of The Weight Hacking Perks 

 

SO WHAT WILL BE IN THE BOOK?

Here’s a quick rundown of what you’ll be reading about in Weight Hacking.

1. Reboot Your System:  Like Neo in The Matrix, you’ve probably “felt it your entire life, that there’s something wrong with the world.” That’s because there is something wrong with the world. It’s been filled with manufactured food-like substances that have little nutrition but way too many calories. And often these food-like substances come with health claims that try to fool us into buying them, like “vitamin water” that in reality contains as much sugar as a Coke. This chapter is the Morpheus of the book, and it will “free your mind” about how you’re being misled about food, and what to do to change that. Welcome to the real world!

2. Plan Your Campaign: Anyone who’s ever played D&D knows that a successful campaign doesn’t happen without planning. The same is true for losing weight. That’s why this chapter touches on the psychology  of planning to explain why some plans work and others fail. It will also show you why “losing weight” is usually a terrible plan (because it’s actually a goal) and how it’s possible, easy even, to create a plan that will work.

3. Log Your Inventory: Study after study shows that people don’t know how much food they eat, and they don’t know how much they should be eating. They even have a hard time knowing when they’re full. No wonder losing weight is hard, right? Weight Hacking shows you how to understand what you’re eating and why you’re eating it, then it helps you figure out what you need to change. There is nothing in here about limiting food, it’s about eating the right amount of food.

4. Write Your Optimal Code: Your body is like a computer, and food is like its programming language. Input the right code and you’ll feel full and satisfied. Input the wrong code and you’ll eat and eat but always be hungry. This chapter will show you how to write the best, most optimal food code for your body so you’ll feel satiated and lose the weight you want to.

5. Overwrite Bad Habits: Breaking a habit is hard. Changing a habit isn’t. The majority of eating decisions we make are based on habits, and a few subtle modifications to those habits can have a massive impact on losing weight. Weight Hacking will show you how to identify the key habits that will have the most impact for you, and then explain how to modify them. It will also show you the power of creating “if/then” routines to help you make the best possible decisions in all situations.

6. Mod Your Environment: The shape of your plates, the way you arrange your refrigerator, the brand of pants you buy…all of these things unconsciously influence how much food you eat. In the last 10 years a lot of ground-breaking research has shown that simple modifications to the environment around us can have a huge impact on losing weight, and it’s not particularly hard. This chapter will show you how.

7. Reformat Your Body: The rule of thumb is that weight loss is 80% about eating and 20% about moving. This chapter is focused on the 20%. Usually a discussion about moving and exercise evokes terror in geeks, whose main memories of a gym often revolve around painful experiences at school (at least mine did!). Fear not, a geeky lifestyle is fully compatible with (and in many ways ideally suited for) moving more.

8. Planned Obsolescence: Once you reach your goal weight, you need to know how you’re going to stay there. This chapter will show you how to segue from “weight loss” mode to “maintenance mode,” something almost everyone neglects. Ever wonder why so many people lose a lot of weight then put it right back on?  Because they never think about maintenance. Weighthackers know better.

 

BONUS SECTIONS

101 Tips & Tricks: As I did the research for Weight Hacking I was continually writing down little tidbits I wanted to remember to use in my daily life. These are simple tactics and psychological tips that can help you in the everyday situations that often trip up people trying to lose weight.

Awesome Gear: I keep a running list of cool gadgets that can actually help people lose weight and stay in shape. This section will give you a rundown of the best current gear out there and explain what’s worth buying (and why).

 

So that's my story. If you've read this far, I hope it means you're interested enough in Weight Hacking to take the next step and make a contribution. Remember, all it takes is signing up for one of the awesome perks on the right. Thanks!

Weight Hacking is simply an operating system for nerds that shows them easy ways to incorporate better eating and sound nutrition into a geeky lifestyle. It also explains how geeky passions like playing games, surfing the Web, reading, and a love of gadgets can be some of the best tools to lose weight and get fit.
 
Featuring Geeks You Know And Love
Weight Hacking is not only written for geeks by a geek, it will also include many geeks you know and love. It will feature the stories of well-known geeks who've lost weight, like beloved writer/screenwriter/comic writer Neil Gaiman, science fiction author and BoingBoing editor Cory Doctorow, and geek scientist and healthy eating blogger Darya Pino. And other geeks will show you how to eat better, like Bonnie Burton, who wrote the Star Wars Craft Book and who'lll be creating new geeky-but-healthy "food crafts" for Weight Hacking.

 
Meet My Resident Expert
I'm writing Weight Hacking in consultation with nutrition expert Jessica Ess, MS, RD, CDN. Ess is a registered dietitian and New York State Certified Dietitian-Nutritionist. She earned her BS in biology from the University of Michigan and MS in dietetics from Eastern Michigan University.  She is a member of the American Dietetics Association and the Greater New York Dietetic Association, as well as ‘Dietitians in Integrative and Functional Medicine’ and ‘Nutrition Entrepreneurs’ ADA practice groups. 
 
Where Your Contribution Will Go
The funds raised on IndieGoGo will help me cover the costs of publishing a professional-level book, which include:

Editing
Proofreading
Art & Design
Contributors
Printing
More importantly, you'll be helping to create a valuable resource for all the geeks out there who struggle with their weight. And that's priceless.
 
 
Here's How You Can Help
Over on the right you'll see a bunch of perks, starting at $1. Just pick the one that seems right to you and click the link, and IndieGoGo will take you through the simple process of making a contribution. It's easy, and you can use any major credit card or your PayPal account. So choose a perk on the right and let's get started!
 
Other Ways You Can Lend Support
In addition to money, crowdfunded projects like Weight Hacker succeed or fail on word of mouth, so anyway you can spread the word helps. A post on Facebook, a tweet, a comment on your favorite geeky blog or even just e-mailing the link to this page to a friend make a difference. 
 
Some Of The Weight Hacking Perks 

 
SO WHAT WILL BE IN THE BOOK?
Here’s a quick rundown of what you’ll be reading about in Weight Hacking.
1. Reboot Your System:  Like Neo in The Matrix, you’ve probably “felt it your entire life, that there’s something wrong with the world.” That’s because there is something wrong with the world. It’s been filled with manufactured food-like substances that have little nutrition but way too many calories. And often these food-like substances come with health claims that try to fool us into buying them, like “vitamin water” that in reality contains as much sugar as a Coke. This chapter is the Morpheus of the book, and it will “free your mind” about how you’re being misled about food, and what to do to change that. Welcome to the real world!
2. Plan Your Campaign: Anyone who’s ever played D&D knows that a successful campaign doesn’t happen without planning. The same is true for losing weight. That’s why this chapter touches on the psychology  of planning to explain why some plans work and others fail. It will also show you why “losing weight” is usually a terrible plan (because it’s actually a goal) and how it’s possible, easy even, to create a plan that will work.
3. Log Your Inventory: Study after study shows that people don’t know how much food they eat, and they don’t know how much they should be eating. They even have a hard time knowing when they’re full. No wonder losing weight is hard, right? Weight Hacking shows you how to understand what you’re eating and why you’re eating it, then it helps you figure out what you need to change. There is nothing in here about limiting food, it’s about eating the right amount of food.
4. Write Your Optimal Code: Your body is like a computer, and food is like its programming language. Input the right code and you’ll feel full and satisfied. Input the wrong code and you’ll eat and eat but always be hungry. This chapter will show you how to write the best, most optimal food code for your body so you’ll feel satiated and lose the weight you want to.
5. Overwrite Bad Habits: Breaking a habit is hard. Changing a habit isn’t. The majority of eating decisions we make are based on habits, and a few subtle modifications to those habits can have a massive impact on losing weight. Weight Hacking will show you how to identify the key habits that will have the most impact for you, and then explain how to modify them. It will also show you the power of creating “if/then” routines to help you make the best possible decisions in all situations.
6. Mod Your Environment: The shape of your plates, the way you arrange your refrigerator, the brand of pants you buy…all of these things unconsciously influence how much food you eat. In the last 10 years a lot of ground-breaking research has shown that simple modifications to the environment around us can have a huge impact on losing weight, and it’s not particularly hard. This chapter will show you how.
7. Reformat Your Body: The rule of thumb is that weight loss is 80% about eating and 20% about moving. This chapter is focused on the 20%. Usually a discussion about moving and exercise evokes terror in geeks, whose main memories of a gym often revolve around painful experiences at school (at least mine did!). Fear not, a geeky lifestyle is fully compatible with (and in many ways ideally suited for) moving more.
8. Planned Obsolescence: Once you reach your goal weight, you need to know how you’re going to stay there. This chapter will show you how to segue from “weight loss” mode to “maintenance mode,” something almost everyone neglects. Ever wonder why so many people lose a lot of weight then put it right back on?  Because they never think about maintenance. Weighthackers know better.
 
BONUS SECTIONS
101 Tips & Tricks: As I did the research for Weight Hacking I was continually writing down little tidbits I wanted to remember to use in my daily life. These are simple tactics and psychological tips that can help you in the everyday situations that often trip up people trying to lose weight.
Awesome Gear: I keep a running list of cool gadgets that can actually help people lose weight and stay in shape. This section will give you a rundown of the best current gear out there and explain what’s worth buying (and why).
 
So that's my story. If you've read this far, I hope it means you're interested enough in Weight Hacking to take the next step and make a contribution. Remember, all it takes is signing up for one of the awesome perks on the right. Thanks!

NOW IS THE HOUR OF HER RETURN


I am seeking your support to publish NOW IS THE HOUR OF HER RETURN, a collection of mystical poems celebrating the Divine Feminine in her incarnation as Kali Ma—the Great Mother Goddess of India. The book chronicles a spiritual journey I began in December 2011 when I woke before dawn one morning with a poem to Kali fully formed upon my lips.

Over the next two years I composed more than fifty other poems to Kali Ma, some written as conversations, others in narrative form. All flowed out of an ecstatic state of grace in which I felt “filled up” with Her presence. For many years I have prayed the rosary, which I practice as a devotion to the Goddess in ALL her incarnations—from Inanna to Isis to Venus to Mary—but I had never had an experience of this kind.

I wrote the first dozen poems before discovering that there is a long tradition of Kali verse in India, where Bengali mystics like Ramprasad (1723 – 1775) composed hymns to the Goddess in a state of ecstatic bliss. I had read the Gospel of Sri Ramakrishna some years earlier without realizing that the one he called “Mother” was no other than Kali Ma. Before these poems began to flow out of me, I had only a passing familiarity with Hindu poetry or philosophy.

My poems to Kali arrived unbidden and unrehearsed—as fierce and wild and tender as the Great Mother Goddess herself. I set them down as they came with few concessions to poetic convention, allowing Her words and Her presence alone to guide my pen.

The following was the first poem I wrote:

My Mother, Daughter,
Sister, Lover, Bride is One
With all qualities. It’s
Pointless trying to
Find a thing that She
Is not.
I pour myself out
Each day, turn
Inward each night, turn
Flips and somersaults
At Her feet
Like Shiva.
I am barely conscious
During this. I’m along
For the ride of the Cosmos.
She stands with one
Foot planted firmly
On my chest,
The other holds my
Thigh, the weight of her
Like so many
Stars pulled inside out,
Made fine and perfect
In their fall.
I become mass only, so
Light I become dark, so
Dark I become light again.
The Broken Heart
Of a galaxy
Is a Universe Complete.
So let me put these
Questions before you: they
Must be answered. Who
Can survive her? Who
Can be without her?
Tell me if you can.

Why I Need Your Help

I am a published poet and author with many articles and books to my credit, but because of the unique mission and uncompromising message of these poems, I did not want to submit them to a process that might normalize their language or blunt the edge of their social critique. Ma Kali wants Her poems to speak directly to readers—unedited, unfiltered, and unbound. We are entering a period of great ecological and social transformation—and She is offering herself as our our guide. 

Where Your Contribution Will Go

  • To fund the book’s editing, design, production, marketing, and distribution
  • To finance travel to events promoting the book
  • To create a website to nurture community discussion about the return of the Great Mother, featuring additional poems, resources for further study, images, and spiritual practices

What You'll Get

  • A opportunity to own an uncensored, beautifully illustrated first edition copy of this inspiring book of poems
  • A rich variety of literary experiences and spiritual teachings to nurture your inner life—from audio CDs with commentaries to author readings and weekend workshops
  • An opportunity to join in fellowship with a growing community of people dedicated to creatively responding to the challenges we all know are coming our way
  • My lasting gratitude for your help in bringing Now Is the Hour of Her Return into the world and recognition of your support in the Acknowledgements section of the book

About Me

I am an intrepid spiritual explorer. Over the years I have been a Zen Buddhist monk and teacher, a senior editor for Tricycle: The Buddhist Review, and the founder of spiritual study groups across the country. My publications include SEEDS FROM A BIRCH TREE: Writing Haiku and the Spiritual Journey; MEDITATION WITHOUT GURUS: A Guide to the Heart of Practice; and HOW TO BELIEVE IN GOD: Whether You Believe in Religion or Not. My book on the new model of spiritual community, WAKING THE BUDDHA, will be released by Middleway Press in May. Look for book events in New York, Boston, Chicago, San Francisco, and LA.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please contribute as generously as you can, and if you can contribute only a little (or even nothing at all), you can still help by getting the word out about NOW IS THE HOUR OF HER RETURN. Share the campaign on Facebook or the social media platform of your choice—or simply copy the link into an email...and keep the energy moving!

THANK YOU for your support!

story:
The world needs a lot of things. But what it needs most is more love. 

Sending something as intangible as love into the world is like trying to lasso an invisible grasshopper. But there are ways. Here’s mine:

Gather a small group of lovely people with hearts a tad too big for their rib cages. Sit together and pour love into as many handwritten notes as we can scribble in an hour or two. Spread out through the city and tuck our love notes into chain link fences, the branches of trees, and cracks in the sidewalk. It’s love made tangible and hand-delivered to the world where it waits to be picked up by the right person at the right time.

Where It Began

A few years ago, I needed a lift - and a reason to stop binge-watching Friday Night Lights while covering all my furniture in a fine dusting of Cheetos crumbs. So I wrote a stack of love notes. After carefully folding them up, I wandered through San Francisco propping them on window sills and tucking them between the flowers of climbing vines. Spreading love in that way settled under my skin and it’s something I’ve wanted to do on a bigger scale ever since.

The world needs more love and this is my best idea re: delivery method.

Where It Will Go:

To and through you, via the digital guides for loving and noting and scattering. 

Through me, to San Francisco and New York. Once there, our fearless love note writers will gather, write the love, and scatter. After the first round, I plan to hit Portland and LA. From there, I hope the love notes catch fire and take over the world. 

Why This Needs Money

You can’t buy love, but you can buy pens and paper and snacks for people devoted to spreading it. I want the gatherings in San Francisco and New York to be filled to the brim with love, to better fill the notes with all the joy and light that can be infused into paper. That means buying the good cheese, yo. 

Creating and developing the digital love scattering guides takes time and effort and someone who knows more about design than I do. I need to buy the time and the design and then I need help getting to New York and San Francisco. 

Your love supports our love so our love can weave its way into the world. It’s an advanced version of Chinese telephone where the more people it touches, the bigger and brighter it gets.

What You Get

More love, for you and for the world. 

Love Blast: If you've come this far, here's a blast of love just for you. 

{POW} 

(Did you feel it?) 

Digital Love Note: One of the hundreds of love notes, delivered to your inbox. Sent with enough happy juice to fuel you for hours. 

Love Note Collection: I've been writing love notes like a fiend and crowd sourcing them from my brilliant friends on Twitter and Facebook. I'm also asking my favorite big-hearted and clever-penned writers to contribute to the cause. All our love scribblings will be gathered into a digital book that you can use to fuel your own note scattering or read when you need a shot of love. 

Love Note Scattering Guide: A digital kit stuffed with ideas on how you can do this on your own or with friends. More love for everyone. 

24 Ways To Be Less Crazy: My best tips for loving yourself, which is where all this starts. 

Spot at the party: Want to join us in the inaugural love note scattering in San Francisco or New York? Claim it. Nowhere near New York? Get first crack at tickets if/when this happens near you. (Next spots will likely be LA and Portland.) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Scatter your own love notes in your own city. Share the campaign. Spread the digital love on Twitter and Instagram (#lovenotes) or Facebook. Teach a squirrel to deliver notes to people who need them.

story:
Ok, so what is Purpose anyway?


noun: purpose;  1.the reason for which something is done or created or for which something exists

verb: purpose;  1.  have as one's intention or objective.

Ok, so what is accident? 

noun: accident; 1. an undesirable or unfortunate happening that occurs unintentionally and usually results in harm, injury, damage, or loss; casualty; mishap:

Ok, so what does living on Purpose, instead of Accident look like?  Well for me it's a powerful shift in thinking that's profoundly changing my life.  Over the past three years I have implemented changes into my life that had seemed impossible to me.  I had an auction and sold everything I owned, quit smoking, lost 30 lbs, stopped biting my nails, completely set aside two major addictions,  maintained an exercise program for over two years, dissolved most of my past pains and regrets, restored a broken relationship with my father, and continue to push against my doubts, fears, boundaries and comfort zones at an accelerated rate.

  Are you where you want to be?   Are you happy with the way your life is going?  What would you change if you could actually design your life the way you wanted it?  If you could do anything you wanted and knew you couldn't fail, what would you do? 

Life keeps score whether you do or not, there's nothing personal about it.  I walk you through a life budget, a step by step process of revealing your true priorities Vs your actual behavior.  Life rewards your actions, not your intentions.  If you want something you've never had, you'll have to do something you've never done.

Hello, my name is Travis Gray, I'm 43 years young, I was born in Arlington, Texas where I still live today. I  have two sons, Joe and Cole who I am very, very proud of.  I have been self employed for most of my life, if you had a PRIMESTAR satellite in the DFW area, there's a good chance my company either installed or serviced you.  

After a 20 year failed marriage and a few other major life changing events, I set out on a journey to restore my broken spirit and find my purpose, passion and meaning in this life.  Through this journey I've discovered an entirely new way of thinking that has opened my heart and mind to a world of opportunities I never would have imagined before.  In this book I describe the systemic process I've followed and outline a clear path to help you live a life of purpose by your own design.  

Out of adversity comes opportunity, failure is a given, growth is optional.

I wish I could tell you a big secret that would allow you to simply snap your fingers, have everything you want and live a life of purpose, unfortunately, I don't have that for you.   The fact of the matter is, it takes work, determination, will power and most of all direction.  However, the first step is desire, you have to be tired enough of losing to change.  I address this in chapter 1, there's a system to achieve anything you desire and you must have a desire to achieve anything on purpose.

One of the hardest things I've found to overcome is the lies that I tell myself.  Have you ever made a decision to take a stand or make a change;  stop smoking, lose weight/stick to a diet, change jobs, leave a toxic relationship, spend more time with your spouse/kids.....make a real shift in your life, like a new year's resolution?  You can feel it you know it's true, you're going to do it this time, you want it bad enough to do the work!!  Then something happens, anything happens and wham your lost, sold out, you give it away like last year's fruit cake, then you start minimizing, telling yourself you didn't really want it any way, maybe next week, next month, next year, after this carton, one more doughnut won't kill me, I'll spend next weekend with them, I'll buy her some flowers for her birthday, it doesn't matter, nobody else cares any way, the kids didn't mind, the dog got out again.....blah blah blah .....anything to keep from having to feel the pain of failure and face your reality.

This book will challenge, motivate and inspire you to see through your masks, walls, barriers and denial to begin to reshape and form a deeper understanding of who you are, what you want and what's standing in your way. I will give you the tools and techniques to unlock the secrets to your inner strength and self motivation that will carry you through the process of redefining and ultimately living your life on purpose. 

This book is about answering that voice, that desire deep in your heart.  It's about facing your doubts and fears head on and all out.  Changing your default behavior to positive behavior.  Changing the way you make decisions so you'll actually have a chance of getting what you want.  It's about allowing yourself the freedom to win or lose.  It's about understanding you can do anything if you just do the work.  You can have anything you want, if you just do the work.

I'm here on Indiegogo asking for your support in funding my new book, LIVING ON PURPOSE, not by Accident.    In the Information Age we now have the ability to take control of our lives and situations like never before.  On Indiegogo one can actually take a dream, transfer a feeling and make it a reality in a matter of weeks instead of years. We now have the ability to step up and make a change in real time.

I'm challenging you to step up and make a bold move, just as I have by putting myself out here like this.  It's taken an enormous amount of strength, hope and faith to overcome my fears of failure, self doubt and judgment to step out of my comfort zone and believe I can actually contribute something to this world.  By supporting this campaign you are actually confirming and solidifying the reality of anyone's ability to follow their heart, live their dreams and live their life on purpose.

I am shooting for $10,000.  This will be enough to get the book through the phases of production; copy writing, editing, layout, design, binding, and printing for distribution.  I'm trying to stay focused on making it a reality before I plan the world wind book tour.  I am hoping to gain enough support through this campaign to allow me to sign with a major publisher.   At this point I am learning, growing and having faith in the process, there's no way I can fail at this project, I have already succeeded!

You can help me fund this project by selecting a PERK on the right side of the screen or by simply clicking the contribute now button.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people may be unable to help financially.  There's more you can do though, you can use the Indiegogo's share tools at the top of the screen, you can tell your friends and family about it, you can post my link on your social media sites, you can email or text your friends and ask them to look at it. 

I'm not asking you to try to sell it, just put it out there and trust the process, it'll find the one's who need it. 

And, ANYONE interested in getting involved with this project, please reach out to me!  Everyone has something to offer this world, you can make a difference, you do matter and I would love to hear your heart and feel your passion. ;-)  If you have the ability to learn and the desire to grow, anything is possible!

two sons, Joe and Cole who I am very, very proud of.  I have been self employed for most of my life, if you had a PRIMESTAR satellite in the DFW area, there's a good chance my company either installed or serviced you.   After a 20 year failed marriage and a few
other major life changing events, I set out on a journey
to restore my broken spirit and find my purpose, passion and meaning in this
life.  Through this journey I've discovered an entirely new way of thinking that has opened my heart and mind to a world of opportunities I never would have imagined before.  In this book I describe the systemic process I've followed and outline a clear path to help you live a life of purpose by your own design.  Out of adversity comes opportunity, failure is a given, growth is optional.
 I wish I could tell you a big
secret that would allow you to simply snap your fingers, have everything you
want and live a life of purpose, unfortunately, I don't have that for you.   The fact of the matter is, it takes work, determination, will power and most of all direction.  However, the first step is desire, you have to be tired enough of losing to change.  I address this in chapter 1, there's a system to achieve anything you desire and you must have a desire to achieve anything on purpose.One of the hardest things I've found to overcome is the lies
that I tell myself.  Have you ever made a
decision to take a stand or make a change;  stop smoking, lose weight/stick to a diet, change jobs, leave a toxic
relationship, spend more time with your spouse/kids.....make a real shift in
your life, like a new year's resolution? 
You can feel it you know it's
true, you're going to do it this time, you want it bad enough to do the
work!!  Then something happens, anything
happens and wham your lost, sold out, you give it away like last year's fruit
cake, then you start minimizing, telling yourself you didn't really want it any
way, maybe next week, next month, next year, after this carton, one more
doughnut won't kill me, I'll spend next weekend with them, I'll buy her some
flowers for her birthday, it doesn't matter, nobody else cares any way, the
kids didn't mind, the dog got out again.....blah blah blah .....anything to keep from having to feel the pain
of failure and face your reality.  This
book will challenge, motivate and inspire you to see through your 
masks,
walls, barriers and denial to begin to reshape and form a deeper 
understanding
of who you are, what you want and what's standing in your way. I will 
give you the tools and techniques to unlock the secrets to your inner
strength and self motivation that will carry you through the process of
redefining and ultimately living your life on purpose.  This 
book is about answering that voice, that desire deep in your heart.  
It's about facing your doubts and fears head on and all out.  Changing 
your default behavior to positive behavior.  Changing the way you make 
decisions so you'll actually have a chance of getting what you want.  
It's about allowing yourself the freedom to win or lose.  It's about 
understanding you can do anything if you just do the work.  You can have
 anything you want, if you just do the work.I'm here on Indiegogo asking for your support in funding my new book, LIVING ON PURPOSE, not by Accident.    In the Information Age we now have the ability
to take control of our lives and situations like never before.  On Indiegogo one can actually take a
dream, transfer a feeling and make it a reality in a matter of weeks instead of
years. We now have the ability to step
up and make a change in real time. I'm
challenging you to step up and make a bold move, just as I have by putting myself out here like
this.  It's taken an enormous amount of
strength, hope and faith to overcome my fears of failure, self doubt and
judgment to step out of my comfort zone and believe I can actually contribute something
to this world.  By supporting this campaign you are actually
confirming and solidifying the reality of anyone's ability to follow their
heart, live their dreams and live their life on purpose.

I am shooting for $10,000.  This will be enough to get the book through 
the phases of production; copy writing, editing, layout, design, 
binding, and printing for distribution.  I'm trying to stay focused on 
making it a reality before I plan the world wind book tour.  I am hoping
 to gain enough support through this campaign to allow me to sign with a
 major publisher.   At this point I am learning, growing and having faith in the process, there's no way I can fail at this project, I have already succeeded!You can help me fund this project by selecting a PERK on the right side of the screen or by simply clicking the contribute now button.Other Ways You Can HelpI understand some people may be unable to help financially.  There's 
more you can do though, you can use the Indiegogo's share tools at the top of the screen, you can 
tell your friends and family about it, you can post my link on your 
social media sites, you can email or text your friends and ask them to 
look at it.  I'm not asking you to try to sell it, just put it out there
 and trust the process, it'll find the one's who need it.  And, ANYONE interested in getting involved with this project, please reach out to me!  Everyone has something to offer this world, you can make a difference, you do matter and I would love to hear your heart and feel your passion. ;-)  If you have the ability to learn and the desire to grow, anything is possible!

story:
Dear good people of the world.

As a believer in love and romance, i come to you ultimately as just an average guy, but an average guy who has not had an average life. But how does one even start a letter like this.
I guess at the beginning right?

Well, to tell you the story of my last 6 months and do it justice in one letter, is probably impossible, and I guess that’s exactly why I am writing a book about it.

But, I will however try.

My name is Shaun Myburg. I am a writer by heart, and a romantic by soul.

I guess like anyone who lives this way, it is because life has made me this way.
You see, my life hasn’t exactly been easy, in fact, it has been downright tragic.

For a long time, I was bitter about the things life had done to me, and used it as an excuse to be sad and lonely.
However, I spent my entire life looking for love, experiencing heartache on top of heartbreak. Yet, I never gave up. I knew my experiences in life were something that would both make me a stronger person, but also keep people away from me.

You see, almost 25 years ago, I lost both my father and brother within a year of each other. You can imagine the impact that has on an 11 year old boy. It either sends you down a path you battle to come back from, or it turns you into a man.

I am proud that I chose the latter. I was forced to become a man and take care of my mother, something I have done ever since.
As the years passed by, I saw my life disappear into the distance as my life became filled with unjust responsibilities. It was simply the hand I was dealt.

Through the years I continued searching for love of my own and someone to be with, but it simply never happened. And at the age of 35, I was lonelier than I had ever been. However, being a romantic, I still had to believe epic love stories could still exist in the world, and over the years, I continued to make grand gestures of love to those who had my heart. But that love was never reciprocated. Inexplicably, nobody ever fell in love with me. To the point where I felt there was something wrong with me and the way I viewed the world.

By the end of 2013, I had all by given up on love, and conceded that maybe, just maybe I was meant to be alone. It saddened me, but I made peace with it.

Then, in a serendipitous moment, I “met” the girl who would change my life.
Now, in order to prevent any unwanted attention(embarrassment?) to her, I wont mention her real name, but for the sake of the story, let’s call her “Blue”.

You see, through a mutual friend, Blue and I became internet friends. She was based in Doha, Qatar, and me, I was here in South Africa.
Blue and I became fast friends, and she eventually began encouraging me to follow what I really loved – writing. In December of 2013, I began writing my first novel. Amazingly, in a month I had finished it. Blue was with me every step of the way, cheering me on, keeping me inspired. In a month she had begun transforming me into the man I was meant to be. I found myself falling in love with Blue, and because of her reading my book (it was an autobiography), I felt Blue had feelings for me.

We understood what we had at this stage was just a very strong friendship. But it was more than strong enough to want to meet each other in person.

In January 2014, I decided to take a leap of faith, and decided to surprise Blue by visiting her in Qatar. I didn’t want to tell her, as I wanted to keep it a surprise. On the 16th January, just three days before I was supposed to fly out, I finally told her via a Skype call (as I needed to make sure she would be there) that I would be spending a week with her in Qatar. She was in tears of joy over my news, and was touched that someone would do this amazing gesture for her.

That night, I travelled home via the train, overjoyed that she had responded so well to my news. I finally felt like I had found the girl that was worth crossing oceans to get to. When I arrived at the station that night however, fate once again intervened. I was attacked by three men, robbed, stabbed twice and dragged out into a field to be killed. I fought for my life that night. I fought because I would rather be killed running towards Blue, than being dragged away from her. The effects of the attack had heartbreaking repercussions however, and at the 11th hour, my trip to Qatar fell through. I was robbed of my money, my ipad with my first book writtern on it, and even the glasses off my face, but more heartbreakingly, two teddy bears I had bought for Blue. That seemed to upset me the most, but I knew that the next day I would be receiving my visa and getting to Blue. It was the only thing that kept me going.

Then the next day, I received word that the Visa company had incorrectly filled out my Visa application and it was rejection. They had not known it had to be applied for IN Qatar. I was devastated, and hurting.

As a result of not being able to travel, I lost my flight as it was non refundable, and wasn’t sure when I would be able to fly again. I felt like I had let Blue down after making her the ultimate promise, and then just a few hours later it felt like my life had fallen apart. Blue was understanding of everything, but I knew her heart was saddened. Financially the attack set me back at least 6 months in my life.
Over the next few months, I began writing a second book, once again inspired by Blue, but this time, it was also about her. We tried several more times to arrange another meeting, and each time our meetings fell though. her coming her, me going there. It was torturous on the heart, and we began wondering if the universe was trying to keep us apart.

As the months passed, we experienced every emotion that came with love, except for the joy of being together, and eventually things broke down and on the 24th April 2014 we had what could be perceived as our first “argument”. Blue was upset that she kept having to disappointment about not getting to South Africa, but from that conversation, I made Blue a promise. I told her to story stressing about getting to me, I would go anywhere in the world to get to her.

Because of the nature of Blue’s job, she traveled around the world, and he next stop would be in a week’s time in Yangon, Myanmar. There and then I promised her I would do everything in my power to get to her in 7 days time. I knew if I got this right we would have less than 48 hours together. However, I had 3 days to organize a flight, hotel and visa.

Against all odds, and a story that is worth a letter of it’s own, I managed to get everything right, and would be traveling from Johannesburg to Hong Kong, then on to Yangon. It would be a 12 hour flight, followed by 13 hour transit wait, followed by another 4 hour flight. But at least I would get to spend a few hours with the girl of my dreams.

We finally met, and spent the most heartbreakingly perfect few hours, knowing that in a few hours we would  have to let go of each other once more. But we knew at that moment, we were in love with each other.

I traveled back on a 3 hour flight, 17 hour transit wait, and 13 hour flight back to Johannesburg. Knowing I would do it again in a heartbeat.
Following that moment, and now a month later, Blue and I have fallen more in love with each each and every day. Despite our distance, we know we are meant to be together. However, our story, and the very obvious obstacles, have only just begun. However the longer we stay apart, the more it hurts.

As I try and find a way to get to Blue, this is where I reach out to you for help in telling this story.
Blue and I deserve more than just a few hours together.

I made her a promise in January that I would be spending a week with her in Doha,Qatar, and through a horrible series of events, was not able to keep that promise. No matter what else I do in life, I will always regret not being able to keep that promise to her.

I am not one to ask for things, as I have always battled my way through life with resilience and determination, but as I now find myself on the brink of exhaustion, I ask for you to help me show Blue that fairy tales do exist. And my love for her is endless. She deserves that much. Her life has not been easy either, and there is a reason we have found each other through the most impossible or circumstances.

I will never ever give up trying to get to her, but sometimes, just sometimes, you need to ask the universe for a break. And I ask you for help in keep my promise to Blue by getting to Qatar even just for a week.

I thank you for reading this, and hope that my story at least inspires people to believe in love again.
For more about my story, you can follow the details on my page on Facebook
http://www.facebook.com/ShaunMyburgWrites

What We Need & What You Get


  • Return Air ticket from Johannesburg, South Africa to Doha, Qatar (roughly R15,000 ($1400), Hotel Stay for a week R8000 ($800), Visa  R600 ($60) (a visa can only be applied for through a 4 or 5 star hotel).
  • The remainder of the money will be used for additional transport, meals etc.
  • If the full goal is not reached, the money will still go to planned a trip to get to Blue.
  • As my second book is about Blue, anyone who is kind enough to contribute to this campaign will get a thanks in the credits of the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not in a position to contribute to the world's greatest love story, please spread the word.

Share this story with your friends, lovers and fellow dreamers.

story:
HIP HOP KUNG-FU & SOCIAL JUSTICE:

A book of Poetry written by "Chief69" with forward and photography by Al-Karim Powell-Darensburg ......

THIS BOOK IS SOLELY WORKS OF POETRY BY "CHIEF69" SHOWING THE CONNECTIONS THROUGH THE POEMS OF HIP HOP AND KUNG -FU AND ITS NATURAL DIALOGUE AND ROLE IN THE SOCIAL CONTEXT....WHEN I SAY HIP HOP I SAY SO AS A VIABLE SOCIAL MOVEMENT AND YOUTH DRIVEN REVOLUTIONARY FRONT. THIS INCLUDES BBOYING/ROCKING/POPPING/LOCKING/EMCEEING/WRITING/DEEJAYING AND THE KNOWLEDGE THAT COMES WITH GRASS ROOTS COMMUNITY ORGANIZING.

KUNG FU or MARTIAL ARTS of course as many HIP HOP HEADS know very well has direct ties with the culture from day one when you had Bboys doing the moves in the dance they saw in films like "Enter the 36 Chambers" and the countless hours of skipping school  to go watch Movies like the Shaw Brother films like the Legendary HIP HOP  group "WU Tang Clan " did .... Saturday mornings rockers would watch Channel 5. to see some more films and study the knowledge. Many HIP HOPPAS in the 70s and 80s went into the Martial Arts lifestyle from basic reasons of self defense if they were a Revolutionary or Outlaw to competing nationwide and actively teaching on a positive note to the polar opposite of using it to vik or rob people for the latest threads and gear. The dedication of practicing martial Arts can also go hand in hand with the work ethic involved in Bboying or Emceeing or Writing and any of the elements.

at its core this work will provide GOOD POETRY with CONSCIOUSNESS to keep it simple and light.with again the  acknowledgement of the impact of Martial Arts or Kung Fu on HIP HOP and myself  - "Chief69"



Nelson “CHIEF69” Seda
(Bboy-Emcee-Artist- Community Organizer)
Born of Puerto Rican decent to a father with a history in the HIP HOP origins and a loving mother in East NY,Brooklyn. He is an avid local practitioner of HIP HOP and qualified in the analytical specialties that his work offers on a philosophical and educational level. Since 2008 while still in high school “CHIEF69” and his friends formed THE FLOOR ROYALTY CREW. Him and his friends seeing the resources of positivity and change that HIP HOP has to offer at an early start mutually decided to progress , legitimize and properly represent to the best of their abilities the True and Original intent of HIP HOP by upholding the ideologies and foundational building blocks laid before them. “CHIEF69” is based in the south Bronx but with his crew and affiliates is always looking for a new and progressive platform for HIP HOP. He has Art work in galleries and the households of many across the globe , He has been featured in many international publications from The NY Times to multiple magazines in Sweden,Japan and more places. He works with the youth , with grass roots community organizations, educational institutions and all creative people to help little by little bring about more LOVE , PEACE , UNITY and above all else HUMANITY…..

VIEW HIS WORK AND BE THE JUDGE FOR YOURSELF HERE:  www.chief69frc.blogspot.com

"Chief69" - Photo above by Charlie Ahearn - 2013

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Al-Karim Powell-Darensburg

Brooklyn born, New York native, Al-Karim Powell-Darensburg has worked in the fields of Music, Fashion and Entertainment for the last 25 years. During this time he has trained models, assisted in developing new designers and worked with numerous recording artist and celebrities in the capacity of artist development director, manager, and consultant.

Mr. Powell-Darensburg has had the unique privilege of assisting in the creation of the first wardrobe department for Black Entertainment Television (BET), where he worked as a fashion stylist for all on-air personalities and performing guest. While at BET he also worked in Children’s and Entertainment Television for such shows as Teen Summit and Caribbean Rhythms.

As a visual merchandiser, he has created scenes and campaigns for stores such as Macy’s, The Hecht Company, Benetton, Oaktree, Boyvie Studio’s, ChicWear-NY and Style vs. Freedom.

Over the last 25 years he has perfected the talents of photography, make-up artistry and fashion styling. He is a graduate of the world-renowned, Parsons School of Design with a background in Fashion Design. Al-Karim is the founder of the entertainmentINDUSTRY Agency (www.entindustry.com), Iconic Visions (iconicvisions.com) and co-founder of the HU2 Group (HU2Group.com).

Currently, Al-Karim is developing a new Urban fashion related magazine, television program and international runway and beauty showcases.

Mr. Powell-Darensburg volunteers his time to train young adults in Jr. High, High School and College in the entertainment industries. He enjoys being a mentor and a positive role model for young minds.

Al-Karim Powell-Darensburg

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- This Project is special in that it was written on a hospital bed when "CHIEF69" was in pain from an inflamed pancreas for 5 days and upon his hospital discharge he sought out to not only share the work but to self publish his work and take his project into the very educational institutions where he often Teaches , Lectures and circuts in the name and honor of HIP HOP as a viable social movement and YOUTH DRIVEN revolutionary front. Having this such work come to light will provide "Chief69" with an even more strong drive to express himself and SPEAK FOR THE HAVE NOTS who fall victim to societies ills and the educational system and its poor curriculum and set standards put in places such as the communities and rough streets where HIP HOP thrives and was born. where all else fails HIP HOP continues to properly prepare young minds and  passionate souls for its fix of Language Arts , Science , Mathematics , Chemistry , etc.


WE NEED TO RAISE $2500 to ensure we have enough funds to publish this work on a small scale and do a grand release event locally.

 

we will self publish about 50 - 100 physical copies and also be using funds raised to have a book release event and I want it to be grand with of course Books - Art - Catered food - Press and much much more....


ALL WHO CONTRIBUTE ANY AMOUNT TO MY PROJECT WILL HAVE A 10% DISCOUNT ON MY BOOK - WORKSHOPS - PERFORMANCES , etc...BE THANKED AND GET A SHOUT OUT ON MY SOCIAL NETWORKS AND HELP A DREAM COME TRUE.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute because of various reasons and I understand, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • PLEASE get the word out and make some noise about this PLEASE SHARE ON YOUR SOCIAL NETWORKS and if you do the work I also do in the community locally or abroad and use HIP HOP to educate ,empower and REVOLUTIONIZE then PEACE and RESPECT TO YOU AND YOURS.....
  • IF YOU HAVE CONNECTIONS TO ANY MEDIA( NEWSPAPERS,MAGAZINES AND MORE WITHIN HIP HOP CULTURE AND MARTIAL ARTS OR KUNG-FU PLEASE FORWARD THIS PROJECT FUNDRAISER TO THEM.)
  • WE INVITE LOCAL HIP HOPPERS / MARTIAL ARTIST / COMMUNITY LEADERS/YOUTH AND CREATIVE TALENTS LIKE OURSELVES TO SUPPORT AND SHOW LOVE WHEN THE PROJECT IS RELEASED.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I'd like to introduce myself and my project. 

Unashamed. A memoir by Aziza Kibibi


Hello, my name is Aziza Kibibi. I am a single mom of five beautiful children that I am very proud of. Most men describe me as mysterious, free spirited and charming. Most woman say that I'm confident, smart and witty. But little do they know, is that from ten years old, I was raised as my father’s (Aswad Ayinde) sex slave. Oh, and the first four of my five children, are also my brother and sisters.


This book is the true story of my life; a tale of how surviving my childhood, adolescence and young adulthood, has shaped me into the woman I am today.



I am the eldest of 9 children by my mother, and including my children whom he fathered, the eldest of over twenty-five by my dad. Using events from the present as a vehicle,  history of my life unfolds. I take the reader on a journey through my sheltered life in a polygamous family where I was home schooled, molested, beaten and trained to satisfy my father’s every sexual desire. In addition, I invite the reader into my present life where I've triumphed over the setbacks and challenges from my upbringing.  

I describe how while growing up I watched my father turn from a loving, talented respected member of the community, into the abusive monster that God spared my own children from growing up with. Via my transition through adolescence the reader witnesses my failed attempts at protecting my younger siblings from the fate I had befallen; my father’s video directing career where we interacted with popular ’90’s music artists such as Lauryn Hill and Wyclef Jean of the music group The Fugees, and the events that led to the unveiling of our family secret. 



UNASHAMED is a tale of tragedy, growth, resilience, survival, faith and forgiveness.  

I want to share my story with the public because I feel I have a moral responsibility to other men, women and children (both victims and victimizers) that may be affected by child molestation and incest, to raise awareness and lend a voice to those that are and have been abused. Unlike the safety mechanism that other victims utilize, I have not repressed the torture that my father inflicted on me, yet I function normally in life love and relationships. I consider this unique because I believe that through my writing it is important to convey to the reader the thoughts and feelings of a victim while being abused. This is also what makes my memoir stand out from other books that have been published with this theme.

As for my personal successes in life; despite my limited homeschooled education, I am currently  pursuing my associates in Liberal Arts - Communications with a 3.7 GPA (my first classroom experience) at Essex County College. I have won three Woman’s Opportunity awards from Soroptamist International for my writing. I currently administrate two blogs and, I run a catering and dessert company called Sincerely, Z. I am also raising, and have wonderful relationships with my four talented children whom I love more than anything. 

Unlike what is and was available to me and countless others, my book will provide insight, support and inspiration to victims, survivors and those that love us via my voice shamelessly sharing the perils of  my victimization, as well as my triumphs as an overcomer. But this book is not only for those connected to incest or sexual child abuse.  I hope that my tales will encourage and motivate anyone going through troublesome times, to push forward and stay strong no matter what challenges life presents one with. Though themed in struggle, Unashamed is a beautiful tragedy filled with provocative scenarios, funny moments, exciting journeys and insightful thought provoking ideas. 

 

What We Need  

At 35 years in the making and 3 years in the writing, Unashamed the 410 page manuscript is complete. And now I need your help to get it published. 

Your gracious contributions will transform this project from something I am doing, to something WE are doing together. Our goal of $19,077 will prep, print, bind, and help distribute completed hard cover and soft cover copies of Unashamed, making you and I the publishers of this book. With this initial launch, I hope to spread the word and promote Unashamed; which will be available on a print on demand basis.  

Funds will go towards the following:

  • Editing for grammar
  • Editing for content and continuity
  • Copyediting
  • Book cover and jacket design
  • Interior Layout
  • Photos and illustrations
  • Printing
  • Binding
  • ISBN assingment
  • Online distribution
  • Marketing



What You Get

Because there is no other piece of literature of this nature on the market, you are helping to make history.  I myself feel blessed to be a part of something that could prevent pain and suffering in others, and may even save a few lives. I want to offer you the same opportunity. In addition I will include you in the journey of realizing this project by acknowledging your kindness on my Facebook and Twitter. 

As the size of the donations increase, the perks grow to include, copies of Unashamed with and without autographs; a dessert party catered by my company Sincerely, Z; book readings and speaking engagements (great for organizations). There's even a perk where I send you a real photograph of myself as a teenager, with a short true story from my life that no one else is privy to.

To me there's no such thing as failure; only opportunities to do it better the next time. So If we do not reach our goal, the funds will go towards whatever it will allow in publishing as many copies as possible. After which, I will find other ways to bring this project to fruition.


Support comes in all forms

Don't let lack of funds stop you from showing support. There are other ways you can help.

  1. Spread the word. Share my campaign on your Facebook and/or Twitter
  2. Suggest my speaking perk or catered event to your church, synagog, temple, business or other organization.
  3. Go to my blog, Unashamed An Open Book, and cheer me on. 
  4. Like my Facebook page and/or follow me on twitter

The Impact

But wait. I'm sure your wondering why don't I just get Unashamed published by a traditional publishing company? I must confess that is ideally what I would like to do, but with the changes in publishing, it is more difficult to achieve, and takes more time for an unknown author to get published. So while I don't discount the possibility of signing with a publishing house, I've decided to take matters into my own hands. If by a different blessing my book is picked up by a publisher, have no fear, a backup plan is here. 

All perks will still be honored to the best of my ability. In addition, your donations will contrubute to the development of my non profit organization Precious Little Ladies. 

The purpose of this organization is to strengthen the bond between mothers and daughters through information, education, empowerment, support and understanding. 

With these tools a family could better prevent, cope and recover from incidents of child sexual abuse. 

Unashamed is not just a book, and I am not just a victim of child molestation. What we are creating here is a movement that will invite change. Unashamed will provide something that I never had. A map to healing, encouragement to forge on and strength to make a change; from someone who understands. 

Join me in impacting the world and making a change. Join me in saving lives. Join me in inspiring over 3 million children and 76 million adults to be UNASHAMED.

Let's do this!

story:
This Movember, don't just grow a 'stache; fund a book and website for prostate health

Yes, you could cultivate some unsightly facial hair ... but wouldn't it be a lot cooler to fund something substantial? The Prostate Repair Guide is well on its way to completion. I'm currently writing Chapter 10 of 12 chapters in the first draft. By December I hope to be writing the second draft, and by January I'll have it off to the editor. At the same time, I'll be designing a proper website aimed at helping men with up to date information on prostate health. 

And like most men with a cause, I'm growing some hideous facial hair, having opted for a 'Zappa' stache. I'm not sure if that's going to help me: Here's what one girl thinks about the mustache:


About the Book

The Prostate Repair Guide is a book designed to help men take control of their diagnosis and treatment, and avoid the nightmarish suffering men go through when they don't get the right care. The inspiration for this book came from my own bitter experience. You can see some drafts of the introduction and Chapter One here.

My father, John Symons, was diagnosed with the aggressive form of prostate cancer in 2008. I took a prolonged absence from work to move to Vancouver and help my mother take care of him in his final months. It could have been a terrible experience ... and in some ways it was ... but my dad was a pretty special guy, and taught us a lot about courage and what it means to face death with dignity. 

Soon after, I began having my own first serious symptoms of prostate disease, but like many men, I didn't want to deal with it ... or even think about it. It took two more years for me to go see my doctor, and when I did, I ended up getting no help at all. My journey through the medical establishment was frustrated by a surprising lack of knowledge by doctors about prostate disease; by my own reluctance to deal with the disease; and by the bewildering nature of prostate disease itself. 

To be clear, I don't blame any of the doctors for what happened to me. If nothing else, I've learned just how difficult it is to deal with prostate diseases, and it's hard to imagine a hard-pressed General Practitioner staying completely up to speed on every disease out there. However, I now know that if I had been given a simple test by a qualified urologist, I could have avoided years of pain, humiliation, and frustration. If I had pushed harder to see a specialist, and known what tests I should have taken, it would have made a huge difference. Instead, prostate disease truly wrecked my life for three years, and in the end could have killed me. 

About the Author

The Prostate Repair Guide is my way of helping other men avoid the trials my family and I went through. The Guide is NOT a book by an 'expert'. Rather, it is a book by someone who has been there, and experienced what it's like. I'm not a doctor, I don't work for the health industry, and so I have no loyalties or biases to protect. 


What I do have is a quarter century of experience as an investigative reporter with newspapers, and more recently, with CBC News. It's something I'm very good at. I worked with CBC's acclaimed Investigative Unit, and over the years won just about every journalism award out there. My specialty is in doing deep research into any topic, and over the years I've covered everything from fatal drug interactions; political scandals; fraud; drug gangs; terrorism; and major disasters such as plane crashes or train wrecks. Often, when we investigate disasters, we find that accidents could have been prevented, or resulted in fewer deaths, if some simple precautions had been taken. 

The inspiration for this book came when I decided to investigate the 'train wreck' of my own prostate disease. Again, I don't blame doctors for what happened to me. I believe they did the best they could with the knowledge they had ... but the knowledge a busy General Practitioner has of prostate disease is not that deep. If you're going to get proper treatment, you must become your own 'expert' and be able to make intelligent decisions about your own care. 

This what the Prostate Repair Guide will do. It goes through what tests need to be done and when; what men can do without drugs or surgery to treat prostatitis and BPH; the options for surgical intervention, and what the risks are for each. What I discovered in my 'investigation' is that there are very good treatments today for prostate disease, but that many men suffer needlessly, and often for decades, because they don't get the right diagnosis or the right treatment. 

Publishing the Book

I plan to publish this book even if I don’t raise a dime in this campaign, because it’s just that important to me. Unfortunately, books and websites do cost real money to produce. 

Funds raised in this campaign will be used for:

  • Producing an e-book, a paperback book and a hardcover book;
  • Producing a website that will be updated weekly with new research and information;
  • Graphic design;
  • Proofreading and editing;
  • Marketing the book to make sure it gets out to the people who need it. 

My hope is that, with your help, the book and website will be done by January or February at the latest, with copies shipping out the first week of February.

Creating a Better Website

Since starting this campaign, I've been working hard to put some content on a basic site I created. Long-term, I hope to make this site a really good clearing house for the best information on treatment and diagnosis options, and also start a forum for men with prostate disease. You can see my site now at: www.prostaterepairguide.com

I've only really been posting since this campaign began, but already getting some decent results. Six people have used my self diagnosis tool, and about 60 people per day are visiting the site. Not a bad start!

Hi! I'm Jade Sylvan. 

I'm a writer and performing artist based in Cambridge, Mass.


For the past six months, I've been on tour in the Eastern part of the country supporting my newest book, Kissing Oscar Wilde (Write Bloody Publishing, 2013)
The book is a novelized memoir about a poetry tour I took in France in 2012. It explores themes of queer and artist identity, romance, friendship, and love.
You can read more about the book, here: http://jadesylvan.com/kissing-oscar-wilde/

DigBoston called the book “A pansexual bildungsroman crafted with unabashed eloquence," and "an epidural of hope.”

And the Albany Times Union said: “It will strike a chord with any readers who have been young literary bohemians.” 


All of my touring is self-funded!


Write Bloody wonderfully paid for the book production costs and distribution, but it is in Independent press, and does not help me with touring costs. So far, my East Coast tours have paid for themselves, but the extra travel expenses of flying to the West Coast, shipping books, and getting around without a car while I'm out there will be more than the money I'm guaranteed to make. 

I have shows booked in the following cities:

Santa Cruz 3/31
Berkeley 4/2
San Francisco 4/3 + 4/4
Portland 4/6
Spokane 4/9 + 4/10
Eugene 4/12
Bellingham 4/14
Seattle 4/15 + 4/16


Full schedule including info here: http://jadesylvan.com/shows/


This is a fantastic opportunity to introduce a book I am extremely proud of to a new region of the country, and connect with wonderful audiences!


You can help an independent artist!


I've estimated that this tour will cost roughly $600 more than I expect to make. By helping me cover this gap, you will be contributing directly to transportation costs that will get me to the places I need to be to perform for these wonderful audiences!


Please spread the word!

Even if you can't help right now, please help me get the word out about my tour and campaign!
