story:
Perhaps the kinkiest self-help book ever created.

 This is not you're typical collection of fetish related images. It includes the stories of not only myself and the changes I went through, from my complete innocence of the topic to the ending, as I changed toward becoming who and what I am today. The underlying message is about change. Something we all need to be at better terms with in our lives.

This is all a story that happened twenty years ago. A potential lifetime for many. But the wink of an eye as you age.

Please know this is not my first time to engage the writing and publishing of a book. I have a couple out now. My most recent is titled; Meditation. It's not what you think.

To say the least I've had a very transformative couple decades in my life. Before I can own my present, I have to also own my past. The publication of this book will free me to openly take credit for it during an interview should it come up as I speak of meditation and spirituality.

Yes, I've even changed my name slightly. Not to hide from the past, but to embrace this new chapter in my life. My name is Melvin Edward Zabel. I simply dropped Ed off a few years ago as I began to teach and write about meditation.

This publication is my own freedom from my own kind of bondage.

Not only did I live this chapter in my life. But I was able transform myself back out of it again.

My next book's working title is; Bridge of Change.

A book about this specific topic. But I need to get this one out first. Although I am being boastful in my presentation, it was all nothing more than a chapter in the book of my life.

I've changed considerably in the past few years.


What We Need & What You Get

The summary that my team has arrived at is the sum of $12,000. 
This covers my investments in all of the editing, consulting etc. I have a team of Editors, publicists, and on-line advisors that can make this a #1 in it's genre.
As well, it will cover some my basic needs as I commit this time required to complete the project.

The contributors benefits are listed where they're supposed to be. You may also find them on the web-sire; 

http://www.theartofbondage.com./donation-rewards.html

If you read all of this text, you'll know this is a lot more than just another coffee table book full of amazing photography. 

With your contribution you will be helping others in ways that are far from this obvious topic. 


The Impact

With your support, not only are you helping me, but you'll be helping others who may just be curious about or even in the middle of the game we call BDSM. 

For some it's a natural lifestyle. (That's okay) While for others it's as simple as experimenting with an aspect of the erotic side of our being. It's my hope that this book will not only entertain you with imagery to inspire your own sexual life, but also I wish to inform you of what it's really all about.

The residual of this publication is tremendous regarding reviving the collection as a show and offering prints and promotional items for sale for long term residual income.

People have been buying my art works for many decades. Many of these images hang in homes that are incredibly prestigious. I'm happy for those who've collected my works in the past.
With this publication their investment is going to increase substantially. As will yours. I've discovered "to my surprise", that I have enough images for at least one more book of this nature. But that's really up to the response I get from the actual publication of this one.

Because you're helping myself and my team to make this book something special and unique, you're actually going to be helping others as well. 
Believe it or not, it will.

Please be generous. At this point my new career is just beginning to blossom. But I can not yet cover my expenses. With this book on the table (metaphorically speaking) I'll be ready to as transparent as I can be with the others that I hope to be of service to. 

We all change. The big secret is; I'm no longer Ed Zabel. I'm a man who teaches the practice of meditation. I do so to enrich the lives of others. This is my desire going forward. Please help me to be what I have the potential to be. 

Thank you.

Ed Zabel 


Risks & Challenges

Every day there many books uploaded to amazon. 

I've done it twice already and it too is something that requires time, money and dedication to push it up to be a best seller within it's genre. I have an amazing publicist, a team of editors that I've worked with before and the support and commitment of a on-line sales coach to help me get this one up on the charts before I begin with my other book.

It could be a complete flop. I don't think so. A great deal of my past has been in marketing. I know what it takes to create a stir and draw attention.
As well do my team that's committed to work with me on this.

It's my intention to complete publishing around the time of the release of the comnig movie about the book; 50 Shades of Grey. There's about to a spike in interest in this topic again. I want to catch that wave and ride it, so time is of the essence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about This campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Blog about me, post about me, talk about me, as long as it draws attention to this in a positive way.
  • Share with specific groups that I'm no longer associated with. i.e Bondage or Fetish groups on Facebook.
  • Like me on Facebook!    facebook.com/edzabelsbook

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you so much for your time and contributions.

story:
We are Sonia Anna Grodek and Daria Porębiak. Both of us have already published a book in Poland - mine was reliesed last year by publisher Alegoria("Drzewo spełniające życzenia. Opowieści mamy i córki" - http://ryms.pl/ksiazka_szczegoly/1365/drzewo-sp... ), Daria's - by Lampa publisher ( "Koniec Świata" http://www.lampa.art.pl/sklep/index.php?p223,da...).

 
After releasing our books we started to think about publishing by ourselves. Publishers often want to interfere in contents of the book, they have their own vision of how the book should look, and besides, we didn't find anyone, who was interested in our project. Because on the spring we got the idea - we want to publish child books! But not ordinary books - we thought, how great would it be to publish fairytales, myths and stories from various Polish regions, and we decided to begin with Mazovia region, which capitol is Warsaw, were we live. We started to look for stories and it turned out, that no one did it before! In libraries there were some, not very appealing collections from communists times, of five or ten stories, a lot of them were the same, and a lot were written in awful manner - mock old dialect.

No wonder - we thought - that children don't want to read this! Our stories will contain original, traditional essence, but they will be written in interesting way, for children and for adults. Some of fairytales we found were very old and very beautiful (the oldest book we found was from 1856); theye were showing the diversity of this interesting region, where before war were living alongside Germans, Poles, Russians and Jews. Beyond them - vampires, all sorts of withches ("strzygi", "wiedźmy", "czarownice"), marmaids ("rusałki"), dragons, anchanted animals and even one unicorn!



In our free time we started to go on a trips to Mazovia - including Góra Kalwaria, Kozienice, Pułtusk or Minsk Mazowiecki.

There we found a lots of interesting stories. Directors of regional museums and local people were happy to share theirs tales and our collection of stories was growing bigger and bigger. Did you know, that at the biggining of XX century, polish soldiers bring back from Ural to near-by-Warsaw Modlin domesticated bear Baśka, who lived there with them till the rest of her live?



Did you know, that under Warsaw ground lives enchanted princess - Golden Duck? Did you know, that "Beauty and the beast" has his equivalent in Mazovia, and its oldest and very moving version we found in XIX's book? Wouldn't it be great, if all this stories were in one, beautiful book, so every child and adult from Mazovia and world could have it at home?

On April we decided, that we will became non-profit organisation. That way it would be easy to find sponsors and apply for grants for publishing the book, and we will not have to bear the costs at starting point (which would be hard, because we didn't have a lot of money, and as a freelancers, we couldnt apply for credit in a bank). It sounded better than starting our own buissness, and it is interesting to know at this point, that according to Doing Buissness world ranking, Poland is at 124 place from 175 worlds countries, when it comes to simplicity of starting your own buissness, and on 114 place, in the matter of simplicity and clarity of tax system. So the non-profit-organisation it was. Application form was about 50 pages and was very complicated; we have to write resolutions, fill houndreds of forms and write a contract with my mum, to rent a 1,5 meters of her house for our bureau.

After 1,5 month we got the refusal. We added more resolutions and forms and waited for 2 months for answer. - In summertime in offices everyone is on vacations so it always take some time, some people wait for six months... - were saying our friends, to "cheer us up".

At least, at the beggining of August, we registered non-profit-organisation in national courts register (KRS) - Ilustracja B. Meanwhile, it got clear to us, thet as a non-profit-organisation in Poland, we can't... sell our book. We can only give it for free. But we wanted to sell many books so Mazovian fairytales got popular and to finance our future publishing projects (tales from other regions, also tales from other countries, when we will get bigger) and to have our own buissness. It turned out, that as non-profit-organisation , to do anything, we have to evade unclear law, fill hundreds of reports and explain ourselves all the time to authorities.

We didn't want to do this. Besides, till that moment we saw a lot of books published by non-profit organisations in Poland - they were miserable brochours, lying forgotten somwhere in the municipal office or museum. That is not what we wanted. Our book was tend to be a hit. It could show, that our culture is not boring and it should be in every bookstore. So, what left was starting our own buisness. We didn't waste the time when we were starting our non-profit-organisation tought- we got a lot of contacts, some people were interested in our project and in the meantime, we almost completed the book.

Now, we are getting to the end of our work to finish the book. From almost 100 stories, we chose about 40, and we are finishing elaborating them. Book will be ready in Septemper, when we will paricipate in local children-book contest - award is 1200 $, so we will try our best. Then we will start our publishing house (in Poland you pay taxes etc. for your buisness from day first, no metter of your income, and you have to pay more, then in UK or USA - that is why we are waiting with it). We will manage that. But we have to raise money for printing our first book. We plan to do it - taking the time for finding an illustrator,  print,  find money etc. - by the biggining of the year 2014. How much do we need?


1 000 $ - for illustrator. For some illustrations we will organise contest for kids from Mazovia's schools, but book must look really good, so someone have to take care of it. We both are freelancers, so we know how unfair it is, when someone want you to work but don't want to pay - so we want to find good artist for the job and pay him fairly.


9 000 $ - for the printing. We are right now looking for printing house, which will print a book on recycled paper - it is really important for us. Our first research shows, that this sum should cover printing of 2 thousends of books. After selling first edition, we will cover costs of second one from the profit.

We will be very happy for every donation. If you can read polish (or want to learn;) you can write us your adress after making a donation at IlustracjaB@gmail.com. We will send you a book signed by authors just the moment it will be out of printhouse:) We can send it to every place in the world, free of shipping cost;) Also, we are on Facebook: www.facebook.com/IlustracjaB

 Please tell Your friends about our project.


THANK YOU!!

No wonder - we thought - that children don't want to read this! Our stories will contain original, traditional essence, but they will be written in interesting way, for children and for adults. Some of fairytales we found were very old and very beautiful (the oldest book we found was from 1856); theye were showing the diversity of this interesting region, where before war were living alongside Germans, Poles, Russians and Jews. Beyond them - vampires, all sorts of withches ("strzygi", "wiedźmy", "czarownice"), marmaids ("rusałki"), dragons, anchanted animals and even one unicorn!
In our free time we started to go on a trips to Mazovia - including Góra Kalwaria, Kozienice, Pułtusk or Minsk Mazowiecki.

There we found a lots of interesting stories. Directors of regional museums and local people were happy to share theirs tales and our collection of stories was growing bigger and bigger. Did you know, that at the biggining of XX century, polish soldiers bring back from Ural to near-by-Warsaw Modlin domesticated bear Baśka, who lived there with them till the rest of her live?
Did you know, that under Warsaw ground lives enchanted princess - Golden Duck? Did you know, that "Beauty and the beast" has his equivalent in Mazovia, and its oldest and very moving version we found in XIX's book? Wouldn't it be great, if all this stories were in one, beautiful book, so every child and adult from Mazovia and world could have it at home?On April we decided, that we will became non-profit organisation. That way it would be easy to find sponsors and apply for grants for publishing the book, and we will not have to bear the costs at starting point (which would be hard, because we didn't have a lot of money, and as a freelancers, we couldnt apply for credit in a bank). It sounded better than starting our own buissness, and it is interesting to know at this point, that according to Doing Buissness world ranking, Poland is at 124 place from 175 worlds countries, when it comes to simplicity of starting your own buissness, and on 114 place, in the matter of simplicity and clarity of tax system. So the non-profit-organisation it was. Application form was about 50 pages and was very complicated; we have to write resolutions, fill houndreds of forms and write a contract with my mum, to rent a 1,5 meters of her house for our bureau.

After 1,5 month we got the refusal. We added more resolutions and forms and waited for 2 months for answer. - In summertime in offices everyone is on vacations so it always take some time, some people wait for six months... - were saying our friends, to "cheer us up".At least, at the beggining of August, we registered non-profit-organisation in national courts register (KRS) - Ilustracja B. Meanwhile, it got clear to us, thet as a non-profit-organisation in Poland, we can't... sell our book. We can only give it for free. But we wanted to sell many books so Mazovian fairytales got popular and to finance our future publishing projects (tales from other regions, also tales from other countries, when we will get bigger) and to have our own buissness. It turned out, that as non-profit-organisation , to do anything, we have to evade unclear law, fill hundreds of reports and explain ourselves all the time to authorities.We didn't want to do this. Besides, till that moment we saw a lot of books published by non-profit organisations in Poland - they were miserable brochours, lying forgotten somwhere in the municipal office or museum. That is not what we wanted. Our book was tend to be a hit. It could show, that our culture is not boring and it should be in every bookstore. So, what left was starting our own buisness. We didn't waste the time when we were starting our non-profit-organisation tought- we got a lot of contacts, some people were interested in our project and in the meantime, we almost completed the book. Now, we are getting to the end of our work to finish the book. From almost 100 stories, we chose about 40, and we are finishing elaborating them. Book will be ready in Septemper, when we will paricipate in local children-book contest - award is 1200 $, so we will try our best. Then we will start our publishing house (in Poland you pay taxes etc. for your buisness from day first, no metter of your income, and you have to pay more, then in UK or USA - that is why we are waiting with it). We will manage that. But we have to raise money for printing our first book. We plan to do it - taking the time for finding an illustrator,  print,  find money etc. - by the biggining of the year 2014. How much do we need?1 000 $ - for illustrator. For some illustrations we will organise contest for kids from Mazovia's schools, but book must look really good, so someone have to take care of it. We both are freelancers, so we know how unfair it is, when someone want you to work but don't want to pay - so we want to find good artist for the job and pay him fairly. 9 000 $ - for the printing. We are right now looking for printing house, which will print a book on recycled paper - it is really important for us. Our first research shows, that this sum should cover printing of 2 thousends of books. After selling first edition, we will cover costs of second one from the profit. We will be very happy for every donation. If you can read polish (or want to learn;) you can write us your adress after making a donation at IlustracjaB@gmail.com. We will send you a book signed by authors just the moment it will be out of printhouse:) We can send it to every place in the world, free of shipping cost;) Also, we are on Facebook: www.facebook.com/IlustracjaB
 Please tell Your friends about our project.THANK YOU!!

story:
La prima antologia del Varco

Chi conosce il movimento sa quanto, in questi mesi, ci siamo impegnati a raccogliere in giro per l'Italia personalità preparate, in grado di scrivere e tirar fuori testi dalla forte pregnanza emotiva ed intellettuale. Abbiamo deciso di radunarli in un'antologia che conterrà:

  • Racconti e poesie edite e inedite dei membri del Varco
  • Fotografie e dipinti dei nostri artisti
  • Saggi sulla società contemporanea

    Per noi è la chance di produrre un'opera vera, cartacea, reale e finanziata dalle persone che ci seguono e che credono in questo progetto. Un'opera giovane che può permettere a tanti aspiranti autori e artisti di compiere il primo vero passo della loro carriera.

    L'antologia, dal titolo provvisorio "L'aria che tira - Antologia del Varco", sarà divisa in quattro capitoli: quattro finestre sul mondo contemporaneo, quattro chiavi di lettura della realtà vista con gli occhi dei giovani italiani, quattro aree tematiche per esplorare la poetica e la sensibilità dei nostri autori.

    • Il senso di isolamento e il paradosso della nostalgia, la lontananza e la vicinanza da sé stessi, dall'amore, da un sogno, dalla vita.
    • La figura della donna, esplorata nella sua indipendenza, nella sua solitudine, ma anche nella sua sessualità e centralità nella meta-pornografica società odierna.
    • Il rifiuto della vita e l'abbandono di ogni speranza, il senso di nodo alla gola che precede la disperazione dopo aver perso l'anima.
    • Il tramonto dell'Occidente visto attraverso i racconti grotteschi e disumani di esistenze meccaniche sull'orlo della nuova era.


    Cosa facciamo e di cosa abbiamo bisogno

    Per pubblicare l'antologia abbiamo bisogno dell'aiuto di tutti: vogliamo che quest'opera sia un libro collettivo, finanziato da chi ci sta attorno, ci segue e ci vuole bene. Abbiamo bisogno di € 1000 per riuscire a stampare le prime 250 copie e donarle durante i nostri reading per far conoscere l'opera che portiamo avanti. Un libro tascabile di circa 150 pagine a colori, al cui interno saranno presenti testi e opere di:

    • Giuditta Giuliano
    • Alessandro D'Orazio
    • Davide Coppolino
    • Matteo Fordiani
    • Antonio Merola
    • Antonio Romagnoli
    • Judith Baldo
    • Elisa Durbano
    • Michele Di Giuseppe
    • Lorena Florio
    • Lucia Buricelli
    • Francesco Frizzera
    • Andrea Gatopoulos
    • Marco Crispano
    • Emanuele Di Felice

    Con un'edizione semplice e bella da sfogliare curata da Andrea Gatopoulos, con l'assistenza di Antonio Romagnoli, pubblicheremo un libro fresco, nuovo, una lettura giovane, da portare con sé per un viaggio nella nostra epoca.


      Cosa daremo in cambio

      Non donerete a vuoto. Abbiamo intenzione di garantirvi, con una donazione di € 10, una copia firmata dell'antologia, nonché un ringraziamento nei crediti della versione stampata.  E se vorrete donare di più, o di meno, a lato troverete la nostra ricompensa e i nostri più sentiti ringraziamenti.

        Cosa succede dopo la pubblicazione

        Una volta pubblicata la nostra antologia, partiremo con un tour di reading nelle grandi città italiane: la porteremo nelle biblioteche, nelle piazze e nei teatri in giro per l'Italia. Una marcia di bellezza, per noi e per tutti gli altri. 

        Qualunque sia il tuo contributo a quest'opera, grazie.

story:
Story of My Book

Hidden Curriculum explores educational inequality by interrogating the "hidden curriculum," the collection of norms, knowledge and behaviors that are rewarded in the American educational system. The book explores how this curriculum is learned (or not), how it can reinforce and create barriers for underrepresented students, and how these dynamics influence students' sense of belonging and achievement. In particular, I'm exploring the role of youth development  organizations in teaching, translating, and shaping the hidden curriculum to students who might not otherwise learn it. 

My name is Andrew Maguire and I am the author of Hidden Curriculum. I wrote this book because I wanted to tell the story of youth development organizations' efforts to decode the hidden curriculum, something that remains overlooked and under-recognized.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that there is in fact a hidden curriculum in America and that the manifestation of that curriculum reinforces barriers to equal education for underrepresented students. I hope it offers an opportunity for reflection, whether you are an administrator of a youth development organization, a young person navigating these institutions, or a community member eager to fight for a more inclusive society. 

In this book, you'll learn about educational inequality and the challenging dynamics it raises in youth development work. You'll hear stories such as...
  • The efforts by one young educator to reform public speaking trainings to harness the lived experiences and unique voices of young students of color
  • The successes and struggles of young alumni of prestigious college prep and academic enrichment programs
  • The inclusive approach of one college prep organization in Chicago to build positive racial and ethnic identity among middle school students with high academic potential. 
Hidden Curriculum is a nonfiction book that speaks to anyone that wants to look at education in a new way. 
 

The Book - Hidden Curriculum

The book is written in 3 parts:

  • Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. These chapters will orient readers both to the idea of the hidden curriculum and to different models in youth development. 
  • Part 2 contains chapters 4-7. In this part, I’ll dig into the ways the hidden curriculum shows up in the college admissions process, the development of a college-going culture, and in both the academic and social spheres on college campuses. 
  • Part 3 contains chapters 8-11 + the conclusion. Here I’ll illustrate four prevailing tensions in the work of youth development organizations and reflect on how they can best support young people in unlocking life-changing opportunities.
     

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in Spring 2021
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and final title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Andrew Maguire is a youth development leader and non-profit strategist who currently supports partnerships at UNICEF USA. In 2018, Andrew was selected as a Luce Scholar and helped launch the undergraduate program at Fulbright University Vietnam in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. 

Andrew wrote this book to learn more about educational access in the U.S., given his professional experience working with youth from other countries. In writing this book, he hopes to continue necessary dialogue around how to bring equity and inclusion to America’s broken education system.

When not working or writing, Andrew is constantly on the hunt for the world’s best bagel (the current top contender is Brooklyn Bagel Company). He has been known to trap people in hours-long conversations about the topic at parties.

For more information, you can connect with Andrew at andrew.maguire22@gmail.com and at @muchadoandrew on Instagram or LinkedIn.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HiddenCurriculum and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Andrew Maguire

story:
Hey friends,

This is Adam Gnade. I'm raising funds to reprint my book The Do-It-Yourself Guide to Fighting the Big Motherfuckin' Sad. Pioneers Press described my book this way:

"This book is Gnade's self-described 'anti-depression guide/guide to a freer, more lawless life.' Gnade's writing looks at the root causes of sadness, anxiety, and general malaise/boredom and offers helpful point-by-point suggestions (in list form) and short essay pep-talks on how to move beyond your demons for a better, smarter, happier life. Like a letter from a trusted friend in the trenches, The Do-It-Yourself Guide to Fighting the Big Motherfuckin' Sad will work with you through all phases of your life, thick and thin."

I get letters and emails every day from people telling me how the book saved them when they were in a really bad place and I'd hate for the thing to go out of print. (There are 40 copies left of the original print run so by the time you read this I imagine those will be gone.)  Update: the book is now out of print.

The more of these we can make the more people we can help.

I'd hate for someone to need this and not be able to get to it. When I was at my worst, in my deepest depression, I needed a book like this pretty bad and I didn't find it. That's why I wrote the book--for those people who need something like this, the people that traditional "self-help" (read: platitudes, new age-y crap, corny as hell) doesn't speak to. Those are my people and those are the people this book is for.

Let's save Big Sad!

Thanks for reading,

-Adam Gnade

PS. You can read more about the book and see some reviews over here.

What We Need & What You'll Get

Basically, we need $1,500 to print 1,500 copies. If we get more we'll print more. We work with a really great printer in Michigan and the way it works with them is the more you print the cheaper it gets. My big dream is to be able to print enough to not worry about reprints for the next year or so, but 1,500 is a-ok by me. That would be totally solid.

If you donate to this campaign you'll get the book and a whole array of cool perks (new collections of writing, other books of mine, lifetime subscriptions to everything I release for the rest of my life, readings in your living room, etc) over the course of the next 30 days. Got a lot of surprises in store.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money there are other ways to help. You can tell someone you love about the campaign, post about it on your Facebook, write a tumblr post. Really, anything helps!

story:
Hep make my new novel  available to the people whose culture it celebrates, by supporting the publication of a Hispanic (Spanish language) edition of  'The Ghost Who Wouldn't Give Up'. The story is illustrated and draws on the rich history of Mexico, its native traditions and pre-colombian past. 

30% of  the revenues of the Hispanic edition (e-and print versions) will be channeled to  one or more of the  indigenous  solidarity movements  in  Mexico (please contact me).


The  first edition in English will be issued on the first of May,  under the publishing imprint, inkistan.com

This cat rules my friends...

 

 

Of all the 58 illustrations in the novel  this  drawing best encapsulates the story...

 

 

 'A little bus, ascends a cobbled road towards a pueblo fantasmos...' 


The  Mexican pueblo fantasmos where I lived for about a year and which provided the setting for much of this tale,  is a real place, but shall remain nameless. I had gone there to write another novel, but was drawn into a quest  for a treasure which had  brought cycles  of  destruction down on the once populous town, most recently when many buildings were dynamited by prospectors after  the treasure, in the immediate post revolutionary period. The town was old even in European terms, and dated back to the late  15th century,  if not before. Only the cathedral had escaped unscathed,  but housed darker secrets, and was built on an ancient mound, indicating the  importance of the site long before the Spanish Conquest of Mexico. The  only way in was by a mile long  tunnel, hewn through a mountain peak, one of three which concealed the town from the world. From the high chapparal  far below,  the conical mountains loomed like  three witches hats, and their native names,  suggested a connection to an ancient legend, concerning a sacred  garden  and a mythical treasure  that had been sought for thousands of years, from both sides of the Atlantic. 

That quest, how I got out of it and  lived to tell the tale, and my  researches  into the background of the  legendary ‘Treasure of the Sierra Madre, formed the basis of  this novel.

 But first I had write the other story  -  why I came to the town in the first place.

 

 

(WHO IS WILL LORIMER? PART #1....)

Though  completing the novel was a personal breakthrough, unfortunately its publication  coincided with an Australian media  magnate taking a major stake in my London publishers. The novel  was a satirical account of a journey across Australian Outback, and in it I returned the traditional Aussie  welcome extended to 'poms' in spades.  Perhaps the  new owner didn’t get the joke, but  for  whatever  reason the launch party was cancelled at the last minute, and my novel was never reviewed, or  distributed, other than to a few bookshops in Notting  Hill near the offices of the publishing company. Even so the  first and last edition sold well and more importantly went on to become at least  a couple of readers'  favourite book. But as a fledgling author I could have done without my  writing career  being blacked before it really got going. However I suppose  that  was a backhanded compliment, considering what that  media magnate and his ilk  stands for. But though the rejections  piled up in  the years following,  I kept writing, and plotting my revenge. 

(More on that  in WHO IS WILL LORIMER #2.)

I have recently rewritten the story.  It is one of  three novels which my putative publishing empire of Inkistan.com, will  issue after the 'Ghost Who Wouldn't Give up is published in early May.

Here are the  covers of those three novels.

  And this one is a real...

 

and this one is the last for now...

 

 

If the campaign surpasses the  goal of funding a Spanish Language e- and print book, the  excess will go towards the editing costs of the other three novels, and establishing inkistan.com as a fiercely  independent publishing imprint.


'A little bus, ascends a cobbled road towards a pueblo fantasmos...'  

Yea, ok, enough of that for the moment. You want to know about  all those marvellous rewards  I went to perkistan to create for  you.

 I shall call this next section 'PHANTASTIC PERKS' (thanks John)

The ultimate perk is this artwork which  features on the cover of 'The Ghost Who Wouldn't Give Up'. The skull was inspired by the  Art of Ancient Mexico.


A note about the exotic glass which facets the outside and  the inside of  the skull.  This is a special dichroic glass which I was granted the exclusive use of by  the company which manufactured it. The company no longer exists. The glass which is coated with layers of gold, platinium and other  precious metals  was designed for use in deep space and, depending on the  point of view, splits the light into complimentary colours, and a mirror phase. It is  99.9% reflective, which is approximately 10% more than conventional mirror. 


This next artwork  and video has a poem to go with it:

Just an old stone god/ a plastic reproduction actually/ the son of a son/ last of a line/like me actually/ plastic/ yet retaining form/ in contemporary society.







The penultimate perk, 'The Skull of Time'  is, as the name suggests,  about Time - our perpetual enemy that never sleeps, or rests, and is always  marking down our days in incremental ticks. In the Ghost  Who Wouldn't Give Up,  the Cathedral bell tolls 13 at midday and  midnight, reminding the population of the pueblo fantasmos that time in the Town  is organized according to the Aztec system - thirteen hours for  the day, and thirteen at night.




.
The Skull of Time revolves and can be used  for divination. Yes, no  or maybe, depending on which way the skull ends up after it's given a spin. It is a very handy skull, given all the question life poses on a daily basis.
.

The next perk,  Bob the Demon, is named  after a character  we meet in the Aztec Underworld of Mictlan in The Ghost Who Wouldn't Give Up. The sculpture is  constructed from ebony,  a fast food container,  and dichroic glass.

 




Achieve instant fame with this next perk and  be an instant celebrity, on the catwalk, on the beach,  clothed or unclothed. Wearing just these unique designer sunglasses customized by the author, you'll command attention wherever you are.

This next perk, The Star of Inkistan Medal, is only   awarded for outstanding contributions to the  Republic of Ink.  Only 1 medal  will be awarded. The recipient  will be elevated to the rank of  Knight Commander of Inkistan,   the Highest  Order of the Republic of Ink. Knights  of Inkistan are charged with protecting  the Republic from media  Corporations.  A certificate  of authenticity accompanies  this  medal.





The next perk 'Temple in Inkistan' is in the characteristic  style of the folk art of Inkistan. Though  the Republic  officially recognizes no creed other than  the  freedom to practice ones personal belief,  the rural landscape  is dotted with charming temples which are dedicated to local deities associated with nature worship. This Temple is dedicated to the  frog spirit of green meadows which  in that region of Inkistan    are particularly lush and  in the summer months resound with the call of the Greater  Greenback Frog  in the early  morning.


The next perk, 'Lightning Strikes',  is inset with  dichroic glass, and  can be worn as jewellery or suspended  in a window. It is  both an invocation of divine inspiration  and a talisman protecting against lightning, which  in the Tartas Mountains of Inkistan is a common occurrence.  


Continuing the Mexican/Inkistan themed perks. Next on offer are 2 deamonkins. The one on the left, is Mexican, and the one on the right Inkistan. They are very friendly demons and bestow luck on whoever wears them.  The Mexican deamonkin is a pendant and the Inkistan deamonkin a brooch. Despite their different provenance, they are a pair.



Because this novel, is partly about Doubles,’ my first perk, like all the rest, includes a mystery perk. It might be a unique set of facebook covers to personalize your page, featuring illustrations in the novel,  a desk ornament and work of art by the author, or chameleon  colour changing  jewellery like this handsome pair of earrings which



 one lucky female supporter is about to get; or a postcard with a signed print and a big thank you from the author. Every supporter buying one perk, will get another, which may or may not be be more valuable than the first.

.

For $1 you will get  a coupon with which to download the e-book from smashwords.com



For $5 you will get 14  facebook covers to suit your every mood and project it onto an unsuspecting world, on a daily basis. 

'One Door closes and another opens'.






The Strange homes of Mr & Mrs Camouflage....


Or, 'Bedouin for the Night'.


One for every mood,  to share  with your friends how you're feeling  on a day to day basis, and  celebrate  this crazy life ...


and now, as promised,  WHO IS WILL LORIMER? #2

 

 

OK, I know, as an answer  it seems a bit of a cop-out, but then you haven't read the novel yet...  Plenty meat in that pie, my friends...

story:
A Skeptic's Search for Spiritual Truth


I have been studying philosophy, religion, and spirituality independently for about twelve years now. Over the years, my journey has taken me down many paths, including pantheism, Taoism, Zen, Hegelian dialectic, eclecticism, Hindu and Buddhist traditions, and many more.


In "Light & Logic," I will finally reveal the startling results of my long quest to unite Western rationality with Eastern mysticism. In its pages, the reader will be skillfully guided through the opposing ideas and arguments which have occupied my mind for over a decade - as well as their resolutions.


Tackling the Tough Questions in New Ways


In the book, readers will discover:


  • What "God" is (and isn't), and how to "find God" through the only path consistent with rational thinking (and you'll never guess what this path is).

  • How two unwieldy and obscure words, "transcendental noncognitivism," can forever change your view of reality and spirituality.

  • What logic really is, and the logical limitations of logic. How and why it's logical to go beyond logic, and more importantly, when.

  • Why we're here, according to the only line of reasoning that can withstand every challenge. You can read this in the ancient Vedic texts, but not in simple English.

  • The simplest and most universal code of ethics, consistent with both rationality and spirituality - and how to apply it. Hint: it's not the Golden Rule.

  • The two key aspects of authentic spiritual practice - and neither one involves going to church or trying to "convert" anyone to your beliefs.

  • A totally new view of the human soul without the many philosophical and scientific problems of previous models. You'll be shocked at how much sense this makes.

  • The nature of intuition, its relation to space, time, and ultimate reality, and how it can be compatible with rational thought (if correctly approached).

  • Logical truth about the "afterlife," death, and other end-of-life questions. Did you know you'll never be dead? If not, you need to read this chapter.

  • The true nature of the ego and its real extent and influence in daily life. Many writers don't get anywhere near the truth of this, and it's essential.

  • The true nature of consciousness - what it is, and what this knowledge means to you. How to conceptualize (and better yet, de-conceptualize) consciousness.

  • The role of every skeptic's least favorite word, "faith," in spiritual thought and practice - and how to embrace a faith that doesn't put your brain behind bars.

  • And many more startling insights, any one of which could potentially permanently change the way you look at the world, as well as how you function within it.

A Revolutionary Book

Regardless of where and how it is published, "Light & Logic" will be a revolutionary book for those who struggle to integrate a sense of spirituality with the strict demands of rationality. I have always resolved that unless I was ready to write a book with real impact, I would not set pen to paper.


Your role, as IndieGoGo backers, is to help me obtain sufficient funds to contact publishers, promote the book, and take care of various costs that will arise during the process. As a person on a fixed income, even the smallest costs are prohibitive to me. Costs might include a variety of fees and expenses.


My funding goal is modest, but with some luck and a little skill, it ought to be sufficient. Writing will commence when funding is complete. Please remember, funding can continue even if the goal is reached, so don't be afraid to pledge "too much." Don't be afraid to pledge too little, either. Everything helps.


Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Nia King and I am a queer, mixed-race art activist.
  • In March, I started a podcast (called We Want the Airwaves) where I interview queer and transgender artists of color about how they got where they are in their careers. The idea was to inform and inspire up-and-coming artists using art as a tool for social change.
  • Now I am working on turning the interview transcriptions into a book, e-book, and zine. Please help me make this collection of funny, heartwarming, and heart-wrenching stories available to the masses. Artists featured include poet Ryka Aoki, illustrator Julio Salgado, and burlesque performer Magnoliah Black!

What I Need & What You Get

This summer I've been working on the podcast 20-40 hours a week. I'm looking at different ways of monetizing the podcast to make it financially sustainable moving forward. In the meantime, I'm running this indiegogo campaign so I can:

  • Break even for the out-of-pocket expenses of running the podcast,
  • Pay the people that are helping me transcribe and edit the interviews, and
  • Publish a book of the interviews, so that even if I do burn out, there will be evidence of all the hard work I have done for the past six months.

In exchange for your support, there are a number of perks you can claim including:

  • an exclusive autographed hardcover edition of the book,
  • exclusive behind-the-scenes audio content,
  • and advice on how to increase your own visibility as an art activist.

The Impact

When I wrote my thesis on QTPOC (queer and trans people of color's) art activism in 2010, there were very few books about it. The librarian even suggested I might have better luck searching terms like "homosexual" and "Negro" rather than "queer" and "people of color." I'd like to change that. The purpose of this project is three-fold.

  • Archive the stories of queer and trans artists of color so they are not forgotten.
  • Make those stories available to future scholars interested in QTPOC art activism.
  • Spread the message that art is activism, and that queer and trans people of color's stories matter!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Download the podcast here or on iTunes.
  • Leave a comment here (moral support goes a long way) or leave a nice review on iTunes.
  • Share the podcast with your friends (using the Twitter or FB buttons here).
  • After you've listened to the podcast, take this quick survey.
  • Buy the zine/e-book/print book when they come out this fall.

Thank you to everyone who has supported to podcast thus far, all the guests, listeners, donors, re-tweeters, and transcribers. I couldn’t have gotten this far without all of your support. <3

story:
Once upon a time there was a young woman who had come to an impasse. She could not decide whether to go forward or backward. No matter which way she turned, it appeared to her to be the wrong way. But by what standard of right and wrong, she could not say. She was lost, suspended in a fog.  Although bewildered by her predicament, she was determined to act as if everything were okay. For who could she tell? Who would understand? Who would even believe her?

And so it was that she found herself at the mercy of strangers. Not benevolent strangers, mind you. Nevertheless, she took a step, moving at least in some direction, danger be damned. For she was not accustomed to standing still—doing nothing. She had fought too long, too hard to just give up. Hopelessness had tried to cut off her wings, but only the tips of her feathers had been snipped. A temporary situation, she thought. As soon as she could get some rest, she'd find her way.

Yes, she'd be fine--she was sure of it. Just like she had always been sure that if she acted courageously she could break through walls. After all, bravery demanded faith. Faith was everything. Wasn't it? Or was she just living in denial? At what point had the ground underneath her feet disappeared? While things collapsed around her, could her charade of optimistic equilibrium that knew no fear, no grief, no regret—last?...

                                                      * * * * * *

Artist, Rita Kearns is having a near breakdown when the story opens. Her life is in shambles after a break-up with her female lover and loss of her second job, the one she counts on to make ends meet for herself and her child. To make matters worse, she thinks her apartment might be haunted. Eerie voices and strange dreams keep her up at night. She hasn't slept in weeks. Now, she must figure out how to get help without appearing crazy. But she is not the only ones having odd dreams. There are other characters in the story, each trying to resolve unusual dilemmas in their lives. Are the clues in her art, paintings of imaginary people she has created, but does not know?

Bleed Through is a novel for all who have questioned the nature of reality, of fate, of destiny, for whom “the big picture” is sometimes elusive, but obsessively seductive. It is a story of a courageous heroine, Rita, stigmatized by the judgmental conformity and stereotypes of the 1950's. And it is also the story of three other equally compelling characters and their families—from 1801 to 2000 in America. Each character's story, affected by gender, sexual identity and ethnicity within the historical period in which live, seem to have no connection to one another at first. Gradually however, the threads of their lives intertwine and a startling tapestry emerges.

In Bleed Through, you are sure to find that characters with whom you resonate. If you are waiting for a novel that surprises and touches you, while it confronts prejudice subliminally but powerfully, you might like this book. If you are LGBT or heterosexual, a parent or grandparent,  an artist, a teacher, social worker, nurse, doctor, scientist, spiritualist, administrator, union worker...a good read awaits you.  If you like passionate characters, romance, life and death conflicts, suspense and consequence, with mystical twists and turns for good measure-- you'll enjoy this story.  Like a happy ending? You got it. Bleed Through is fast-paced and easy to read--a page-turner that may just be your next favorite novel!

Your help will get this riveting, timely novel into the world and to your door (or computer.) After years of hard work, the manuscript is finished! I will apply your valuable support to pay the editor, as well as pay for formatting, cover design, publication and promotion costs.

I am so grateful for your support. If you cannot contribute financially yourself, you can still participate in this campaign--help me get the word out to your friends and community. Together we can make a difference.

Once upon a time there was a young woman who had come to an impasse. She could not decide whether to go forward or backward. No matter which way she turned, it appeared to her to be the wrong way. But by what standard of right and wrong, she could not say. She was lost, suspended in a fog.  Although bewildered by her predicament, she was determined to act as if everything were okay. For who could she tell? Who would understand? Who would even believe her?
And so it was that she found herself at the mercy of strangers. Not benevolent strangers, mind you. Nevertheless, she took a step, moving at least in some direction, danger be damned. For she was not accustomed to standing still—doing nothing. She had fought too long, too hard to just give up. Hopelessness had tried to cut off her wings, but only the tips of her feathers had been snipped. A temporary situation, she thought. As soon as she could get some rest, she'd find her way.
Yes, she'd be fine--she was sure of it. Just like she had always been sure that if she acted courageously she could break through walls. After all, bravery demanded faith. Faith was everything. Wasn't it? Or was she just living in denial? At what point had the ground underneath her feet disappeared? While things collapsed around her, could her charade of optimistic equilibrium that knew no fear, no grief, no regret—last?...
